Title: FMCG Production Supervisor
Description:
Company Description
Global Food Investments (GFI) is a premier agricultural investment and consulting group specializing in farm development, factory construction, and global frozen fruit distribution. With a focus on quality and advanced agri-tech management, the company operates across strategic global markets, delivering consistent and scalable production. GFI's expertise includes end-to-end cold chain engineering, frozen produce export, particularly IQF strawberries, and vertical integration across all strawberry formats. Supporting over 8,000 team members, GFI is committed to expanding Egyptâ€™s presence in the global produce market through innovative solutions and long-term value creation.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site role for a FMCG Production Supervisor based in 10th of Ramadan. The Production Supervisor will oversee daily operations at the production facility, ensuring smooth workflow, adherence to quality standards, and efficient resource management. Responsibilities include supervising production teams, implementing safety and process protocols, maintaining equipment, monitoring productivity, and addressing any operational challenges. Collaboration with quality and supply chain teams to meet production targets will also be a key part of the role.
Qualifications
Experience in production management and team supervision in the FMCG or food manufacturing industry
Proficiency in process optimization, quality assurance, and adherence to safety standards
Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills
Knowledge of cold-chain operations and food safety regulations is an advantage
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Food Technology, Industrial Engineering, or a related field is preferred
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, on-site environment
Proficiency in using ERP software and production planning tools

Title: Market Research Executive
Program Manager - EMEA
Description:
We are hiring a Program Manager to drive selection and pricing programs that shape a high-performing quick commerce offering. In this role, you will own end-to-end initiatives to optimize assortment relevance, pricing competitiveness, and item-level profitability. You will work cross-functionally to build scalable mechanisms, close performance gaps, and improve unit economics. The role has direct impact on customer experience, margin improvement, and sustainable business growth.
About us
NOK Human Capital is a leading HR consulting and talent acquisition firm with a global footprint and a proven track record of supporting Fortune 500 clients. We specialize in connecting top-tier talent with industry leaders, driving innovation, and fostering high-performance cultures across the MENA region and beyond.
Key Responsibilities
Define and optimize core selection strategies across categories to drive relevance, coverage, and topline growth.
Build scalable onboarding processes for new selection in partnership with cross-functional teams to ensure rapid activation and readiness.
Analyze and improve item-level profitability by identifying low-margin SKUs and recommending pricing or cost actions.
Lead pricing programs using competitive benchmarks, elasticity analysis, and contribution metrics to balance customer value and margin.
Monitor assortment gaps at store and category level and coordinate actions to improve depth and availability.
Develop mechanisms, tools, and dashboards to automate pricing actions and scale selection curation.
Track key retail and financial KPIs, identify performance gaps, and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, Economics, Engineering, or a related field.
3â€“5+ years of experience in program management, category management, retail buying, vendor management, or a similar role.
Demonstrated experience managing selection growth, pricing strategy, or commercial programs.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret large datasets and drive data-backed decisions.
Experience working cross-functionally with commercial, marketing, operations, or supply chain teams.
Proficiency in Excel; working knowledge of SQL or data visualization tools is an advantage.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver results in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.

Title: Center Quality Assurance Specialist (Helwan)
Description:
JOB OBJECTIVE
To perform Quality Assurance functions to ensure compliance with internal and external regulations and protocol under the direct supervision of the Center Quality Manager (CQM).
To edit SOPs related to processes at donor center level following the guidelines established according to Egyptian regulations and the guidelines established according to cGMP requirements.
Key Responsibilities
To perform periodical review of DC records.
To perform periodical equipment quality control review.
To perform periodical review of equipment incident logs.
To verify and release of sample shipments.
To inspect and release of incoming supplies.
To perform periodical employee observations.
To assist to CQM to ensure cGMP regulations are followed.
To assist to CQM to ensure that SOPs are followed.
To assist to CQM in the edition of SOPs.
To perform a review of the documentation of unsuitable test results and the disposition of the associated units.
Academic Experience Required
Bachelor's Degree in Health-related Sciences.
Knowledge in Quality Management
Strong integrity and commitment to quality and compliance
Professional Experience Required
Preferably at least 2 years of experience in a similar position, in environments of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Pharma background.
Computing Skills
MS Office knowledge
Personal Skills
Ability to understand, explain, follow and enforce SOPs, protocols and other regulatory guidelines.
Ability and willingness to study specific activities, in a short time.
Accuracy and reliability.
Can work independently, excellent organizational skills, and attention to detail.
Performs a higher-level document review and employee observations
Ability to work in groups and with other departments.
Communicates openly with CQM on issues noted during reviews and is able to give suggestions for corrections.
Has a good understanding of cGMP and quality systems.
Good ability to identify problems and propose solutions.
Adherence to the Grifols skills and values.
LANGUAGES
Written and spoken English and Arabic.

Title: Assistant Store Manager
Description:
Company Description
Brandhouse, part of Al Mansi Group for Commercial Agencies, specializes in manufacturing luxury formal attire with innovative designs that reflect the latest fashion trends. Established in 1998, Brandhouse opened its first store in Turkey in 2001, followed by expansions into Russia and Egypt. The companyâ€™s commitment to using 100% Turkish-made materials ensures exceptional quality for customers seeking sophistication and luxury. By combining talented fashion designers and high-quality materials, Brandhouse caters to diverse tastes, delivering stylish and elegant formalwear for its customers.
Key Responsibilities:
- Supervise and support the daily operations of the store.
- Lead and motivate the sales team to achieve monthly sales targets.
- Assist in staff performance monitoring and provide coaching when needed.
- Ensure a high standard of customer service is maintained at all times.
- Handle customer complaints and resolve issues professionally.
- Monitor stock levels and coordinate with the Store Manager for reordering.
- Prepare daily/weekly sales and performance reports.
- Train and onboard new team members.
- Ensure commercial requests, including transfers in/out, are processed in a timely manner.
- Plan, organize, and manage time efficiently to meet store objectives.
- Foster a positive and culturally aware work environment.
Requirements:
- Minimum of 3 years' experience in classic fashion retail in a similar role. Strong leadership and team management skills.
- Excellent decision-making and problem-solving abilities.
- Outstanding time management, planning, and organizational skills.
- Professional appearance and attention to detail.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Flexibility and adaptability to work in dynamic environments and handle various customer profiles.
- Solid commercial understanding and awareness of retail business drivers.
- Cultural awareness and the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and customers.
Additional Benefits:
- Competitive salary package
- Health insurance and social insurance
- Professional and inspiring work environment
- Opportunities for career growth and promotion.

Title: Solution Engineer
Description:
Job Summary
At Sumerge, Solution Engineers (Technical Sales) design and deliver tailored solutions that help clients stay ahead of industry trends. Partnering closely with Sales and Engineering, they translate customer needs into scalable outcomes while ensuring smooth adoption and measurable business value.
Our ideal candidate has a strong background in software development, pre-sales, or solution design, with solid knowledge of web technologies. They are collaborative communicators who thrive at the intersection of technology and business, guiding clients through their digital transformation journey with confidence and clarity.
Key Responsibilities
Own the technical consulting process for assigned clients by assessing both expressed and hidden needs, recommending fit-for-purpose solutions, and coordinating follow-up support to ensure long-term success
Guide customers through their digital transformation journey by simplifying technology adoption, addressing potential technical roadblocks, and reinforcing Sumerge's role as a trusted partner
Contribute to the design and recommendation of enterprise architectures and platforms using Sumerge technologies to deliver scalable, efficient, and business-aligned solutions
Collaborate with product management and engineering teams to stay informed on industry trends and provide client-driven insights that help shape solution enhancements and maintain competitiveness
Work closely with the Sales team to uncover and pursue new opportunities within existing accounts, strengthening client relationships and supporting revenue growth
Deliver clear, structured, and engaging technical presentations and demos that combine solution capabilities with relevant industry knowledge to build client confidence and enable informed decisions
Own the preparation of proposals and responses to RFPs, RFIs, and RFQs by producing accurate, compelling, and customer-aligned technical content that improves win rates
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or related field
Experience in solution engineering, pre-sales, or technical consulting; Banking, Telecom, or Government sector exposure a plus
Strong knowledge of software development and web technologies
Excellent communication and presentation skills in English; Arabic speakers preferred
Collaborative, client-focused, and strong in problem-solving
Skilled in preparing proposals and technical documents
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education

Title: Project Engineer
Description:
Who are we and what we stand for?
Schneiderâ€™s purpose is to create Impact by empowering all to make the most of our energy and resources, bridging progress and sustainability for all. At Schneider, we call this Life Is On.
Mission:
This position is accountable for managing Small/medium scale Customer project orders, from start to finish, so that it is completed on time and within budget. This includes initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing of customer projects/programs.
Under section head supervision this position confirms customer requirements, which includes drawings, specifications, job site requirements, bill of material alignment with specifications & clarify exceptions.
Manage complete job process from order preparation, thru manufacturing release, product shipment, post shipment support.
What will you do?
Use tools to prepare cost, schedule, scope, quality, risk,procurement communication management plans.
Monitor and control project progress performance throughout project lifecycle, obtain, verify deliverables, attend status meeting, provide performance and status reports, forecast project completion schedule, budget, Configuration management, tracking project updates and modifications.
Lead the closeout of the project to include financial reconciliation, verification of job site equipment arrival,installation, start-up, and training support completion through review of internal system information,contact with the customer, and coordination with support services such as field services, after-shipment support, and training functions.
Validate project performance against target profitability.
Assist in project statement of work developing including technical & commercial terms, identify project scope,project constrains and customer expectations, major risks.
Provide technical & commercial offers after understanding & interpreting customer specifications/drawings.
Understand, analyze, document, and communicate contractual, technical and commercial terms and conditions relative to the company standard.
What qualifications will make you successful for this role?
Bachelor degree of Electrical or Power engineering.
Relevant 3 years of experience in Project Managememt.
PMP Certificate is preffered.
Excellent commend of English.
Proffessional user of Microsoft Office.
Working with team.
Adhering to the principals & values.
Learning & Researching.
Adapting and responding to change.
Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?
When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that ourÂ  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
â‚¬36 billion global revenue
+13% organic growth
150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
#1 on the Global 100 Worldâ€™s most sustainable corporations
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and â€˜inclusionâ€™ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.
At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here
Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Graphic Designer
Description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer to develop visually compelling designs that support branding, marketing, and communication objectives. The ideal candidate will transform concepts into engaging visual assets across digital and print platforms while maintaining brand consistency.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop creative designs for digital and print materials (social media, websites, brochures, presentations, advertisements).
Create and maintain brand guidelines and ensure consistency across all visual materials.
Collaborate with marketing, content, and business teams to translate ideas into effective visual designs.
Design social media creatives, banners, infographics, and marketing campaigns.
Prepare final artwork for production and printing.
Revise designs based on feedback and ensure timely delivery.
Stay up to date with design trends, tools, and best practices.
Qualifications & Skills:
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field (preferred).
Proven experience as a Graphic Designer or in a similar role.
Strong portfolio showcasing creative and professional design work.
Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign (After Effects is a plus).
Good understanding of typography, color theory, and layout.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Attention to detail and creative thinking.
Experience:
2â€“5 years of relevant experience (can be adjusted based on seniority).

Title: Manager - Aviation Security
Description:
Job Purpose
Nominated as the â€œPost Holderâ€, the Aviation Security Manager is the approved party by the ECAA to lead and manage the Air Arabia identified civil aviation security measures as per Egypt and in adherence with corresponding ECAA regulations in the Foreign States. He/she shall ensure that all security measures are implemented, communicated, assessed and complied with at all times.
Key Responsibilities
Defines and develops Air Arabiaâ€™s security policies and procedures and related manuals to be validated by the Chief Executive Officer all in accordance with ECAA rules and regulation pertaining to this function and in accordance with Companyâ€™s overall policies, procedures and security objectives.
Partners with Stakeholders to: review and assess the Companyâ€™s assets, facilities, equipment and activities to identify security needs and threats; develops necessary security measures to eliminate risk and enhance security; implements approved measures and communicates accordingly.
Develops/ amends the â€œAircraft Operator Security Programâ€ for Air Arabia, ensuring its compliance with the the aviation authorities (ECAA) in the respective areas of operation. Maintains a current and up-to-date â€œAOSPâ€ endorsed by Senior Management prior ECAA review and acceptance.
Evaluates, reviews and conducts inspections to encourage internal security audit and quality control practices and ensure the effectiveness of the â€œAircraft Operator Security Programâ€. Advises on and manages all security systems in use by Air Arabia ensuring the cooperation of line managers.
Assists in the management, develops, and implements operations security standards and procedures in accordance to national/international aviation security legislations ensuring maximum security measures are taken to safeguard passengers, crew, staff and property without any compromise on those measures caused by break-down of Air Arabiaâ€™s Security Management System.
Manages the selection, performance and evaluation of the right manpower to deliver standardized and approved security measures for Air Arabia in Egypt and Foreign States; ensures the availability of competent security officers, to manage the security checks as per adopted procedures at all times.
Creates â€œCultural Awarenessâ€ of the set of security measures and standards approved for the Company through initiating and managing â€œAwareness Campaignsâ€ and through educating security staff and all other employees on how to implement those measures and adhere to corresponding regulations.
Initiates and manages additional security measures during periods of increased risk and/or for specific flights and routes as needed whilst maintaining familiarity with applicable aviation security-related legislations and regulations in all the geographic areas operated by Air Arabia.
Ensures an effective risk analysis, threat assessment and response capability; develops, publishes and records policies to counter the threats and risks in accordance with International Governmental requirements and advises managers on implementation accordingly.
Investigates criminal activities and malpractice whilst maintaining records of the same and of any un-authorized weapons or suspect explosive devices detected on Air Arabia aircraft or on property used by Air Arabia.
Qualifications (Academic & Language)
Bachelor degree in Management/Aviation or equivalent; alternately a diploma or certificate in the related field from a recognized university or institute combined with needed experience and exposure.
Must have attended Appropriate Government/ IATA Aviation Security Course for Security Managers.
Must have completed investigations/Interview techniques courses including techniques in detection of forged travel documents and passengers profiling.
Skilled report writing is required to ensure that complex reports are properly and clearly described.
Professional membership of associations related to the Aviation/Airlines industry is a plus.
Project Management certificate or alternately the proven corresponding working experience is a must.
Cost Control, Compliance, Audit and Quality Assurance certificates and trainings are an added value.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Very good in English
Work Experience
7+ yearsâ€™ of experience in the Aviation/Airlines industry, 5 years of which in Aviation Security in a similar capacity; 3 years at least in the training field is required for this role.
A sound knowledge of Government Immigration Acts, Police & Criminal Evidence Acts.
Has extensive exposure on CAA particularly ECAA; familiar with all rules and regulations of ECAA pertaining to the Aviation Security , policies, procedures, manuals, etc.
Good exposure on investigation procedures.
A very good knowledge and exposure on airline and Flight Operations, SGHA contracting formalities and standard regulations; good understanding of Flight crew thought process.
A balanced personality, composed, capable of dealing with threats and emergency cases with focus, analytical thinking, efficiency and commitment to successful safe results.
Very good knowledge and working exposure to Quality Assurance /Safety/Internal & External Audit functions.
Experienced in designing, implementing, and monitoring security policies, procedures and operating manuals.
Proven skills in analyzing data, identifying pitfalls and recommending cost-effective solutions.

Title: Hostess
Description:
Additional Information
Job Number
25196846
Job Category
Rooms & Guest Services Operations
Location
Cairo Marriott Hotel, 16 Saray El Gezira Street, Cairo, Egypt, Egypt, 11211VIEW ON MAP
Schedule
Full Time
Located Remotely?
N
Position Type
Non-Management
Position Summary
Our jobs arenâ€™t just about giving guests a smooth check-in and check-out. Instead, we want to build and experience that is memorable and unique. Our Guest Experience Experts take the initiative to deliver a wide range of services that guide guests through their entire stay. They are empowered to move about their space and do what needs to be done. Whether processing operational needs, addressing guest requests, completing reports, or sharing the highlights of the local area, the Guest Experience Expert makes transactions feel like part of the experience.
No matter what position you are in, there are a few things that are critical to success â€“ creating a safe work place, following company policies and procedures, maintaining confidentiality, protecting company assets, upholding quality standards, and ensuring your uniform, personal appearance, and communications are professional. Guest Experience Experts will be on their feet and moving around (stand, sit, or walk for an extended time) and taking a hands-on approach to work (move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance). Doing all these things well (and other reasonable job duties as requested) is critical for Guest Experience Experts â€“ to get it right for our guests and our business each and every time.
Preferred Qualifications
Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.
Related Work Experience: No related work experience.
Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.
License or Certification: None
At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated.â€¯Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.
Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep the promise of â€œWonderful Hospitality. Always.â€ by delivering thoughtful, heartfelt, forward-thinking service that upholds and builds upon this living legacy. With the name thatâ€™s synonymous with hospitality the world over, we are proud to welcome you to explore a career with Marriott Hotels. In joining Marriott Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International.
Be
where you can do your best work,
begin
your purpose,
belong
to an amazing global team, and
become
the best version of you.
JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 100 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if youâ€™re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brandâ€™s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where youâ€™ll be part of a community and enjoy true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can pursue your passions in a luxury environment with a focus on holistic well-being. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. Thatâ€™s The JW Treatmentâ„¢. In joining JW Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International.
Be
where you can do your best work,
begin
your purpose,

Title: Collection Specialist
Description:
About Us
NowPay (YC W21) is a FinTech startup building a financial-wellness platform for employees in emerging markets. Saving, spending, budgeting and borrowing. Those are the 4 pillars of financial-wellness. NowPay aims to improve every aspect of those for employees by building products that tackle every vertical.
NowPay enables employees to get their salaries in advance at any point in time during the month and also pay their bills instantly. NowPay is backed by YCombinator, 500 Startups, BECO Capital, Global Ventures, Endure, Plug and Play, MSA Capital, 4dx, Foundation Ventures, EFG and Beltone.
Job Description
Make outbound collection calls professionally while keeping and improving customer relations.
Monitor accounts on a daily basis.
Collect users' payments in accordance with payment due dates.
Identify issues attributing to account delinquency and discuss them with management.
Review and monitor assigned accounts and all applicable collection reports.
Provide timely follow-up on payment arrangements.
Take action in order to encourage timely payments.
Process payments and refunds.
Maintain all related tasks assigned by the direct manager
Requirements
Excellent communication skills.
Must have attention to detail with an eye for accuracy.
Computer skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred.
Good English.
Minimum Experience 1-3.
Solid experience in collections.
Microsoft Office is a Must.
Benefits
Salary advance, the ability to have access to your salary anytime of the month
Hybrid working environment
Medical insurance.
Social insurance.
Regular perks such as company social and wellbeing-events

Title: Senior Operations Coordinator
Description:
Join Our Team :)
Whether youâ€™re seeking a new challenge in operations or looking to grow your career within a dynamic and supportive work culture, Salahly is the perfect place for you.
We are transforming the home services industry in Egypt â€” and we invite talented coordinators to join our journey.
Weâ€™re not just a company, weâ€™re a family!
We believe in teamwork, respect, and continuous development. Your success is our success.
Who We Are
Salahly is a leading home maintenance and repair service provider known for delivering high-quality, reliable, and efficient solutions to households and businesses.
With a powerful presence in Upper Egypt and a strong expansion strategy, we are reshaping how customers access home services by connecting them with skilled and trusted technicians.
Job Title:
Senior Operations Coordinator
Department:
Operations (Technicians + Customer Service)
Reports To:
Upper Egypt â€“ COO
Job Location:
Assiut Governorate â€“ Upper Egypt
What Will You Doâ“
As a Senior Operations Coordinator, you will play a key role in running and improving daily operational performance across the Upper Egypt sector. Your responsibilities include:
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Oversee daily scheduling, dispatching, and job allocation to ensure high service quality.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Support and guide coordinators & technicians to meet service SLAs and operational KPIs.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Monitor daily performance dashboards: SLA, utilization, on-time arrival, FTF, AHT, CSAT/NPS.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Ensure accurate job intake, documentation, follow-up calls, and closure on CRM.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Coordinate with the Operations Manager to manage shift plans, workload balancing, and capacity planning.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Handle escalations from customers and technicians, ensuring quick and effective resolution.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Conduct daily reviews with the ops team; identify gaps and support corrective actions.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Ensure compliance with SOPs, safety procedures, and quality standards in every job.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Track inventory, tools, uniforms, and spare parts movement with full accuracy.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Support onboarding and training of new coordinators and technicians.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Assist in preparing weekly/monthly reports for the Operations Manager.
What Are We Looking Forâ“
Weâ€™re searching for someone who combines operational discipline with strong communication and leadership skills:
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â 2â€“4 years of experience in operations, field services, logistics, or marketplace environments.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Strong background in scheduling, dispatching, and customer coordination.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Experience leading small teams or acting as a focal point for daily operations.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Solid understanding of SLAs, quality metrics, and workforce management.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Tech-savvy: CRM, call systems, spreadsheets, dashboards (Excel/Sheets).
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Strong communication skills in Arabic (English is a plus).
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Problem-solver, organized, patient, and comfortable with field presence when required.
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Background from service-related industries is highly preferred.
What We Offer Youâ—
We believe you will love being part of Salahly!
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Competitive salary + performance-based bonuses
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Social & Medical Insurance
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Career growth pathways as Salahly expands in Upper Egypt
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â A supportive work environment that values innovation and teamwork
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Continuous training programs to grow your technical and leadership skills
Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â An inspiring culture that promotes ownership, learning, and equality
#Operations #Assiut #Upper_Egypt #FieldServices #TeamLeadership #CustomerExperience #SLA #Dispatching #Coordination #Start_Up

Title: Construction Manager - Giza
Description:
Role Purpose
To oversee, coordinate, and manage all on-site construction activities and ensure the project is delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards. The Construction Manager serves as the key point of contact for subcontractors, site staff, and consultants to ensure smooth execution of construction works.
Key Accountabilities
Plan, coordinate, and supervise construction projects from start to finish.
Manage day-to-day site activities including resources, subcontractors, and materials.
Monitor project progress and ensure compliance with construction schedules.
Ensure that all work is carried out in accordance with health and safety regulations.
Coordinate with engineers, architects, consultants, and other project stakeholders.
Prepare and submit project progress reports, site diaries, and quality documentation.
Review and approve method statements, material submittals, and work inspections.
Manage and resolve any site issues, delays, or conflicts that arise during construction.
Ensure project budgets and timelines are maintained and report any variances.
Lead site meetings and maintain open communication with project teams and clients.
Qualifications, Experience, Knowledge & Skills
Bachelorâ€™s degree in civil engineering, Construction Management, or related field.
10+ years of experience in construction management or site supervision.
Strong understanding of construction processes, methods, and industry standards.
Proficient in project management tools and software (e.g., MS Project, Primavera).
Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
Solid knowledge of safety regulations and quality standards.
Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, plans, and specifications.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

Title: Customer Relationship Management Manager
Description:
Role Objectives:
The CRM Manager owns the full customer relationship. This role is responsible for activation, engagement, retention, and resurrection through data-driven lifecycle strategies, automation, personalization, and targeted communication. The role is also responsible for overseeing Breadfastâ€™s loyalty program and referral program. This role will lead a small team, partner closely with Product, Data, and Marketing, and drive measurable incremental revenue through high-impact CRM initiatives.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Build and execute the end-to-end lifecycle strategy across all user stages.
Develop automated journeys, triggers, and experiments to improve activation, engagement, and retention.
Manage CRM tooling, segmentation, automation logic, and message orchestration.
Drive personalization and continuous A/B testing across channels (email, push, in-app, SMS, etc.).
Oversee loyalty and referral programs, optimizing incentive structures and funnel performance.
Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Data to build new triggers, improve personalization capabilities, and strengthen tracking.
Own CRM reporting, measurement, and ROI visibility.
Identify growth opportunities and forecast CRM-driven revenue and LTV impact.
Ensure flawless execution of campaigns with high operational reliability.
Required Education, Knowledge, And Skills:
5-7+ years of experience in CRM, Lifecycle, or Retention in a high-velocity consumer or marketplace business.
Strong command of CRM platforms, automation tools, and segmentation workflows.
Proven track record scaling lifecycle programs with measurable revenue impact.
Strong analytical ability; fluent in interpreting data to drive decisions.
Experience managing loyalty or referral programs is a plus.
Ability to lead a team and collaborate cross-functionally with technical and non-technical teams.
Ownership mindset, strong execution skills, and a bias for fast iteration.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

Title: Social Media Specialist
Description:
Company Description
Carly is an innovative e-commerce platform revolutionizing the way people buy and sell cars online. With a vision to create the most advanced super app for car enthusiasts, Carly integrates cutting-edge technology and exceptional user experience. By redefining the car marketplace, the company aims to offer seamless solutions and unmatched services to its customers. Join us in Riyadh to be part of a dynamic team driving the future of the automotive industry.
Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role for a Social Media Specialist located in Riyadh, with the flexibility for some work from home. The Social Media Specialist will be responsible for creating and managing content across social media platforms, executing social media marketing campaigns, monitoring engagement, and analyzing social media performance. The role also includes strategic planning to align content with overall marketing goals and fostering effective communication with the online community.
Qualifications
Proficiency in Social Media Marketing and Social Media Content Creation, with an understanding of platform-specific best practices.
Knowledge of Digital Marketing and Marketing strategies to enhance brand awareness and achieve KPIs.
Strong Communication skills for crafting compelling messages and engaging with diverse audiences.
Ability to analyze metrics and adapt strategies based on performance data.
Creative mindset and familiarity with trends in the social media and digital marketing landscape.
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
Experience in the automotive or e-commerce industry is a plus.

Title: Customer Service Representative
Description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a dedicated and customer-focused
Call Center Agent
to handle inbound and outbound calls, assist customers with inquiries, resolve complaints, and provide accurate information about our products and services. The ideal candidate has excellent communication skills, patience, and a strong problem-solving attitude.
Key Responsibilities
Answer incoming calls and respond to customer inquiries in a professional manner
Make outbound calls when required (follow-ups, surveys, confirmations, etc.)
Resolve customer complaints efficiently and escalate complex issues when necessary
Provide accurate information about products, services, policies, and procedures
Maintain detailed and accurate records of customer interactions in the system
Meet individual and team performance targets (quality, productivity, and attendance)
Follow company guidelines, scripts, and compliance standards
Build positive relationships with customers to enhance satisfaction and loyalty
Requirements & Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree
Previous experience in a call center or customer service role is preferred
Excellent verbal communication and active listening skills
Strong problem-solving and conflict-resolution abilities
Ability to work under pressure and handle difficult customers professionally
Basic computer skills and familiarity with CRM systems
Ability to work rotational shifts, including evenings or weekends if required
What We Offer
Competitive salary
Professional paid training
Supportive and dynamic work environment
Health and social insurance
Transportation provided 24/7

Make outbound collection calls professionally while keeping and improving customer relations.
Monitor accounts on a daily basis.
Collect users' payments in accordance with payment due dates.

Title: Career Coach

Company Description
Z FullU
is a career coaching and development platform focused on helping individuals unlock their full potential, design careers that truly fit who they are, and discover the full version of themselves.

Role Description
Z Full U is hiring a Certified Career Coach to work remotely with clients seeking clarity, direction, and meaningful growth in their careers.
In this role, you will work on a session-based model, helping individuals understand themselves better, explore suitable career paths, and build realistic, well-aligned career plans. You will guide clients through career decisions, transitions, and professional growth using structured coaching approaches tailored to each individual.
This role is not about giving generic advice. We are looking for a coach who can think deeply, listen carefully, ask the right questions, and genuinely help people find the career path that fits who they are.
Responsibilities

Qualifications (Required)

-Proven experience delivering career coaching or career guidance sessions
-Clear previous work or portfolio (case studies, programs, or documented experience)
-Existing client feedback or testimonials demonstrating impact
-Strong understanding of career development, job markets, and professional growth
-Excellent communication and deep listening skills
-Ability to work independently and manage sessions professionally in a remote environment
Nice to Have
Background in psychology, HR, counseling, or talent development
Experience working with career changers, fresh graduates, or professionals in transition
Familiarity with remote work, freelancing, or modern career paths
Why Join Z FullU?
-Fully remote work with flexible scheduling
-Session-based role focused on quality and impact
-Opportunity to work with a purpose-driven platform
-Freedom with responsibility â€” flexibility paired with professional commitment
-Chance to grow with the brand and help shape its coaching approach
Important Note
This is a flexible role, but it requires consistency, reliability, and professional commitment.
we are looking for a certified professional who takes career coaching seriously and believes in its real impact.

Title: Warehouse Keeper
Description:
job Title:
Warehouse Finished Goods Storekeeper
Location:
Shubra El Kheima
Job Summary:
Responsible for receiving, storing, and issuing finished goods while ensuring accurate inventory records and proper warehouse organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Receive finished goods from production and verify quantities & quality
Store products properly according to warehouse standards
Record all inbound & outbound transactions on the system
Maintain accurate stock balances and conduct regular inventory counts
Prepare inventory and warehouse reports
Coordinate with production, sales, and logistics teams
Ensure cleanliness, safety, and organization of the warehouse
Report any discrepancies or damages immediately
Job Requirements:
Bachelorâ€™s degree
Previous experience in a finished goods warehouse (garments preferred)
Good computer skills (Excel is a plus)
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Skills & Competencies:
Inventory management
Organization & time management
Communication skills
Teamwork
Problem-solving
Problem Solving

Title: Electrical Department Head
Description:
Company Description
Giza Spinning & Weaving Co., established in 1979 by Eng. Mohamed Marzouk, has become a leader in Egypt's textile industry. The company has consistently expanded by integrating renowned brands and diversifying its operations across multiple stages of textile production, including spinning, dyeing, cutting, sewing, and finishing. With a focus on innovation and adaptability, Giza continues to thrive in the dynamic textile sector.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site position located in Egypt for the role of Electrical Department Head. The responsibilities include overseeing the electrical department, designing and maintaining power systems. The role also involves leading and mentoring a team of engineers, ensuring compliance with safety protocols, and optimizing electrical processes to enhance operational efficiency.
Qualifications
Proven expertise in Electrical Engineering, Power Systems, and Electricity
7-10 years of experience.
Strong Team Management and leadership skills
Proficiency in safety and regulatory compliance for electrical systems
Ability to develop and execute electrical system solutions and strategies
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Power Engineering .
Previous experience leading an electrical team in manufacturing or industrial settings is a plus

Title: Spa Therapist
Description:
Job Description:
Deliver a variety of spa services (Body treatments, Swedish Massage Therapy, Aromatherapy Massage, Hot Stone Massage, Reflexology, Thai Massage, Deep Tissue Massage, and Shiatsu Massage) in a safe and comfortable manner
Maintain equipment and sample inventory of products.
Keep a clean and stocked room.
Acknowledge and respond to relevant customer queries, needs, and expectations.
Suggest and promote retail products or additional services.
Uphold hygiene standards and follow health and safety regulations.
Cooperate with and report to the administration on any arising issues.
Apply best practices and be up to date with market trends.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Physical Education or any related field
Degree or current license in aesthetics or physiotherapy
Proven work experience as a Spa Therapist is a must
Hands-on experience in massage techniques
Good command of English
Very good communication and customer service skills
Positive attitude
Job Functions: Customer Service and Health Care Provider

Title: TikTok LIVE - Agency Partnerships Manager - Cairo
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. From content strategy, monetization, gifting, LIVE features, data analysis, creating campaigns and ensuring a fun and safe space for all of our LIVE users.
We are looking for passionate and talented people to join the LIVE Operations team and support in our mission to inspire creativity and bring joy.
1. Identify and approach potential business partners (MCNs, agencies, talent organizations, or media companies) that can contribute to TikTok Liveâ€™s ecosystem growth.
2. Build and maintain long-term relationships with partners, ensuring mutual understanding and sustainable collaboration for business growth.
3. Onboard and train new partners, ensuring they are aligned with TikTok Liveâ€™s goals, content strategy, and operational standards.
4. Develop and execute business development strategies to achieve growth targets, including agency expansion, content diversification, and talent acquisition.
5. Work cross-functionally with internal teams (content, marketing, product, and data) to support partners and drive performance improvements.
6. Lead workshops, presentations, and partner engagement sessions to communicate platform updates, opportunities, and best practices.
7. Monitor and analyze performance metrics of agencies and creators, preparing regular reports and recommending improvements.
8. Continuously explore new partnership models and collaboration opportunities in the live-streaming, entertainment, and digital media sectors.
9. Ensure all partnerships contribute positively to TikTok Liveâ€™s brand, user experience, and community safety
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
1. Bachelorâ€™s degree or above, preferably in Business, Media, Communications, or a related field.
2. 3 years of experience in business development within the internet, media, or entertainment industry.
3. Proven track record in identifying, approaching, and closing strategic partnerships that drive business growth.
4. Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to build trust and alignment with external partners.
5. Target-oriented mindset with a demonstrated ability to meet or exceed performance goals under pressure.
6. Hands-on experience managing agency or partner operations, with a structured approach to onboarding, support, and performance monitoring.
7. Proficiency in speaking Arabic, English and French due to business travel requirements.
Preferred Qualifications:
1. Have strong data analysis skills, be able to identify problems and discover opportunities through data and provide strong support for operation decisions.
2. Be proficient in various community operation tools (such as management tools for WeChat communities, QQ communities and other platforms), and have certain event planning abilities.
3. Be careful and responsible at work, have a strong team spirit, be able to withstand certain work pressure and be passionate about community operation work.
4. Excellent organizational and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and translate insights into actionable strategies.
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.â€‹
Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect â€“ and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.â€‹
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.â€‹
â€‹

Title: Creative Copywriter
Description:
Company Description
At Be Group, we create unique services designed to provide flexibility and creativity to meet your business needs. Our mission is to enhance website visibility, attract new clients, and build effective websites. We place a strong emphasis on delivering trusted E-marketing processes to ensure our clients' success. Our innovative solutions are tailored to each business to maximize their potential.

â€¢ Writing, develop and manage creative content, video scripts and copies required in English and Arabic language.

Title: English Second Language Instructor
Description:
Company Description
Founded in 2017, Guide Academy is a comprehensive recruitment and learning institution dedicated to empowering individuals from diverse backgrounds with essential skills. Focused on quality education and training, the academy's mission is supported by its five key pillars: Skills Training, Language Learning, Trainer Trained, Recruitment Hub, and Corporate Pro. Guide Academy delivers tailored and scalable solutions, ensuring alignment with unique organizational needs, industries, and growth objectives. With experienced professionals and a human-centered approach, the academy is committed to excellence, offering personalized support to achieve meaningful results and foster professional growth. Located in Cairo, Guide Academy values quality, relevance, and lasting client relationships.
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role based in Cairo for an English Placement Tester. The role involves conducting English language assessment tests to evaluate participants' language proficiency, analyzing test results for placement purposes, and providing detailed reports and feedback to support the learning process. The tester will collaborate closely with training teams to align testing methods with program goals and ensure a seamless evaluation process. Administrative tasks related to scheduling, reporting, and test manual preparation will also be part of the responsibilities.
Qualifications
Strong proficiency in English language assessment, test development, and evaluation
Experience in education or training environments with knowledge of effective teaching and evaluation strategies
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and feedback delivery skills
Attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently
Familiarity with educational technologies and tools for online and in-person assessments
Degree in English, Education, Linguistics, or a related field; certification in TEFL, TESOL, or similar is considered a plus
Commitment to collaborative teamwork and adapting to the dynamic needs of learners

Title: Treasury Accountant
Description:
Position:
Treasury Accountant
Job Type:
Full-Time
Reports To:
Accounting Manager
Location:
Alexandria, Egypt
Company Description:
The Mena Group is a prominent real estate company with over 40 years of experience, having delivered more than 300 projects across Egypt and the Middle East. We are renowned for developing integrated residential communities, tourist resorts, and commercial projects. Our commitment to excellence and innovation has made us a trusted name in the real estate industry.
Job Summary:
The Treasury Accountant is responsible for managing the companyâ€™s cash flow, banking operations, and financial transactions. The role ensures accurate treasury reporting, timely payments, and compliance with internal controls. Construction industry experience and an Accounting Bachelorâ€™s degree are mandatory.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage daily cash flow, liquidity, and bank balances.
Prepare cash flow forecasts and monitor cash requirements for ongoing construction projects.
Handle bank reconciliations and ensure all transactions are recorded accurately.
Process supplier payments, subcontractor transfers, and project-related expenses.
Coordinate with the Finance and Procurement teams to ensure timely fund availability.
Maintain relationships with banks and oversee all treasury-related documentation.
Monitor LCs, LGs, and project guarantees as required for construction contracts.
Ensure compliance with company policies, financial standards, and audit requirements.
Support month-end closing and provide treasury reports to management.
Implement and maintain strong internal controls over treasury operations.
Qualifications & Requirements:
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting is Must.
Minimum 3â€“5 years of Treasury Accounting experience, preferably in the construction industry (Real Estate).
Strong knowledge of cash flow management, bank operations, and treasury procedures.
Experience in LCs, LGs, and project-based financial transactions.
Proficient in MS Excel and accounting software (ERP preferred).
High attention to detail, accuracy, and time management skills.

Title: Senior Accountant
Description:
W
e are a trusted recruitment partner connecting exceptional finance professionals with leading organizations. On behalf of our client, we are seeking a
Senior Accountant
to join a dynamic finance team and ensure the highest standards of accuracy, compliance, and efficiency across all accounting operations.
Key Responsibilities
Prepare timely and accurate financial analyses and reports.
Oversee monthly, quarterly, and year-end closings, ensuring precision and compliance.
Manage and reconcile general ledger and balance sheet accounts.
Conduct monthly and quarterly bank reconciliations and compliance checks.
Assist in budgeting and financial forecasting processes.
Support audit preparation and liaise with external auditors.
Record and analyze revenues, expenses, and other financial transactions.
Supervise accounting functions and ensure process consistency across departments.
Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on overdue payments.
Prepare tax-related reports and ensure compliance with local regulations.
Collaborate with the Chief Accountant on semi-annual and annual closures.
Contribute to the enhancement of accounting systems, processes, and procedures.
Provide guidance and support to junior accounting staff.
Maintain effective communication with managers regarding financial updates and issues.
Manage vendor accounts and ensure timely settlements.
Job Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
4â€“7 years of professional accounting experience, including at least 2 years in a senior role.
Proven experience with general ledger management and month-end/year-end closing.
Proficiency in accounting software and ERP systems (Odoo preferred).
Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.).
In-depth knowledge of accounting principles, GAAP, and Egyptian Tax Law.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities.
Familiarity with financial reporting standards and audit procedures.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Awareness of current financial and business trends.

Title: Industrial Safety Technician
Location: Sharm El Sheikh, South Sinai, Egypt
Description:
Company Description
With its stunning location at Sharm El Sheikh, Rixos Premium Seagate offers a luxurious retreat overlooking the shimmering red sea. The hotel offers an All-Inclusive concept combining exceptional restaurants and bars, top-class entertainment venues that also provide a variety of dining experiences and superb wellness and sports facilities. Rixos Premium Seagate offers stylish rooms and suites with direct access to the private beach, and state-of-the-art conference and banquet venues.
A beautiful beach, delicious food with top-quality service restaurants with luxurious buffets, pools, Rixy Club exclusively for children and live entertainment all await your ultimate holiday experience.
Rixos Premium Seagate is located 18 km from Naama Bay, 25 km from the old market of Sharm El-Sheikh and 9 km from Sharm El-Sheikh
Job Description
Inspect, maintain, and test industrial safety equipment such as fire alarm systems, fire extinguishers, emergency lighting, gas detectors, and safety signage
Conduct routine safety checks of machinery, tools, and work areas to identify potential hazards
Assist in implementing and enforcing health, safety, and environmental (HSE) policies and procedures
Support emergency preparedness activities including fire drills, evacuation drills, and safety training
Report unsafe conditions, incidents, and near misses, and assist with corrective actions
Maintain safety inspection records, permits, and compliance documentation
Ensure proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) by staff and contractors
Assist in lockout/tagout procedures and safe isolation of equipment during maintenance
Coordinate with supervisors, safety officers, and contractors to ensure safe work practices
Respond promptly to safety incidents and support emergency response teams
Qualifications
Diploma or Technical Certificate in Industrial Safety, Mechanical, Electrical, or related field
Basic knowledge of occupational health and safety regulations and standards
Ability to read safety manuals, technical drawings, and procedures
Good communication and reporting skills
Physically fit and able to work in industrial environments
Willingness to work shifts, weekends, or on-call if required

Title: Assistant Professor In Computer Science (Part-Time Position)
Description:
The Universities of Canada in Egypt hosting University of Prince Edward Island (UPEI) in Egypt invites applicants at the rank of Full Time Assistant Professor with specialization in Computer Science / Video Gaming at Faculty of Science, School of Mathematical and Computational Sciences starting February 2026.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Teaching and learning:
Transfer knowledge to students and teaching assistants including but not limited to practical skills, methods and techniques.
Ensure that the teaching content and methods of delivery are in accordance with faculty guidelines and respond to issues relating to staff and student needs.
Develop innovative approaches to course delivery and ensure that different teaching components and delivery comply with the quality and educational standards and regulations of the department.
Promote debate and develop the ability of students to engage in critical discourse and problem solving.
Supervise student projects and research, as well as, mentor their academic progress.
Set, mark and fairly assess work and examinations and provide feedback to students.
Research and Scholarly Endeavors
Lead and co-ordinate research activity in the field including determining relevant research objectives, leading research and collaborative partnerships with other educational institutions or other bodies and preparing and submitting proposals and applications to external bodies, e.g. for funding and accreditation purposes.
Carry out independent or contribute to research work and publications or disseminate research findings using other appropriate media.
Seek practical application of research findings in line with the vision of the university.
University Services
Chair or contribute to committees work and participate in school/department decision-making and governance.
Exemplify the work of the university and department both nationally and internationally.
Dealing with referred issues for students within their own educational programs.
Act as a line manager, supervising the work of others, for example in research teams, projects, or as M.Sc., PhD supervisor when required.
Mentor, appraise and advise staff on personal and career development plans.
Foster innovation and inter-disciplinary team working.
Other duties as may be required for the department and assigned by the department head.
Required Skills and Qualifications:
A Ph.D. Degree from a recognized University (Preferably Canadian and/or North American institutions)
A record of excellence in teaching and scholarly output appropriate to career stage
Excellent command of English language
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
Excellent teamwork and organizational skills
Compassionate, positive, and professional attitude
High level of responsibility and commitment.
Ability to take and implement initiatives contributing to the development of the school.
Ability to balance the competing pressures of teaching, scholarship, research, knowledge transfer, administrative demands and deadlines.

Title: Mid/Senior AI Developer
Description:
Job Overview
We are looking for a talented
AI Engineer
with over three years of experience in Large Language Models (LLMs), Conversational AI, and Generative AI. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience building intelligent systems with LangChain and LangGraph, with a focus on AI agents, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and autonomous reasoning pipelines.
You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and optimize AI-driven solutions that enhance business processes and user experiences.
Roles & Responsibilities
Design, fine-tune, and deploy LLMs for production-ready applications.
Build AI agents and multi-agent systems using LangChain, LangGraph, and related frameworks.
Develop and integrate Conversational AI pipelines that deliver seamless, human-like interactions.
Implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures leveraging vector databases and document retrievers.
Collaborate with data engineers and product teams to design scalable, reliable, and efficient AI pipelines.
Develop and maintain APIs and backend services using FastAPI and modern software engineering practices.
Collaborate with data engineers and product teams to design scalable, reliable, and efficient AI pipelines.
Optimize model inference, latency, and scalability in cloud and containerized environments
Optimize model inference, latency, and scalability in cloud and containerized environments.
Stay current with advancements in LLMs, Agentic AI, and Generative AI ecosystems.
Required Skills
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with LangChain and LangGraph for AI agent orchestration.
Experience integrating LLMs via APIs such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google Vertex AI.
Solid understanding of prompt engineering, RAG pipelines, and tool-using AI agents.
Proficiency with PyTorch, Transformers (Hugging Face), and vector databases (e.g., Qdarnt, FAISS, Chroma).
Experience designing multi-agent systems or workflow-based AI agents using LangGraph or similar frameworks.
Knowledge of LLM evaluation, prompt optimization, and context management strategies.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with MLOps and continuous integration/deployment pipelines for AI systems.
Understanding of generative AI models for text, image, or multimodal outputs.
Familiar with traditional ML and computer vision.
Strong problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills.
Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience in AI/ML model development and deployment.

Title: Sr. Business Development Manager (Online)
Description:
NexTag is the largest comparison shopping site for products, mortgages, travel, cars and more. Founded in 1999, the company was recently named the second fastest growing private company in the Bay Area by the San Francisco Business Times 2004 "Fast 100" and ranked first in the 2003 "Fast 100". NexTag was also named the 7th fastest growing technology company in North America on the "Rising Stars" list by Deloitte 2003 Technology Fast 500.
On a monthly basis, over 11 million consumers use NexTag to find and compare products and services online. Named to the Red Herring Top 100 for 2005, NexTag has enjoyed four consecutive years of profitability and sustained growth.
Nextag.com is looking for a Business Development contributor to own responsibility for NexTag.com business development initiatives with financial services partners.   This position is critical to the day to day decision making and operations of the company and will report to the VP of Mortgage.  Activities include:
1)  Prospecting [sourcing]
2)  Qualifiying
3)  Recruiting
4)  Responding to inbound inquiries.
5)  Overcoming obstacles and objection handling
6)  Building a book of business under tight metrics and deadlines.
Additional responsibilities include contract negotiations, ongoing support and growth of an account base with cross-functional activities with Finance, Technology, Product Management and Marketing as necessary.
The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5-7 years of experience in sales or business development.  Requriements include strong sales and prospecting skills, and direct experience with the internet or experience in businesses with an internet component.  Knowledge of the home loans, consumer lending, insurance and contacts in the consumer finance community is strongly desired.
Excellent writen and verbal communication skills and attention to detail.  Must have technical skills include proficiency with MS Office Suite with particular emphasis in Excel and Word.
Primary Responsibilities:
Develop and cultivate partnerships with financial organizations.
Drive business in the assigned category.
Identify key partners and sell Nextag as a  business partner.
Qualifications
5+ years of business development, major account sales experience or experience with a investment banking firm.
Management experience required
Analytical and quantitative skills a must.
BA/BS or equivalent from a top-tier University.  MBA a plus.
You'll be joining a great team and a fast-growing company with an excellent future. If you are an aggressive, self-driven individual we want you to join the NexTag team.
To apply, please send resume to jchan@nextag.com.
For more information, please visit our website at http://www.nextag.com
No relocation for this position. Local candidates only.

Since 2001, RAYA CX has been the trusted partner for customer service, technical support, and global services for Fortune 1000 companies throughout North America, Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. Headquartered in competitive and skilled labor markets, RAYA CX offers a wide range of integrated BPO solutions. The company is committed to leveraging advanced technologies, robust strategies, and continuous innovation to deliver exceptional results.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site role for a Call Center Representative based in Qesm El Maadi. The Call Center Representative will handle customer inquiries, provide product and service information, resolve customer concerns, and ensure a positive customer experience. The role involves responding to phone calls, emails, and chats, maintaining customer satisfaction, and adhering to company quality standards and procedures.
Qualifications
Proficiency in Customer Service, Customer Support, and ensuring Customer Satisfaction
Strong Interpersonal and communication skills for effective client interactions
Basic Computer Literacy and the ability to navigate systems efficiently
Ability to remain calm and attentive during interactions with customers
Previous experience as a Call Center or Customer Service Representative is advantageous
High school diploma or equivalent; additional qualifications are a plus
Fluency in English; additional language skills are a plus

Title: Sr Planning Engineer (Claims)
Description:
Job Description â€“ Planning Engineer (Claims & Dispute Resolution)
Location:
Remote (based in Egypt, with future relocation to Egypt office upon establishment)
Company:
[Confidential â€“ Real Estate Development & Consultancy Firm]
Industry Focus:
Real Estate Development Management, Planning & Commercial Services, Dispute Resolution Services
About Us
We are a specialized consultancy providing
end-to-end solutions
across
real estate development management, commercial planning, and disputes resolution services
. With a strong presence in the UAE and upcoming operations in Egypt, we partner with leading developers, contractors, and investors to deliver successful, high-value projects.
As part of our expansion, we are seeking a
Planning Engineer (Claims)
to join our growing team. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious professional to contribute remotely from Egypt and transition into a key role once our Egypt office is established.
Role Overview
The
Planning Engineer (Claims)
will play a critical role in supporting our
planning, scheduling, and claims management activities
across major projects. The role requires strong expertise in
construction claims, delay analysis, and project scheduling
, along with the ability to provide commercial insights that support dispute resolution and project success.
Key Responsibilities
Develop, review, and maintain
project schedules
, resource allocation plans, and progress tracking reports.
Conduct
delay and disruption analyses
in support of claims and dispute resolution cases.
Prepare
extension of time (EoT)
submissions and claims documentation in compliance with contracts and industry standards.
Support dispute resolution teams with
technical planning evidence
and data-based justifications.
Coordinate with project managers, commercial teams, and clients to ensure alignment on project timelines and claims strategy.
Prepare and present
forensic planning reports
and expert witness documentation when required.
Ensure compliance with
UAE and international construction standards
.
Qualifications & Skills
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in
Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related discipline
.
8â€“10 years of experience
in project planning, scheduling, and claims management within construction/real estate sectors.
Proven expertise in
Primavera P6
and other project control tools.
Strong background in
claims preparation, delay analysis techniques
(e.g., Time Impact Analysis, As-Planned vs As-Built).
Familiarity with
FIDIC contracts
and international contract frameworks.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and report-writing skills.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills in both
English and Arabic
.
Ability to work independently while collaborating with remote, cross-border teams.
Working Conditions
Working Hours:
9:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM
Days Off:
Friday +
2 Saturdays off per month
Remote work setup from Egypt until local office launch
What We Offer
Competitive
salary package
aligned with experience and expertise.
Opportunity to work remotely from Egypt with
future relocation to our Egypt office
.
Exposure to
landmark real estate and infrastructure projects
in the UAE and MENA region.
Career growth in a dynamic environment combining
planning, commercial, and dispute resolution services
.
A supportive, professional culture that values
technical excellence and innovation
.
Industries: Real Estate and Business Consulting and Services

Title: Sales Executive
Description:
Company Description
PORTEX is a comprehensive freight forwarding company, providing expert services in import, export, consolidation, inland logistics, air freight, and ocean freight. We are dedicated to ensuring efficient and tailored transportation solutions, offering our clients seamless logistics management. Our goal is to meet diverse shipping needs with reliability and professionalism, helping businesses streamline their supply chain operations.
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site Sales Executive role located in Nasr city, Cairo, Egypt. The Sales Executive will be responsible for identifying and establishing relationships with potential clients, managing sales pipelines, and promoting the company's freight forwarding services. Day-to-day tasks include engaging in client outreach, negotiating contracts, and collaborating with internal teams to ensure efficient service delivery. The role requires maintaining market knowledge, meeting sales targets, and delivering exceptional customer experience.
Qualifications
Strong communication, relationship-building, and negotiation skills
Experience in sales management in logistics field is a must.
Knowledge of freight forwarding services such as import, export, air freight, and ocean freight operations
Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities to address customer needs effectively
Proficiency in using CRM tools and Microsoft Office applications
Proactive attitude with a target-driven approach to achieving sales goals
Fluency in English; additional languages are considered a plus
Previous experience in the freight forwarding or logistics industry is advantageous
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

Title: Customer Success Services Sales Representative (SaaS) â€“ MEA region
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Oracleâ€™s cloud technology is changing the way the world does business, and weâ€™re looking for a Coprime Sales Representative to open, maintain, and grow SaaS service engagements within CSS; driving participation in customer events, handling and qualifying leads, and developing and closing services business. CSS establishes long-term relationships with many of Oracle's largest customers through annuity and project-based service contracts.
What You Will Do
The job requires ambitious, results-oriented sales professionals with experience selling Technology solutions. The ideal candidate is passionate about sales and has an appetite for continuous learning and personal development.
Identify and prioritise new opportunities, and effectively engage with other sales professionals, and prospects to develop new or expansion deals for CSS
Seek sufficient pipeline cover and deliver your allocated quota in each Financial period.
Sell consultatively, providing credible advice and mentorship on the value of CSS adoption and service solutions for Oracle SaaS. Lead information-gathering sessions specific to CSS Services, to better determine the CSS role in opportunities.
Build and run go-to-market initiatives.
What We Are Looking For
Proven history of strong sales, consulting, and collaboration skills. The ability to work within sophisticated sales and delivery cycles and with multiple partners.
Cognitive ability to listen, understand, and respond concisely to sophisticated questions and validate that the response is understood.
Exhibit strong verbal and written communication skills, needs analysis, positioning, scoping, and business justification.
Ability to travel within the Gulf following Oracle's prevailing travel advice and as required in fulfilment of the role
A business â€œhunterâ€ who displays positivity, initiative, and self-motivation and promotes these qualities within the broader team.
Career Level - IC4
RESPONSIBILITIES
Oracleâ€™s cloud technology is changing the way the world does business, and weâ€™re looking for a Coprime Sales Representative to open, maintain, and grow SaaS service engagements within CSS; driving participation in customer events, handling and qualifying leads, and developing and closing services business. CSS establishes long-term relationships with many of Oracle's largest customers through annuity and project-based service contracts.
What We Are Looking For
Proven history of strong sales, consulting, and collaboration skills. The ability to work within sophisticated sales and delivery cycles and with multiple partners.
Cognitive ability to listen, understand, and respond concisely to sophisticated questions and validate that the response is understood.
Exhibit strong verbal and written communication skills, needs analysis, positioning, scoping, and business justification.

A business â€œhunterâ€ who displays positivity, initiative, and self-motivation and promotes these qualities within the broader team.
QUALIFICATIONS
Career Level - IC4
ABOUT US
As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrowâ€™s technology to tackle todayâ€™s challenges. Weâ€™ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sectorâ€”and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
Weâ€™re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
