Title: Mold Design Engineer
Description:
Join Our Team as a Mold Design Engineer!
The main purpose:
Responsible for the 3D CAD models and supporting detailed drawings of the new molds and design modifications and engineering changes to existing mold designs.
Key Responsibilities:
1. Design and create new Molds for new products in order to put them into the production line
2.Â Creating 2D mold layout assembly drawings and bills of materials, and calculating the cost to confirm they are designed for manufacturability, efficiency, and cost savings.
3.Â Making modifications to existing mold designs to improve their performance or to integrate new technology.
4.Â Work with reverse engineering principles and rapid prototype resources as needed.
5.Â Drawing and Design spare parts by reverse engineering to repair some parts in machines to support the production line, ensuring their conformity to specifications by reviewing dimensions with measuringÂ instruments if required.
Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in design and production engineering.
- Proven working experience of 2-7 years in manufacturing.
- CAD/CAM expert and very proficient in the 3D SolidWorks mold design package or others (CATIA, NX, etc.).
Work Location:
Mansoura Factory.
Work style:
Â· Full-time
Â· 8 hours per day
To apply, please send your CV to â€œ
hr@akl.com.eg
â€, and mention "Mold Design Engineer" in the subject.
Join us in shaping the future of automotive parts!

Title: Electrical Tendering Engineer (MV Panels)
Location: Qesm El Obour, Al Qalyubiyah, Egypt
Description:
Role Description
The Electrical Tendering Engineer will be responsible for preparing and submitting quotations, analyzing electrical engineering specifications and requirements, procuring materials and equipment, and effectively communicating with clients and stakeholders. The role involves working closely with the engineering and sales teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery of tenders.
Job description
Study of all the specifications and insure that the product are complying the specifications
Make product configuration by selecting all attributes regarding the product on our quotation tool .
Coordinate with Sales engineers and customers to ensure specifications are accurate in order to prepare technical and price offer.
Follow up with the sales office about any questions regarding the previous offers
Contact with supply chain dep.to get prices and approvals for some products under supervise with manager
Make compliance statement on the specification and complete submittal up on request.
Reply on Consultant and client comment's
Fill Guarantee tables when required.
Contact with supply chain dep. To check the availability of product for each tender or some important offers.
Contact with production dep. To Check the delivery period of product for each tender or some important offers.
Make accurate costing with updating BOM for each tender or some important offers.
Make all modifications required modified by customer or on Orders after approval
Make any task ordered by their supervisor
Responsible for Pre-Sales Support
Make the necessary visit for customer with sales Engineer up on request.
Job Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s degree in electrical and Power Engineering.
2â€“4 years of experience in MV panels (Switchgear, Kiosks, RMUs)
Very good command of English Language
Superb time management skills
Good communication skills
industrial background is a MUST.

SYE English Community is the first English learning community in Egypt, dedicated to personal and professional development through language education. Our talented instructors provide a unique development program designed to significantly improve English language proficiency, enhance skills, and transform lives. SYE is passionate about empowering individuals to achieve their goals through effective communication and skill-building.
Role Description:
SYE Community is one of the leading English learning communities in Egypt. We believe that learning English should be interactive, practical, and fun â€” not just about textbooks and exams.
Weâ€™re looking for passionate English Instructors to teach Adults across our four branches:
Dokki, Maadi, 6th of October, and Nasr City
, with opportunities available for Full-time, Part-time, and Freelance roles.

Title: Salesforce Consultant - Remote - Octopus
Description:
About Octopus By RTG
Octopus by RTG is the tech hiring and outsourcing arm of
Robusta Technology Group
, dedicated to connecting exceptional tech talent with top-tier organizations across the
MENA, GCC, Europe, the US, and Canada
. We specialize in building strong, long-term partnerships between skilled professionals and innovative companies. Our mission is to
empower growth, innovation, and excellence
by matching the right talent with the right opportunities.
Currently, we are hiring a Salesforce Consultant for one of our
partner organizations in KSA
, offering the opportunity to contribute to exciting projects within a dynamic and forward-thinking environment.
The
Salesforce Consultant / Administrator
is responsible for overseeing the implementation and ongoing management of Theeb's
Salesforce platform
. This role coordinates closely with the external implementation vendor during the project execution phase and assumes full ownership of system administration post go-live.
The position ensures Salesforce effectively supports business objectives, integrates seamlessly with core enterprise systems, and delivers high levels of user adoption, data quality, and operational efficiency.
Main Responsibilities
Manage and coordinate day-to-day activities with the external Salesforce implementation vendor.
Review, validate, and approve business requirements, system designs, and development deliverables.
Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT), ensure adequate testing coverage, and track issue resolution through to closure.
Configure and administer Salesforce components, including objects, fields, workflows, validation rules, and flows.
Manage users, profiles, roles, permission sets, and access controls in line with security policies.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics to support business and executive decision-making.
Ensure seamless integration with CarPro, Genesys, MuleSoft, and Data Warehouse platforms.
Provide training, documentation, and ongoing support to end users to drive adoption and effective usage.
Enforce Salesforce security standards, data governance policies, and compliance requirements.
Act as the primary internal subject matter expert (SME) for Salesforce operations, enhancements, and best practices.
Requirements
Education
Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience & Technical Skills
5+ years of experience in Salesforce implementation, administration, or consulting roles.
Strong hands-on experience in Salesforce configuration, user management, automation, and reporting.
Solid understanding of system integration concepts, APIs, and middleware tools (e.g., MuleSoft).
Proven ability to coordinate with vendors and manage complex, multi-stakeholder initiatives.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Excellent stakeholder management and documentation capabilities.
Certifications (Preferred)
Salesforce Administrator
Salesforce Platform App Builder
Salesforce Consultant (Sales / Service / Experience Cloud)
Language Requirements
Fluent in Arabic and English (spoken and written)

Title: Lead Generation Specialist
Description:
Company Description
DynaSystems is a cutting-edge technology firm specializing in Microsoft Dynamics AX and 365 Finance and Operations. We focus on providing tailored solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients through deep expertise in the technical aspects of these platforms. Our dedicated team excels in integration with third-party systems, customizations, and the development of bespoke plugins to enhance functionality and performance. We are committed to optimizing efficiency and maximizing productivity for our clients.
We are expanding and looking for a
Lead Generation Specialist
to join our growing organization. This is a
key position
that will directly support the CEO in identifying, qualifying, and engaging potential clients for our Microsoft Dynamics and integration solutions.
Responsibilities
Research and identify new business opportunities through
LinkedIn, email, and online platforms
.
Generate qualified leads and maintain a structured leads database.
Reach out to prospects via
email, LinkedIn messages, and phone calls
to introduce our solutions.
Schedule online meetings and demos for the CEO or technical team.
Collaborate closely with management to design outreach strategies and improve conversion rates.
Track and report lead generation metrics and pipeline status.
Requirements
Minimum
3 years of experience
in
lead generation, inside sales, or business development
. Must be in the
software or IT industry
.
Strong knowledge of
LinkedIn Sales Navigator
,
email marketing
, and
CRM tools
.
Excellent
English communication and writing skills
.
Ability to work independently and take ownership of the full lead generation process.
Familiarity with
Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O)
or ERP systems is a
strong advantage
.
Proactive, organized, and goal-oriented personality.

Title: Area Manager - First Mile
Description:
About Bosta:
Launched in 2017, Bosta is an overnight delivery provider for E-commerce companies in Egypt. Leveraging technology to empower businesses is what we do best. Our goal is to disrupt the logistics industry by bringing technology and experience together to provide a one-stop shop for delivery solutions.
We rely on advanced technology to deliver orders to our customers in a fast way. Businesses can track and connect with couriers and follow up on their orders - all in one system.
About the Job:
The Area Manager for First Mile will oversee and manage the initial phase of the shipping process
process, ensuring efficient collection and processing of reverse parcels.
The successful candidate will be responsible for optimizing operations, driving the team
performance, and enhancing customer satisfaction for FM operations
Job Code:
2026OPER-276
Job Responisbilities
Operational Management: Oversee daily operations in the First Mile segment, ensuring timely collection and processing of packages
Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and develop a team to achieve performance targets; Conduct regular training to enhance skills
Performance Analysis: Monitor key performance indicators (PSR, Return Promise, Lost, Exceeded Return) to assess effectiveness and implement improvements as necessary
Process Optimization: Identify areas for process enhancement to maximize efficiency and reduce costs
Merchant Relationship Management: Build strong relationships with merchants to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction and address any issues promptly
Budget Management: Prepare and manage budgets for the area to achieve the FM cost, ensuring effective allocation of resources
Collaboration: Work closely with other departments, such as Account Management, customer service and Fleet
Job Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree in business administration, Logistics, or a related field
Minimum of 3 Years of experience in a managerial role within logistics or shipping
Strong leadership and team management capabilities
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills
Proficient in data analysis and performance management
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

Title: Data Engineer - Data Integration Intern
Description:
Introduction
A career in IBM Consulting is built on long-term client relationships and close collaboration worldwide. Youâ€™ll work with leading companies across industries, helping them shape their hybrid cloud and AI journeys. With support from our strategic partners, robust IBM technology, and Red Hat, youâ€™ll have the tools to drive meaningful change and accelerate client impact. At IBM Consulting, curiosity fuels success. Youâ€™ll be encouraged to challenge the norm, explore new ideas, and create innovative solutions that deliver real results. Our culture of growth and empathy focuses on your long-term career development while valuing your unique skills and experiences.
Your Role And Responsibilities
Data Engineer â€“ Data Integration Intern, you will support the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines that integrate data from multiple sources into centralized data platforms. You will work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business teams to ensure data is reliable, accessible, and ready for analysis
Required Technical And Professional Expertise
Basic understanding of data engineering concepts (ETL/ELT, data pipelines, data integration).
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
Familiarity with at least one programming language such as Python or Java.
Understanding of data formats (CSV, JSON, Parquet is a plus).
Basic knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Willingness to learn and ability to work in a team environment.
Preferred Technical And Professional Experience
Exposure to data integration or ETL tools (e.g., Airflow, Talend, Informatica, dbt).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Basic understanding of data warehousing concepts (fact tables, dimensions, schemas).
Experience with APIs and data extraction from external systems.
Awareness of data quality, data validation, and logging practices.

Title: Events and Exhibitions Designer
Description:
Company Description
Skybridge crafts extraordinary experiences by transforming bold visions into unforgettable events. With a deep commitment to precision and creativity, our team specializes in designing and delivering events that captivate audiences and create lasting impressions. At Skybridge, we pride ourselves on bringing innovative ideas to life while focusing on excellence at every stage of execution. Our dedication and expertise make us a trusted leader in the event industry.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site Senior 3D Event Designer position based in Qesm El Maadi. The Senior 3D Event Designer will be responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and developing 3D spaces for events. This role involves collaborating with event planning teams to create immersive experiences, ensuring that design concepts align with client visions and brand guidelines. The designer will actively participate in brainstorming sessions, create detailed renders, and manage design phases from concept to final execution.
Qualifications
Proficiency in Event Designing and Event Planning to conceptualize and execute large-scale experiences.
Expertise in Event Management and an understanding of event logistics and flow to ensure seamless implementation.
Strong Communication skills to collaborate with internal teams, clients, and vendors effectively.
Sales skills, including the ability to present and sell ideas and concepts to stakeholders.
Proficiency in 3D design tools (e.g., AutoCAD, SketchUp, 3D Studio Max) is highly desirable.
Ability to work under tight deadlines while maintaining attention to detail.
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Design, Architecture, or a related field is preferred.

Title: Back Office Agents Voice&Non-Voice |English Speakers
Description:
Company Description
ETISAL International Group is one of the leading Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) companies in the Middle and Far East. With years of expertise, ETISAL offers innovative, tailor-made solutions to meet the unique needs of each client, enabling them to focus on core business functions while improving service delivery. The company takes pride in its global reach, cultural understanding, and dedication to quality, providing industry-best practices and cutting-edge technology. ETISAL emphasizes transparency, flexibility, integrity, and a commitment to exceeding client expectations in all their operations.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site role based in Cairo for a Back Office Agent handling both Voice and Non-Voice operations. Responsibilities include addressing customer inquiries via calls, emails, and live chats, processing customer requests efficiently, providing support to ensure a seamless service experience, and ensuring adherence to company policies and quality standards. The agent will be responsible for evaluating and resolving customer concerns while maintaining confidentiality and professionalism at all times.
Qualifications
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English for handling both voice-based and written customer interactions.
Strong multitasking, problem-solving, and analytical thinking skills for accurately addressing customer needs and issues.
Proficiency in using customer service tools, CRM platforms, and basic computer applications, with the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies.
Ability to work full-time on-site in Cairo and serve customers with professionalism and accuracy.
Prior experience in customer service, specifically in back-office operations, is a plus.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to handle data and processes efficiently.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and contribute positively to a team-oriented culture.

Title: Corporate Secretary
Description:
Role Overview
The Secretary of the Egyptian Fashion & Design Council plays a pivotal administrative and governance role, ensuring the smooth operation of the Council, effective coordination among committees, and accurate documentation of all official activities. The role supports strategic decision-making, maintains institutional integrity, and serves as a key point of contact between the Board, members, partners, and external stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities
Governance & Board Support
Prepare agendas, documentation, and briefing materials for Board, General Assembly, and committee meetings.
Attend meetings, record accurate minutes, and ensure timely circulation and approval.
Maintain official records, resolutions, bylaws, and policies in line with governance best practices.
Ensure compliance with Council statutes, internal regulations, and applicable Egyptian legal requirements.
Administration & Operations
Manage official correspondence, filings, and documentation on behalf of the Council.
Maintain and update membership records, databases, and contact lists.
Coordinate schedules, meetings, and follow-ups for the Secretary General, Chairperson and Executive Board.
Oversee document management systems, archiving, and confidentiality protocols.
Coordination & Communication
Act as liaison between the Board, committees (Business, Sustainability, Creative, Education, PR & Media), and international ambassadors.
Facilitate internal communication and ensure alignment across departments and initiatives.
Support coordination with external partners, sponsors, fashion councils, and government entities.
Oversee outsourced services, including social media and marketing.
Strategic & Event Support
Support the planning and execution of Council-led initiatives, summits, fashion weeks, and international collaborations.
Track decisions, action items, and implementation timelines arising from meetings.
Assist in preparing reports, presentations, and official statements.
Compliance & Reporting
Support statutory reporting, filings, and renewals as required for non-profit or council operations.
Ensure proper documentation for MOUs, partnerships, and agreements in coordination with legal advisors.
Uphold ethical standards, transparency, and confidentiality across all Council activities.
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Law, Communications, Public Administration, or a related field.
Minimum 2 years of experience in a senior administrative, secretarial, or governance support role, preferably within councils, associations, or non-profit organizations.
Experience in the fashion, creative industries, or cultural sector is an advantage.
Skills & Competencies
Strong organizational and time-management skills with high attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Arabic; French is a plus.
Proven ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and digital document management systems.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with senior leaders and international stakeholders.
Personal Attributes
Professional, diplomatic, pinctual and highly reliable.
Proactive, solution-oriented, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment.
Strong sense of responsibility, integrity, and institutional commitment.
Work Environment
Hybrid role with availability for meetings, events, and travel as required.
May require flexible hours aligned with Council activities and international engagements.

Title: Sales Consultant
Description:
Company Description
ELTarek Automotive, established by Eng. Tarek Ismail in Alexandria, Egypt, began as an authorized distributor for Mercedes-Benz passenger cars. With over 40 years of experience in the automotive industry, the company has expanded its services to include insurance, financing, and trade-in options, offering customers a comprehensive car ownership journey. Today, ELTarek Automotive represents more than 18 leading car brands and holds a 16% share of the Egyptian automotive market. The company remains dedicated to providing exceptional sales and after-sales experiences to its customers across Egypt.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site role for a Sales Consultant based in Giza. The Sales Consultant will be responsible for engaging with customers to provide tailored sales consultancy, ensuring a positive buying experience, and achieving sales targets. Key tasks include advising customers on automotive options, understanding their needs, delivering exceptional customer service, and maintaining customer satisfaction. This role also involves building long-term relationships with clients and staying updated on vehicle features and market trends.
Qualifications
Proven skills in Sales Consulting and Consulting to understand customer needs and recommend appropriate solutions
Strong Customer Satisfaction and Customer Service abilities to ensure excellent client interactions and experiences
Exceptional Communication and interpersonal skills for client engagement and relationship building
Demonstrated ability to meet sales targets and work effectively within a team
Good knowledge of the automotive industry and a passion for automobiles
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field is preferred
Prior experience in sales or customer service roles is an advantage

Title: B2B Telesales Specialist â€“ Real Estate (KSA Market)
Description:
York Holding Group is a diversified investment and development group with a portfolio spanning real estate, technology, and financial innovation. The group operates through three specialized business verticals that complement each other to drive growth across the real estate ecosystem, from large-scale property development, to next-generation PropTech solutions, to a regulated FinTech platform transforming real estate investment through digital tokenization and fractional ownership. United by a shared vision of innovation, transparency, and excellence, York Holding Group continues to shape the future of living, investing, and digital real estate experiences across the region.
B2B Telesales Specialist â€“ Real Estate (KSA Market)
Location:
Remote (Egypt)
Employment Type:
Full-Time
About Us
Dwelleo is an innovative
PropTech platform transforming the Saudi Arabian real estate market
through AI-powered insights, smart listings, and advanced digital solutions for developers, brokers, and property seekers. Our mission is to redefine the way properties are bought, sold, and rented in KSA through a seamless, intelligent digital ecosystem.
As part of our growth, we are expanding our commercial team and are looking for a high-performing
B2B Telesales Specialist
to drive developer and broker onboarding across Saudi Arabia.
Role Summary
The
B2B Telesales Specialist â€“ Real Estate (KSA Market)
will be responsible for driving outbound sales activities, onboarding real estate developers, brokerage firms, and individual brokers onto the Dwelleo platform. This is a high-impact revenue-generating role focused on pipeline development, closing onboarding deals, and growing Dwelleoâ€™s listing ecosystem across Saudi Arabiaâ€”fully remote from Egypt.
Key Responsibilities
B2B Telesales & Onboarding
Identify, target, and engage real estate developers, brokerage firms, and individual brokers across Saudi Arabia.
Conduct high-volume outbound calls, virtual meetings, and follow-ups to convert leads into active partners.
Present Dwelleoâ€™s platform, pricing packages, and AI-powered tools clearly and persuasively.
Negotiate commercial terms, onboarding agreements, and listing packages in line with company policies.
Manage the full sales cycle from lead generation to deal closure and onboarding activation.
Maintain accurate records of activities, pipelines, and conversion data using CRM tools.
Client Relationship Management
Build strong long-term relationships with developers and brokers to ensure recurring listings.
Act as the main point of contact during onboarding and early-stage activation.
Ensure partners are fully trained and supported to maximize platform adoption and performance.
Market Awareness & Growth Support
Monitor the Saudi real estate market and identify new business opportunities.
Track competitors such as Property Finder, Bayut, Wasalt, and Aqaar.
Share market feedback with Product and Marketing teams to improve positioning and performance.
Reporting & Performance
Achieve monthly targets for onboarding volume, revenue, and active listings.
Prepare weekly sales reports covering pipeline status, conversion rates, and market insights.
Collaborate closely with Product, Marketing, and Operations teams for smooth deal execution.
Requirements
Must-Have Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Sales, Marketing, Real Estate, or a related field.
2â€“4 years of experience in B2B sales, telesales, business development, or account management.
Previous experience in PropTech, real estate platforms, SaaS, or digital marketplaces is highly preferred.
Strong understanding of B2B sales with developers, brokers, or property owners.
Fluent English is mandatory (spoken and written) for dealing with KSA clients and international stakeholders.
Proven track record of achieving sales targets.
Highly self-motivated and disciplined for remote work environments.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with or selling to the Saudi real estate market.
Experience using CRM systems.
Understanding of digital marketing, online listings, and lead generation.
Key Competencies
Strong persuasion, negotiation, and closing skills.
Excellent relationship-building ability.
Results-driven and target-oriented mindset.
High level of professionalism and customer focus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tech-driven startup environment.
What We Offer
Competitive salary
Remote-first working model
Full training on Dwelleoâ€™s platform, AI tools, and sales methodology
Opportunity to be part of a fast-scaling PropTech startup targeting the Saudi market

Title: Video Editor
Description:
Description
We are seeking a talented and creative Video Editor to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a keen eye for detail, a passion for storytelling, and a strong understanding of visual aesthetics. As a Video Editor, you will be responsible for transforming raw footage into compelling video content that engages and captivates our audience. You will work closely with our production team to understand project goals, ensuring that all video edits align with our brandâ€™s vision and message. Your role will include collaborating with directors and producers, as well as incorporating feedback to refine video projects. We expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest editing techniques and software, consistently pushing the envelope on creativity while maintaining high standards of efficiency. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and have a portfolio that showcases your skills and versatility, we want to hear from you. Join us as we create stunning visual narratives that leave a lasting impression. Your contribution will play a critical role in enhancing our video content across various platforms, including social media, internal communications, and external marketing campaigns.
Responsibilities
Edit video content for various platforms, ensuring high quality in pacing, rhythm, and visual storytelling.
Collaborate with producers, directors, and other team members to understand project requirements and creative direction.
Storyboard and assemble raw footage, adding music, sound effects, and graphics as needed to enhance the narrative.
Review and revise edits according to feedback from the team, ensuring all changes align with project goals.
Maintain well-organized digital assets, including source files, projects, and completed videos for easy access and future use.
Ensure timely delivery of final edits that meet established deadlines and specifications.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in video editing software and techniques to improve efficiency and creativity.
Requirements
Proven experience as a video editor with a strong portfolio showcasing previous work.
Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.
Solid understanding of color grading, audio editing, and video production workflows.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, as well as independently.
Strong attention to detail and a passion for storytelling through visual media.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Effective communication skills to articulate creative ideas and incorporate feedback constructively.

Title: Customer Service Representative
Description:
Company Description
MAMPACK is a leading Egyptian company specializing in the manufacturing of high-quality cardboard pipes, known as "Alkor," which adhere to international standards. Founded in 2015, the company has built its reputation on delivering exceptional product quality and earning the respect and trust of its customers. With a dedicated team of 30 employees, technicians, and workers, MAMPACK currently achieves a production capacity of 200 tons per month and is continuously expanding its output. The company is committed to excellence, precision, and meeting the needs of its clients, positioning itself as a trusted name in the cardboard tube manufacturing sector.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site Customer Service Representative role based in New Cairo. The Customer Service Representative will be responsible for interacting with customers, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring a positive customer experience. Key daily tasks include handling communications via phone, email, or in-person, providing support for order processing and delivery, and maintaining customer satisfaction by addressing concerns promptly and professionally. Collaboration with other departments to streamline customer-related processes is also a key component of this role.
Qualifications
Proven experience in Customer Service, Customer Support, and managing Customer Satisfaction
Strong understanding of Customer Experience and the ability to foster relationships
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills
Organizational and time management abilities
Ability to work on-site in Qalyub
Fluency in English and Arabic
High school diploma or equivalent; further education is an advantage

Title: ERP -Application Support
Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Application Engineer â€“ ERP with a strong background in ERP systems, Finance, to lead and support ERP implementations and enhancements.
The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the full lifecycle of ERP projects, ensuring system integrity, and delivering solutions that align with business goals.
Job Description
Provide first-line support for ERP application users, resolving technical issues and answering functional queries.
Monitor ERP system performance and proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve application-related problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze, document, and escalate complex issues to higher-level support or vendors as needed.
Assist in the configuration, testing, and deployment of ERP modules and updates.
Maintain detailed records of support requests, resolutions, and system changes using ticketing systems.
Conduct user training sessions and create user guides to enhance ERP system adoption and efficiency.
Participate in system audits and ensure compliance with organizational policies and best practices.
Support data migration, integration, and reporting activities within the ERP environment.
Contribute to process improvement initiatives by identifying recurring issues and recommending solutions.
Stay updated on ERP system enhancements, patches, and industry best practices to ensure optimal system performance.
Job Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Information Systems, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in ERP application support or a similar technical support role (FININCE).
Strong understanding of ERP systems and business processes in multi-industry environments.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.
Effective verbal and written communication skills for user support and documentation.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced, office-based environment.
Experience with ticketing systems and support documentation tools.
Familiarity with database concepts and basic SQL queries.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Willingness to participate in ongoing training and professional development.

Title: Senior Travel Consultant
Description:
Responding to inquiries about our company's services and offering hotels & air
Determining each client's requirements, including destinations, length of stay, and transit time.
Ensuring that clients pay the deposit before you commence with bookings.
Informing clients about the cancellation policy, including salient dates and all penalties.
Ascertaining and adhering to the available budget.
Selecting the most appropriate transport based on the available finances, requisite departure and arrival times, and preferred duration of transit.
Securing accommodation that is best suited to the budget and location of choice.
Planning excursions based on each client's needs and interests.
Accounting for mobility and medical needs during each phase of the trip planning process.

Title: Senior Sales Executive-B2B
Location: El Sadat City, Al Minufiyah, Egypt
Description:
Company Description
Oleo Misr, located in Sadat City, Egypt, is a pioneer in the oleochemical industry in the Middle East and Africa. With roots dating back to 1940, the company is part of a group specializing in edible oils, soap, feed additives, and oleochemicals. Oleo Misr produces eco-friendly products, including soap noodles, distilled and fractionated fatty acids, and pharmaceutical-grade glycerin, all derived from renewable and sustainable raw materials. Guided by a commitment to environmental conservation, the company employs innovative technology, closed-system processes, and effective by-product recycling. With a dedication to quality, sustainability, and partnership, Oleo Misr aims to lead the oleochemicals industry in the region.
Job Responsibilities
- Build and maintain long-term relationships with existing clients and key accounts.
- Identify and approach potential customers in the chemical and manufacturing sectors.
- Conduct regular market visits and meetings to explore new business opportunities.
- Prepare and deliver technical and commercial proposals.
- Negotiate pricing, contracts, and terms of business with customers.
- Collaborate with the business development, marketing, and supply chain teams to ensure smooth order fulfillment.
- Provide accurate sales forecasts, reports, and market feedback to management.
- Stay updated on market trends, competitor activities, and customer requirements.
- Participate in industry exhibitions, trade fairs, and networking events to enhance brand presence.
- Ensure all sales activities align with company policies, ethical standards, and safety regulations.
Qualifications
- 5 years of proven experience in B2B sales of Oleochemicals, Chemicals for different industries.
- Strong background in B2B sales, customer acquisition, and account management.
- Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
- A bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Business, or a related field is preferred.
How to Apply

Title: Plant People Director
Description:
Location:
Suez, EG
Requisition ID: 16006
Why work for us?
Driven by our purpose: Building progress for people and the planet. We are transforming to become the leader in innovative and sustainable building solutions. Holcim US offers an unparalleled range of innovative cement, aggregates, asphalt, concrete products and construction services that have been the foundation for infrastructure projects across the globe. To move the industry forward to a greener future we need people who are passionate about sustainability, are driven to shape and influence perception, and keen to build, grow and thrive in our high-performance culture.
Are you ready to build progress with us?
Plant People Director
Job Purpose
The People Plant Director is accountable for leading the full people agenda at Sokhna Plant ensuring a high-performance culture, strong employee engagement, effective talent development, and robust HR and administrative operations.
The role serves as a strategic business partner to the Plant Director and site leadership team, while ensuring alignment with Lafarge Egyptâ€™s corporate HR strategy and governance.
This position oversees HR Business Partnering, HR Operations, Administration, and third-party workforce management within a complex industrial/manufacturing environment.
Key Responsibilities
Health & Safety:
Adhere to and enforce relevant legislation and policies and ensure that the highest degree of safety and safe working practices are maintained.
2- Functional:
People Strategy & Leadership
Define, deploy, and continuously refine the plant people strategy in line with Lafarge Egyptâ€™s corporate People agenda, industrial priorities, and CPO direction.
Translate business and operational objectives into clear workforce and organizational plans that support safety, productivity, and sustainability.
Lead culture transformation initiatives that reinforce Lafarge values, accountability, performance, and engagement across all plant functions.
Act as a trusted advisor and coach to the Plant Director and the site leadership team on all people-related matters.
Ensure strong governance, ethical conduct, and consistency in people decisions across the plant.
Talent Management & Organizational Development
Lead strategic workforce planning to ensure optimal manpower levels, critical skills availability, and future capability readiness.
Drive talent identification, succession planning, and leadership pipeline development for critical and operational roles.
Oversee performance management cycles, ensuring objective goal setting, quality performance reviews, and effective development plans.
Design and deploy learning, upskilling, and reskilling programs for both white-collar and blue-collar employees, aligned with operational excellence needs.
Support organizational design, role clarity, and structure optimization to enhance efficiency and accountability.
Employee Relations, Labor Stability & Engagement
Ensure a stable, compliant, and constructive labor environment across all plant operations.
Lead collective and individual employee relations matters, including disciplinary actions, grievances, investigations, and conflict resolution.
Act as the final escalation point for complex employee relations and labor law cases at site level.
Drive employee engagement initiatives, engagement survey action plans, and continuous listening mechanisms.
Strengthen internal communication, ensuring transparency, alignment, and trust across all employee segments.
People Operations Excellence
Oversee all People operational activities, including personnel administration, employee lifecycle management, payroll coordination, HR systems, and data accuracy.
Ensure effective implementation of HR policies, procedures, and standards across the plant.
Maintain full compliance with Egyptian labor law, internal controls, audits, and corporate governance requirements.
Monitor HR KPIs, workforce analytics, and reporting to support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure service quality, responsiveness, and operational discipline within the HR Operations team.
Administration & Facilities Management
Lead the Administration function for the plant, covering facilities management, transportation, accommodation, catering, security, and general services.
Ensure safe, efficient, and cost-effective management of plant facilities and services in line with HSE and business standards.
Manage budgets related to administration and general services, ensuring cost control and value optimization.
Oversee contracts and service providers, ensuring service quality, compliance, and SLA performance.
Coordinate closely with HSE, Security, Procurement, and Finance to ensure seamless administrative operations.
Third-Party Workforce & Contractor Management
Oversee third-party labor providers, contractors, and outsourced services supporting plant operations.
Ensure compliance with labor law, HSE requirements, and Lafarge standards for all external workforce.
Monitor headcount, performance, costs, and risks related to outsourced labor.
Drive continuous improvement in contractor workforce productivity, discipline, and engagement.
Business Partnership & Change Leadership
Act as People Business Partner to the Industrial Director and functional leaders, aligning people solutions with operational priorities.
Provide regular insights to the CPO on workforce trends, talent risks, engagement levels, and organizational effectiveness.
Lead and support site-wide change initiatives including restructures, productivity programs, digital transformation, and cultural shifts.
Anticipate people-related risks and proactively propose mitigation actions.
Governance, Risk & Continuous Improvement
Ensure strong people governance, risk management, and compliance across the plant.
Lead internal and external audits related to HR and administration and ensure timely closure of findings.
Drive continuous improvement in HR and administrative processes, service delivery, and employee experience.
Ensure alignment with Lafarge Egypt, regional, and group HR standards and policies.
Education
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or a related discipline.
Postgraduate qualification (MBA, Masterâ€™s in HR Management, Organizational Development, or Industrial Management) is preferred.
Continuous professional development in labor law, leadership, change management, and industrial relations is expected.
Technical Skills:
Strong knowledge of industrial/manufacturing HR and blue-collar workforce management.
In-depth understanding of Egyptian Labor Law and industrial relations.
Expertise in workforce planning, talent management, and performance systems.
Proficient in HRIS systems (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle) and HR operations.
Experience managing facilities, transportation, and administrative services in industrial sites.
Skilled in third-party workforce and contractor management with compliance focus.
Solid background in governance, audit, and compliance related to HR and admin.
Competent in leading change management and organizational effectiveness initiatives.
Experience:
Minimum 13 - 15 years of progressive HR experience, preferably within multinational and industrial/manufacturing environments.
Strong hands-on experience leading HR functions in factory or plant settings with large labor populations.
Proven exposure to administration and facilities management as part of a senior HR role.
Deep expertise in employee relations, engagement, talent management, and organizational development.
Strong leadership, stakeholder management, communication, and analytical skills.
Contacts
Email : eg-m-ta-hr@lafarge.com
Closing Date
30- Jan- 2026
WHO ARE LAFARGE PEOPLE?
Lafarge people are passionate about finding better ways to build. They embrace innovation and improvement with a pioneering spirit. They work as trusted partners, creating better solutions and experiences for their customers, communities, and colleagues.
Your Lafarge Experience
At Lafarge, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether youâ€™re in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us youâ€™ll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. Youâ€™ll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas, and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because itâ€™s only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in.

Title: Sponsorship Sales Manager
Description:
Company Description
HUMM Studios is a dynamic media company creating captivating long and short-form digital culinary content for the Arabic-speaking audience. Since 2018, our passionate and diverse team has produced thousands of innovative content pieces, including recipe videos, tutorials, podcasts, shows, styled photoshoots, ad campaigns, and educational materials. With over 400 million collective views and nearly 2 million followers across platforms, our food-centric content resonates with audiences through inspiring and creative storytelling. All our productions are crafted in-house, delivering high-quality experiences tailored for an engaged and growing community.
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Sponsorship Sales Manager, based in Cairo, Egypt. The Sponsorship Sales Manager will oversee identifying and securing sponsorship opportunities by building and nurturing relationships with clients. Responsibilities include generating leads, developing new business strategies, negotiating sponsorship deals, managing client accounts, and ensuring the delivery of sponsorship commitments. The role will play a key role in aligning client goals with the creative capabilities of HUMM Studios.
Qualifications
Proven experience in Sponsorship Sales and developing creative partnership proposals
Skills in New Business Development and Lead Generation
Strong expertise in Sales with the ability to achieve and exceed revenue targets
Proficiency in Account Management, including building long-term client relationships
Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
Ability to identify opportunities and provide innovative solutions aligning with company capabilities
Background in media, advertising, or a relevant field is a plus
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field

Title: Moderator and Customer Service
Description:
About Ben Soliman Classic Suits
Ben Soliman Classic Suits is a distinguished menswear brand celebrated for its craftsmanship, precision tailoring, and timeless sophistication. Our collections redefine classic elegance for the modern gentleman through attention to detail and premium quality.
Overview
The Social Media Specialist will be responsible for managing customer interactions across social media platforms, handling inquiries and closing orders, coordinating with inventory and shipping teams, and ensuring an exceptional customer experience from first contact to final delivery.
Key Responsibilities

Convert inquiries into successful sales and process orders professionally

Maintain positive brand image and ensure customer satisfaction

(or relevant experience in retail customer service can be accepted)
Previous experience in customer service or online sales, preferably in fashion retail
Good understanding of inventory coordination and shipping processes

Ability to multitask and stay organized under pressure
Excellent written communication in Arabic (brand-appropriate tone)

Title: Key Account Specialist
Description:
About Abbott
Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve peopleâ€™s health. Weâ€™re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.
Working at Abbott
At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You will have access to :
Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.
The Opportunity
This position works out of our [Alexandria, Egypt] in the Established Pharmaceutical Division where we are committed to bringing the benefits of our trusted medicines to more people in the worldâ€™s fastest-growing countries. Our broad portfolio of high-quality and differentiated branded generic medicines reaches across multiple therapeutic areas including gastroenterology, women's health, cardiometabolic, pain management/central nervous system, and respiratory.
What Youâ€™ll Do :
Manages and develops assigned Chain Key customers with handling implementation of Trade Marketing activities perspective to build strong relationships with key customers.
The Opportunity
Implements a common Trade marketing plan to optimize Trade Key Accounts (Chain Pharmacies) & eCommerce channels for local markets.
Define and develop Key chain strategies and tactics (such as merchandising recommendations and materials) to stimulate Abbottâ€™s brands availability, visibility and recommendation rates, bridging Abbottâ€™s brandsâ€™ strategy and customersâ€™ needs,
Main Responsibilities
Develops a structured commercial offering locally with a strong emphasis to :
Strengthen and grow our brands in the chain sectors.
Understand switch level in key Chain Channels.
Build Pharmacy Loyalty and advocacy perspectives in key chain channels.
To liaise, build and develop relationships with key purchasers in chain sector, and optimize services to Abbott in return.
Devise and propose promotional plans that maximize sales in your assigned chains and ensure timely execution.
Performance Analysis and Reporting : Monitoring Chains performance against key performance indicators (KPIs) and sales targets. Analyzing sales data, and competitor activities to identify areas for improvement and formulate actionable insights. Preparing reports and presenting findings to management.
Relationship Management : Building and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders, including all key healthcare professionals, and regulatory authorities. Resolving escalated customer issues, addressing complaints, and maintaining customer satisfaction.
Manage relationships with key pharmacy chain buyers and stakeholders.
Ensure product listings, shelf positioning, and in-store execution follow Abbottâ€™s brand and merchandising guidelines.
Implement chain-specific activities to drive brand visibility and availability, including new product launches.
Ensure all trade activities comply with legal and regulatory standards, especially for Rx products
Provide insights for demand forecasting and business planning.
Required Qualifications
Required : Advanced Degree in Science, business studies, or related areas.
Preferred Qualifications
Minimum 3 years of sales experience, with relevant expertise and a strong background in key account management.
Proactive and innovative mindset, with the ability to develop and implement creative solutions.
Comprehensive industry knowledge acquired in a multinational company.
English fluency is essential.
Computer literate.
Demonstrated ability to influence relationships and leverage knowledge internally across a matrix structure to optimize opportunities with customers and achieve shared goals.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ensure business continuity.
Success in particular assigned marketing campaign.
The candidate must be based on Alexandria.

Title: Motor sales insurance
Description:
Company Description
Amanleek is dedicated to transforming the insurance industry by making services more accessible and transparent for individuals and businesses. The company leverages innovation and technology to meet the evolving needs of the insurance market. Amanleek focuses on delivering a seamless and trustworthy experience for all its customers. Its solutions are designed to simplify insurance processes and provide products that address the unique needs of a diverse audience.
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Motor Sales Insurance professional based in Cairo. The primary responsibilities include managing motor insurance sales, building strong customer relationships, providing exceptional customer service, and meeting sales targets. The role involves identifying potential customers, understanding their needs, and presenting suitable insurance products. Additionally, the candidate will collaborate with other team members to enhance overall sales strategies and participate in sales-related training programs to ensure continuous improvement.
Qualifications
Strong Communication and Customer Service skills to engage with clients effectively and ensure a positive customer experience
Proficiency in Sales and Sales Management to meet targets and strategize successfully
Ability to work collaboratively with a team and independently to achieve business goals
Familiarity with insurance products, particularly motor insurance, is a plus
Knowledge of the insurance market and its evolving trends

Title: Customer Support (English)
Description:
The vacancy is for a Contact Center Representative at Teleperformance Egypt for one of our projects, as we are hiring for different projects, and you will be assigned to one of our projects depending on your English level.
Work conditions:
The shift is 9 hours rotational including a 1-hour break & 2 days off rotational.
The last shift for females ends at 2 AM.
The work location will be in the New Cairo sites, Mohandseen, or One Kattameya sites depending on the project you will join (English level) & we do provide Transportations all over many points in Cairo and Giza.
Salary:
-The salary range is up to 19K EGP including KPIs. You will be receiving your KPIs in the Euro equivalent in EGP.
Other benefits:
-Social insurance.
-Medical insurance up to 400k coverage per year.
-Career Path throughout an internal development program.
-Refer a friend program.
-Overnight allowance.
-Transportation provided all over Cairo and Giza. (door-to-door transportation for females after 11:00 PM)
-VPN line.
-Discounts in many stores all over Egypt.
-Discounted Gym Access.

Title: Senior E-commerce
Description:
Company Description
Ch & Be is an Egyptian company dedicated to creating professional hairstyling products that offer women a hassle-free way to achieve their desired look. The brand focuses on simplicity and accessibility, empowering individuals to embrace their personal style with ease. With a vision to expand into the full beauty spectrum, Ch & Be is committed to innovative solutions that enhance beauty and self-expression.
Role Description
This is a
full-time, on-site
Senior E-commerce role based in
Nasr City Cairo, Egypt.
The role involves managing e-commerce operations, analyzing performance data, enhancing the customer shopping experience, implementing growth strategies, and overseeing online sales. The senior professional will collaborate with cross-functional teams and lead initiatives to drive sales growth and improve customer satisfaction.

- Manage product listings, pricing, content, and keyword optimization on Amazon & Noon.
- Monitor and improve product rankings, sales performance, and inventory.
- Coordinate with operations and logistics to ensure stock availability and timely fulfillment.
- Create and manage advertising campaigns (PPC) to maximize ROI.
- Analyze data and performance metrics to drive growth and profitability.
- Handle account health, returns, disputes, and ensure compliance with marketplace policies.
- Develop strategies for expansion across new platforms (e.g., Jumia, B-tech ,etc).
Qualifications
3+ years experience
managing Amazon & Noon seller accounts.
Proven leadership skills and the ability to manage and guide a team effectively
Experience in the beauty or retail industry is a plus
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field

Job Summary
Assists in the oversight of the daily shift operations of Housekeeping, Recreation/Health Club and, if applicable, Laundry. Works with employees to ensure property guestrooms, public space and employee areas are clean and well maintained. Completes inspections and holds people accountable for corrective action. Position assists in ensuring guest and employee satisfaction while maintaining the operating budget.
CANDIDATE PROFILE
Education And Experience
High school diploma or GED; 1 year experience in the housekeeping or related professional area.
OR
2-year degree from an accredited university in Hotel and Restaurant Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related major; no work experience required.
CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
Assisting in Managing Housekeeping Operations
Ensures guest room status is communicated to the Front Desk in a timely and efficient manner.
Works effectively with the Engineering department on guestroom maintenance needs.
Supervises the property general cleaning schedule.
Obtains list of rooms to be cleaned immediately and list of prospective check-outs or discharges to prepare work assignments.
Inventories stock to ensure adequate supplies.
Assists in the supervision of daily Housekeeping shift operations and ensures compliance with all housekeeping policies, standards and procedures.
Assists in the ordering of guestroom supplies, cleaning supplies and uniforms.
Supports and supervises an effective inspection program for all guestrooms and public space.
Communicates areas that need attention to staff and follows up to ensure understanding.
Ensures all employees have proper supplies, equipment and uniforms.
Managing Departmental Costs
Participates in the management of the departmentâ€™s controllable expenses to achieve or exceed budgeted goals.
Understands the impact of departmentâ€™s operations on the overall property financial goals and objectives and manages to achieve or exceed budgeted goals.
Comprehends budgets, operating statements and payroll progress reports as needed to assist in the financial management of department.
Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service
Responds to and handles guest problems and complaints.
Strives to improve service performance.
Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service.
Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement.
Conducting Human Resources Activities
Participates as needed in the investigation of employee accidents.
Supervises staffing levels to ensure that guest service, operational needs, and financial objectives are met.
Ensures employees understand expectations and parameters.
Ensures property policies are administered fairly and consistently, disciplinary procedures and documentation are completed according to Standard and Local Operating Procedures (SOPs and LSOPs) and support the Peer Review Process.
Observes service behaviors of employees and provides feedback to individuals.
Uses all available on the job training tools to train new room attendants and provide follow-up training as necessary.
Participates in the employee performance appraisal process, providing feedback as needed.
Assists as needed in the interviewing and hiring of employee team members with the appropriate skills.
Supports a departmental orientation program for employees to receive the appropriate new hire training to successfully perform their job.
Participates in employee progressive discipline procedures.

Title: RAMS Engineer
Description:
Job Purpose
As part of the Engineering team, the RAMS (Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, and Safety) Engineer is responsible for ensuring that all metro and LRT systems, subsystems, infrastructure, and assets comply with performance, reliability, and safety standards across their lifecycle. The role is essential in minimizing system downtime, enhancing operational safety, and ensuring full compliance with international railway standards and company requirements.
Responsibilities/Duties
Profil de candidat recherchÃ© :
RAMS Planning & Strategy
Develop and implement comprehensive RAMS plans for metro and LRT systems, subsystems, and infrastructure assets.
Define and communicate RAMS requirements in collaboration with design, operations, and maintenance teams.
Contribute to establishing RAMS targets and performance indicators to support long-term asset reliability and safety goals.
Reliability & Availability Analysis
Conduct reliability predictions and Failure Modes, Effects, and Criticality Analyses (FMEA/FMECA).
Monitor system performance and availability, analyzing trends to identify causes of downtime or reduced reliability.
Recommend technical and procedural improvements to enhance system uptime and reduce failures.
Maintainability Assessment
Evaluate maintenance requirements and design maintainability for new or modified assets.
Support maintenance optimization, spare parts planning, and corrective/preventive maintenance strategies.
Propose design modifications that enhance ease of maintenance and lifecycle cost efficiency.
Safety Engineering
Perform hazard identification, risk assessment, and safety analysis (HAZOP, HAZID) in collaboration with the Railway Safety Department.
Ensure full compliance with international railway safety standards (EN 50126, EN 50128, EN 50129).
Support safety case preparation and verification of risk mitigation measures.
Verification & Validation
Participate in system testing, commissioning, and acceptance activities to validate RAMS requirements.
Analyze field data and simulation results to confirm compliance with reliability and safety objectives.
Provide technical input during design reviews and validation workshops.
Documentation & Reporting
Prepare detailed RAMS documentation including reports, safety cases, and technical records.
Manage the asset condition assessment process within the RAMS scope.
Interface with regulatory authorities, certification bodies, and internal stakeholders for RAMS submissions.
Utilize appropriate analytical tools, including AI-assisted platforms, to enhance RAMS evaluations and reporting accuracy.
Safety Responsibilities
Promote a positive safety culture within the workplace and attend any safety-related meetings or briefings as required within the job role.
Comply with the requirements of RDMC RQHSE Policy and Safety Management System.
Be mindful that Safety, Security, and Environmental protection are everyoneâ€™s responsibility.
All staff members are accountable for reporting and intervening in any Safety, Security, or Environmental violations.
Qualifications
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering (or equivalent).
Knowledge
In-depth knowledge of metro and rail systems (rolling stock, signaling, SCADA, power supply, and communications).
Proficiency with CMMS platforms (e.g., IBM Maximo), fault diagnostics, and analytical reporting tools.
Strong understanding of maintenance and safety procedures, work permits, and emergency response protocols.
Experience
3â€“5 years of proven experience in RAMS engineering, preferably within metro, LRT, or transportation projects.
Desired Behaviors & Experiences
Familiarity with international railway safety standards (IEC, EN 5012x, or equivalent).
Certification in reliability engineering (e.g., CMRP or equivalent) is an advantage.
Experience using RAMS software tools (Isograph, ReliaSoft, RAM Commander, or similar).
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and data interpretation skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.
Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration within cross-functional technical teams.
Experience with metro system components (rolling stock, signaling, power, or infrastructure) is considered a plus.

Title: Employee Life Cycle Associate Manager
Description:
JOB TITLE
Employee Life Cycle Associate Maanager | MAF Global Solutions | Global Solutions
Role Summary
The Employee Life Cycle Associate Manager will act as back up for the Offboarding Head in all tasks & issues related to offboarding, will be also assisting team members with questions and escalations, Managing the work assignments allocation of onboarding function for UAE all Non-Retail Operating Companies. Will handle periodical review of all offboarding operations with the respective stakeholders.
ROLE PROFILE
Supervises the Offboarding team of UAE.
Works closely on allocating offboarding tickets among a team of offboarding officers.
Analyses current systems issues to figure out operational gaps & initiate corrective recommendations that lead to a smooth onboarding process.
Acts as a first point of escalation and acts towards solving all issues and turning the negatives experience into a positive one.
Conducts quality checks on the offboarding team to make sure that they are following the policies and procedures through checking random samples & running system reports.
Assists the Employee Life Cycle tower lead & Offboarding Manager in drafting offboarding processes.
Provides coaching and timely feedback to the team.
Ensures the team members comply with MAF values, ethics, policies & procedures.
Requirements
A minimum of 5 years of HR relevant experience.
Graduate in a relevant discipline.
SuccessFactors knowledge.
Knowledge of local / Regional labor laws.
Customer Focus and Stakeholder Management.
Reporting and People Management skills.
What We Offer
At Majid Al Futtaim, weâ€™re on a mission to create great moments, to spread happiness, to build, experiences that stay in our memories for a lifetime. Weâ€™re proud to say that over the past 27 years, we have built a reputation as a regional market leader in what we do. Join us!
Work in a friendly environment, where everyone shares positive vibes and excited about our future.
Work with over 45,000 diverse and talented colleagues, all guided by our Leadership Model.

Title: Distributor Development and RTC Manager

The Distributor & RtC Development Manager will be responsible for developing and managing relationships with distributors to ensure the effective distribution of ABC portfolio to enhance market growth. This role involves strategic planning, performance analysis, and lead the deployment of RTC transformation in cooperation with diverse business functions and playing a crucial role in ensuring all activities are conducted ethically and compliantly in accordance with competition authoritiesâ€™ regulations.

Sustain Customer Centricity approach via build and maintain strong relationships with existing RtC partners and potential ones
Full responsibility on Winning with Distributors journey to achieve sales targets and market growth â€œSegmentation, plan, develop, track and rewardâ€
Monitor distributor performance and provide regular feedback and support.
Effectively analyses financial reports to drive revenue management growth & data driven value creation.
Build, develop and implement successful distribution agreements, ensuring compliance, manage timely, renewal, updates, and termination â€œif anyâ€
Increases market share without assuming a monopolistic/dominant position.
Monitors and responds to competitor plans and actions.

Liaise communicate clearly with key internal stakeholders to ensure optimum deployment of RtC transformation
Boost distribution power with Traditional and Organized trade heads based on different markets strategy
Ensure with the Commercial Excellence and TM that we have updated TC and ongoing monitoring the SFP
Embed digital development with e-business manager to reach smooth transaction capture as a data driven sales
Coordinate with CSLP to close the inner and outer loop for distributors` pain-points, ensure that response rate and Net Promotor Score â€œNPSâ€ are in line with OpCo ambition
Ensure cross functional alignment to boost distribution power and maintain long-term relationships with our RtC partners via Distribution Network Design, Trade Terms and Joint Business planning
Coordinate with logistics team to manages the supply across breweries and secondary warehouses in line with sales targets and opportunities.
Coordinates with the Trade Marketing team to provide appropriate assistance and the development of an activation schedule and propose TM calendar
Meets with the marketing department on a regular basis to introduce opportunities, growth ideas and demand spaces based on customer and consumer needs, and market insights.
Effectively managing the production plan cycle(s) and RPM with RSMs and planning team
Education & Experiences
Educational Background
Bachelorâ€™s degree in business administration is preferable

Qualifications & Other Requirements
Excellent Command of English Language
Advanced Microsoft Skills

Strong analytical and strategic planning skills

Project Management skills

Core Functional Competencies
Customer at the Center
The ability to consistently generate customer insights that drive winning customer strategies and plans, increase customer engagement and improve Customer Satisfaction
Channel & Customer Development
The ability to efficiently manage & develop fragmented trade customers from planning through to execution
Route to Market Strategy & Understanding
The ability to drive the availability of our products and service our customers via an optimal mix of direct, indirect and digital channels, optimizing total value chain profitability.
Distributor Management
The ability to effectively and efficiently select, manage and develop distributors to deliver our Route to Consumer strategy and drive execution via our Distributors
Personal Skills
Strategic Thinking
Team Developer
Analytical Skills
Interpersonal & Communication Skills
Negotiation Skills
Customer Centric

Title: Insurance Producer
Description:
Company Description
MetLife, established in 1868, is a leading global financial services provider, offering insurance, annuities, employee benefits, and asset management solutions. With operations in over 40 markets worldwide, MetLife holds strong positions in key regions such as the United States, Japan, Latin America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East. Committed to helping customers navigate the complexities of life, MetLife is transforming to deliver greater value through innovative, flexible products and services. By prioritizing simpler, more intuitive experiences, MetLife aims to meet the evolving needs of individuals and institutions. Guided by a mission to build financial security, MetLife continues to focus on being a dependable partner in an ever-changing world.
Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role for an Insurance Producer based in Cairo, Egypt, with the flexibility for some remote work. The Insurance Producer will be responsible for selling insurance products and services, assisting customers in identifying their insurance needs, and providing professional advice on suitable coverage options. The role involves maintaining strong customer relationships, addressing inquiries promptly, and explaining employee benefits and insurance policies clearly. The Insurance Producer will also work collaboratively with internal teams to meet sales targets and contribute to overall company goals.
Qualifications
Strong background in Insurance Sales and expertise in insurance products and services
Exceptional Communication and active listening skills
Proven experience in Customer Service with a customer-centric approach
Understanding of Employee Benefits to assist customers in selecting suitable options
Ability to build and nurture long-term customer relationships
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to meet sales targets
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field is preferred
Previous experience in the insurance or financial services sector is an advantage
