Title: Senior Technical Lead Product Owner VOIS
Description:
Who We Are
VOIS (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value for customers by delivering intelligent solutions through Talent, Technology & Transformation.
As the largest shared services organisation in the global telco industry with 30,000 FTE, our portfolio of next-generation solutions and services are designed in partnership with customers across Vodafone Group, local markets, and partner markets to simplify and drive growth. With our strategic partner Accenture, we work alongside our Vodafone customers, other Telco and tech companies to drive transformation, meet the challenges of our industry and ensure we stay relevant and resilient. This partnership is a unique, industry-first model which brings together the best of in-house and 3rd party capability.
We work with customers across 28 countries from 10 VOIS locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Spain, Turkey, UK, Germany, Ireland, and with a network of teams in Czech Republic, Italy, Greece, and Portugal.
#VOIS #BeUnrivalled #CreateTheFuture
About This Role
We are seeking a
Technical Product Owner
to act as the bridge between technical teams and business stakeholders. You will own the end-to-end delivery of the product roadmap, ensuring high-quality technical solutions aligned with business objectives. This role involves leading technical planning, prioritising features, and translating business needs into actionable technical specifications.
What You Will Do
Own and manage the product backlog, defining and prioritising features.
Translate business requirements into technical solutions in collaboration with developers.
Lead sprint planning sessions and ensure alignment with product goals.
Drive product strategy, balancing technical debt, feature development, and customer needs.
Provide technical guidance on architecture, design, and tool selection.
Mentor and support technical teams, fostering collaboration and innovation.
Ensure adherence to coding standards, perform code reviews, and enforce best practices.
Communicate progress, risks, and updates to stakeholders regularly.
Deliver high-quality features on time and adapt to changing business requirements.
Who You Are
Experienced in technical roles (8+ years), including development and product ownership.
Skilled in Object-Oriented Programming (Java, Spring Boot), Microservices, and Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
Proficient in RESTful APIs, CI/CD pipelines, caching, and performance tuning.
Familiar with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and backlog management.Strong communicator with leadership and mentorship abilities.
Holds a Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Proactive, calm under pressure, and able to manage multiple priorities effectively.
Not a perfect fit?
Concerned you may not meet every requirement? Vodafone is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are excited about this role but your experience does not align exactly with every aspect of the job description, you are encouraged to apply. You may be the right candidate for this or another opportunity, and the recruitment team will support you in exploring where your skills fit best.
What's In It For You
Opportunity to lead technical product delivery in a global organisation.
Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and large-scale systems.
Collaborative work environment with continuous learning and innovation.
Career growth through leadership and technical mentorship opportunities.
What Skills You Will Learn
Advanced product ownership and Agile practices.
Technical leadership and architecture decision-making.
Cloud-native solutions and microservices design.
Performance optimisation and scalable system design.
VOIS Equal Opportunity Employer Commitment
Vodafone recognises and celebrates the value of diversity in building a workforce that reflects the customers and communities it serves. No form of discrimination is tolerated. This includes, but is not limited to, discrimination based on race, colour, age, veteran status, gender, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, ethnicity, disability, religion or belief, political affiliation, trade union membership, nationality, citizenship, indigenous status, medical condition, HIV status, neurodiversity, social origin, cultural background, marital or civil partnership status, or socio-economic background.
Join Us
At Vodafone, weâ€™re working hard to build a better future. A more connected, inclusive and sustainable world. As a dynamic global community, it's our human spirit, together with technology, that empowers us to achieve this.
We challenge and innovate in order to connect people, businesses, and communities across the world. Delighting our customers and earning their loyalty drive us, and we experiment, learn fast and get it done, together.
With us, you can truly be yourself and belong, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive, and make a real difference.

Description:

The position is suited to individuals who thrive in dynamic environments and are flexible with international assignments
Job Summary
Accountable for the quality, consistency and production of the restaurant kitchen. Exhibits culinary talents by personally performing tasks while leading the staff and managing all food related functions. Coordinates menus, purchasing, staffing and food preparation for the property's restaurant. Works with team to improve guest and employee satisfaction while maintaining the operating budget. Must ensure sanitation and food standards are achieved. Develops and trains team to improve results.
CANDIDATE PROFILE
Education And Experience
High school diploma or GED; 4 years experience in the culinary, food and beverage, or related professional area.
OR
2-year degree from an accredited university in Culinary Arts, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 2 years experience in the culinary, food and beverage, or related professional area.
CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
Ensuring Culinary Standards And Responsibilities Are Met For Restaurant
Develops, designs, or creates new applications, ideas, relationships, systems, or products, including artistic contributions for restaurant.
Supervises restaurant kitchen shift operations and ensures compliance with all Food & Beverage policies, standards and procedures.
Maintains food preparation handling and correct storage standards.
Recognizes superior quality products, presentations and flavor.
Plans and manages food quantities and plating requirements for the restaurant.
Communications production needs to key personnel.
Assists in developing daily and seasonal menu items for the restaurant.
Ensures compliance with all applicable laws and regulations regulations.
Follows proper handling and right temperature of all food products.
Estimates daily restaurant production needs.
Prepares and cooks foods of all types, either on a regular basis or for special guests or functions.
Checks the quality of raw and cooked food products to ensure that standards are met.
Determines how food should be presented and creates decorative food displays.
Leading Kitchen Team
Supervises and coordinates activities of cooks and workers engaged in food preparation.
Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example.
Leads shift teams while personally preparing food items and executing requests based on required specifications.
Supervises and manages restaurant kitchen employees. Managing all day-to-day operations. Understanding employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence.
Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
Serving as a role model to demonstrate appropriate behaviors.
Ensuring and maintaining the productivity level of employees.
Ensures employees are cross-trained to support successful daily operations.
Ensures employees understand expectations and parameters.
Establishes and maintains open, collaborative relationships with employees and ensures employees do the same within the team.
Establishing and Maintaining Restaurant Kitchen Goals
Sets and supports achievement of kitchen goals including performance goals, budget goals, team goals, etc.
Developing specific guidance and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish daily kitchen operations work.
Understands the impact of kitchen operation on the overall property financial goals and objectives and manages to achieve or exceed budgeted goals.
Effectively investigates, reports and follows-up on employee accidents.
Knows and implements company safety standards.
Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service
Provides services that are above and beyond for customer satisfaction and retention.
Manages day-to-day operations, ensuring the quality, standards and meeting the expectations of the customers on a daily basis.
Improves service by communicating and assisting individuals to understand guest needs, providing guidance, feedback, and individual coaching when needed.
Sets a positive example for guest relations.
Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement.
Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service.
Handles guest problems and complaints.
Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.
Managing and Conducting Human Resource Activities
Identifies the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.
Participates in training restaurant staff on menu items including ingredients, preparation methods and unique tastes.
Manages employee progressive discipline procedures.
Participates in the employee performance appraisal process, providing feedback as needed.
Uses all available on the job training tools for employees.
Assists as needed in the interviewing and hiring of employee team members with appropriate skills.
Additional Responsibilities
Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.
Analyzes information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
Attends and participates in all pertinent meetings.

Title: Centralized Control Technician
Description:
Job Purpose
The Centralized Control Technician supports the maintenance, reliability, and operational readiness of the Centralized Control subsystems, including ATS, SCADA, ECO, and VCP. The role ensures that these systems remain in optimal condition to support safe and efficient operations across Cairo Metro Line 3 stations, tunnels, and workshops.
The position involves conducting preventive and corrective maintenance, troubleshooting faults, replacing or repairing defective parts, and carrying out safety tests. It requires strict adherence to safety standards and established procedures, while also providing timely responses to equipment malfunctions to minimize operational disruptions.
Responsibilities/Duties
Profil de candidat recherchÃ© :
Maintenance & Technical Support
Perform preventive and corrective maintenance activities on Centralized Control subsystems across all sites.
Conduct inspections, safety checks, and testing of Centralized Control systems to ensure reliability.
Troubleshoot malfunctions, identify root causes, and carry out necessary repairs or replacements.
Respond promptly to equipment failures and ensure quick resolution to minimize downtime.
Install, adjust, and test system components when required.
Tools, Equipment & Resources
Ensure all maintenance tools, equipment, and devices are in proper working condition.
Monitor and maintain stock levels, initiating supply orders when necessary.
Maintain a clean, safe, and organized working area at all times.
Compliance & Safety
Adhere to health, safety, and environmental standards, ensuring safe working practices.
Report any environmental, safety, or operational issues immediately to the Executive Maintenance team.
Ensure all tasks comply with established maintenance and safety procedures.
Coordination & Reporting
Assist the Centralized Control Supervisor in planning and executing maintenance activities.
Supervise subcontractors, ensuring proper execution of preventive maintenance plans.
Prepare accurate reports and document all maintenance activities carried out.
Provide clear communication and updates to management on system status and task completion.
Undertake any other related duties assigned in support of Centralized Control operations.
Qualifications
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or equivalent; Telecom or Electrical certification preferred.
Physically fit to handle time-sensitive and hands-on maintenance tasks.
Knowledge
General technical knowledge across electrical and communication domains.
Awareness of maintenance practices, methods, and processes.
Railway or metro industry knowledge is preferred.
Familiarity with Centralized Control subsystems (Light Current, ATS, SCADA, Networking).
Ability to read and interpret technical blueprints and drawings.
Strong troubleshooting skills for control system malfunctions.
Working knowledge of common tools, appliances, and devices.
Ability to use maintenance tools and basic PC applications.
Capable of writing simple technical reports, business correspondence, and drawings as needed.
Experience
3-5 years of experience as a maintenance technician.
Experience in centralized control maintenance within railway or metro environments is a plus.
Desired Behaviors & Experiences
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability.
Team-oriented mindset with willingness to support colleagues.
Positive attitude, enthusiasm, and adaptability to change.
Self-motivated with initiative to contribute proactively.
Resilient and able to remain calm under pressure.
Organized, reliable, and attentive to detail.
Effective communicator with good interpersonal skills.
Commitment to continuous learning and personal growth.

Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
We are hiring a Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Next-gen operations at scale, with pure Python infra-as-code, from bare metal to containers and applications. Our goal is to perfect enterprise infrastructure devops.
We run hundreds of private cloud, Kubernetes, and application clusters for customers across physical and public cloud estate, and we are raising the bar on what's possible with automation by embracing a universal operator pattern and model-driven operations.
To succeed in this role you need to believe in automation as a pure software engineering problem, not a hack-it-till-it-works-for-me problem. You need to be interested in the scientific approach to operations at scale, driven by metrics and code, and you need to be able to learn the entire stack, from bare metal networking and kernel up to serverless and open source applications.
Location: Globally remote role
The role entails
Our cloud operations engineers bring Python software-engineering skills and rigour to the operations domain. We practise devsecops from bare metal to application. We architect and run OpenStack, Kubernetes and software defined storage, and we enable devsecops for applications running on that infrastructure too.
To become a member of this team, you need to be a software engineer fluent in Python, you need a genuine interest in the full open source infrastructure stack from metal to containers, and you need the ability to work in a high pressure operations environment with mission-critical services for global brand name customers.
As a member of the team you will gain experience in a broad range of cloud technologies. We evolve our offerings as the state of the art improves, so you get to stay current with the latest capabilities in open source infrastructure. We drive upgrades to keep our customers on the latest, best solutions.
What we are looking for in you
Degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science
Experience with Linux and familiarity with Linux networking and storage
Python software development expertise
Operational experience
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long
Nice-to-have skills
Experience with OpenStack or Kubernetes deployment or operations
Familiarity with public or private cloud management
What we offer colleagues
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Establishes and maintains open, collaborative relationships with employees and ensures employees do the same within the team.
Ensures property policies are administered fairly and consistently.
Communicates performance expectations in accordance with job descriptions for each position.
Recognizes success performance and produces desired results.
Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service
Provides services that are above and beyond for customer satisfaction and retention.
Manages day-to-day operations, ensuring the quality, standards and meeting the expectations of the customers on a daily basis.
Sets a positive example for guest relations.
Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service.
Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.
Handles guest problems and complaints.
Maintaining Culinary Goals
Achieves and exceeds goals including performance goals, budget goals, team goals, etc.
Develops specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.
Utilizes the Labor Management System to effectively schedule to business demands and for tracking of employee time and attendance.
Trains employees in safety procedures.
Managing and Conducting Human Resource Activities
Identifies the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.
Improves service by communicating and assisting individuals to understand guest needs, providing guidance, feedback, and individual coaching when needed.
Participates in the employee performance appraisal process, providing feedback as needed.
Brings issues to the attention of the department manager and Human Resources as necessary.
Additional Responsibilities
Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.
Analyzes information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
Attends and participates in all pertinent meetings.

Title: senior odoo implementer
Description:
Job Description: Senior Odoo Implementer
Location: Nasr City
Job Type: Full-time
Experience Level: Senior
About the Role:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior Odoo Implementer to join our dynamic team. In this pivotal role, you will be the key driver in deploying, customizing, and optimizing Odoo ERP solutions for our diverse clientele. You will act as a strategic partner, analyzing complex business processes and translating them into efficient, scalable, and tailored Odoo systems. If you are passionate about technology, excel in client interaction, and thrive on delivering transformative business solutions, we encourage you to apply.
Key Responsibilities:
End-to-End Implementation Leadership:
Lead the entire Odoo implementation lifecycle, from initial discovery and requirements gathering to go-live and post-launch support.
Analyze client business processes, identify inefficiencies, and design optimal workflows within Odoo.
Configure and customize core Odoo modules (Sales, CRM, Inventory, Accounting, Manufacturing, HR, etc.) to meet precise client specifications.
Plan and execute data migration strategies from legacy systems to Odoo, ensuring data integrity.
Client Management & Consultation:
Serve as the primary functional point of contact for clients, building strong, trusted advisor relationships.
Conduct interactive workshops, demonstrations, and training sessions for end-users at all levels.
Manage client expectations, provide expert consultation, and ensure high levels of satisfaction throughout the project.
Solution Design & Technical Execution:
Develop detailed functional design documents for customizations and integrations.
Collaborate closely with the technical development team to scope, design, and test custom modules.
Design and build custom reports, dashboards, and KPIs to provide actionable business insights.
Integrate Odoo with various third-party applications (e.g., payment gateways, e-commerce platforms, logistics systems) using APIs.
Quality Assurance & Continuous Improvement:
Perform rigorous unit, integration, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure flawless delivery.
Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and propose enhancement solutions post-implementation.
Stay updated with the latest Odoo features and best practices to provide cutting-edge solutions.
Qualifications & Requirements:
Experience:
3+ years of proven experience in successfully leading and delivering end-to-end Odoo implementations.
Deep functional expertise in multiple Odoo modules (e.g., Sales, Inventory, Accounting, CRM, Project, Manufacturing).
Strong background in business process analysis, re-engineering, and workflow automation.
Technical Proficiency:
Expert-level knowledge in Odoo configuration and administration.
Hands-on experience with data migration tools and managing PostgreSQL databases (writing basic queries is essential).
Practical experience with integration methodologies (REST/XML-RPC APIs) and connecting Odoo to third-party services.
Proficiency in designing custom reports using Odoo's QWeb, Pivot, and Graph views.
Soft Skills:
Exceptional client-facing communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts clearly.
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Strong project management and time-management skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
A team player mindset with a proactive and results-driven attitude.
Preferred Qualifications:
Odoo Functional Certification is a significant advantage.
Very good command of English (written, listening, and spoken).
What We Offer:
A competitive salary package with performance-based bonuses.
Continuous professional development opportunities, including certifications and training.
A chance to work on challenging and diverse projects with a portfolio of clients.
A collaborative, innovative, and supportive work environment.
Opportunity to be a key player in a growing team and make a significant impact.

Title: Full Professor / Associate Professor / Lecturer in Physical Therapy for Orthopedics diseases and its Surgeries
Description:
Position: Full Professor / Associate Professor / Lecturer in Physical Therapy for Orthopedics diseases and its Surgeries (Full time)
Duties & Responsibilities:
As a faculty member, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the growth and development of our faculty. Some of the key responsibilities include:
1. Delivering high-quality, innovative, and student-centered courses in both foundational and specialized areas of the degree program.
2. Participating in the preparation of the program for accreditation and other quality initiatives, ensuring excellence in education.
3. Engaging with stakeholders in the professional community to support teaching, research, and professional development as well as supporting in building a network for internships and practical onsite training.
4. Collaborating with various committees at the program, faculty, and university level, actively contributing to the academic community.
5. Serving as a student advisor, providing guidance and support to students throughout their academic journey.
6. Contributing to the development of research capacity within the faculty, fostering a culture of inquiry and innovation.
Successful candidate will be responsible for teaching courses of Physical Therapy for traumatology, PT for Orthopedic Diseases and its Surgeries, and Physical Therapy for Sport injuries.
Essential Qualifications and Experience:
1. Be a qualified physiotherapist eligible for registration to practice in country and a member of the professional organization.
2. Experience across multiple areas of physiotherapy practice will be highly valued, especially specialized in Physical Therapy for Orthopedic diseases and sport injuries.
3. Hold a PhD in physical therapy for Orthopedics, demonstrating expertise in area of specialization.
4. Showcase evidence of teaching excellence in the design, delivery, and evaluation of physiotherapy entry to practice education programs and courses.
5. Demonstrate a track record of research activity and outputs, including grants and peer-reviewed publications.
6. Possess excellent written and oral communication skills, along with strong interpersonal abilities.
7. Versatility across various physiotherapy and health content-specific teaching areas will be highly considered.
Application Instructions
Interested applicants are invited to submit their curriculum vitae including employment history, a statement outlining research and teaching interests, list of publications and names of at least three referees.
For further information, please contact the Human Resources Department on hr@giu-uni.de;

Title: Laundry Attendant
Description:
About Four Seasons
Four Seasons is powered by our people. We are a collective of individuals who crave to become better, to push ourselves to new heights and to treat each other as we wish to be treated in return. Our team members around the world create amazing experiences for our guests, residents, and partners through a commitment to luxury with genuine heart. We know that the best way to enable our people to deliver these exceptional guest experiences is through a world-class employee experience and company culture.
At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating everyone we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us or discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us.
About the location:
Seaside glamour on the Egyptian riviera; with Egyptian underpinnings and a sleek waterfront setting, our resort-style Hotel embodies modern Alexandria and its unique cosmopolitan flare. On one side, the Mediterranean Sea glistens in the sun; on the other, a dynamic metropolis buzzes with life. This stunning resort-style hotel opened in June 2007 and has a combination of classic hotel design and modern and contemporary beach suites and villas. Our hotel is connected to a shopping mall, it has 154 rooms including 31 Suites, 30 Beach Suites and 6 Villas with private pools, a private beach, a sea water infinity beach pool and a heated indoor pool, Spa and Fitness Center, and 10 food and beverage venues including an open-air 350 seat beach restaurant.
Laundry Attendant
Four Seasons Alexandria is looking for a Laundry Attendant who can sort, process and folds Rooms and F&B linens such as sheets, towels, table clothes, and napkins.
and can deal with all kinds of chemicals, taking care of all the safety measures.
What Will You Do
Sorts used linens into appropriate categories for washing. Sorts out stained or torn linen. Loads and unloads driers.
Shakes wet sheets, table linens and napkins prior to ironing in order to spread them out. Feeds washed linens into ironer. Retrieves folded linens and stacks or hangs clean linens as appropriate.
Sorts clean towels, rugs and robes. Uses towel folder and manual folding for bath towels, washcloths, rugs and robes. Places folded product on appropriate rack.
Operates and maintains folding equipment. Reports any problems or deficiencies to manager.
Complies with Four Seasonsâ€™ Category One and Category Two Work Rules and Standards of Conduct as set forth in EmPact.
Works harmoniously and professionally with co-workers and supervisors.
What Will You Bring
Reading, writing and oral proficiency in the English language.
What We Offer
Competitive Salary, wages, and a comprehensive benefits package
Excellent Training and Development opportunities
Complimentary Dry Cleaning for Employee Uniforms
Complimentary Employee Meals

Title: Salesforce QA Engineer
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Manual Testing:
- Develop and execute detailed test cases, test plans, and test scripts based on Salesforce requirements and specifications.
- Perform functional, regression, integration, and system testing of Salesforce applications.
- Document, track, and manage defects and work with development teams to resolve issues.
- Validate data integrity, workflow automation, and custom Salesforce functionalities.
- Ensure compliance with Salesforce best practices and standards.
Web Automation:
- Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for web applications using tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or similar.
- Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous quality assurance.
- Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to automation test scripts and infrastructure.
Salesforce Specific:
- Conduct end-to-end testing of Salesforce functionalities, including custom objects, workflows, triggers, and integrations.
- Validate the implementation of Salesforce customizations and configurations against business requirements.
- Work with Salesforce administrators and developers to understand system design and requirements.
Quality Assurance:
- Collaborate with business analysts, developers, and stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage and high-quality deliverables.
- Provide feedback on usability and potential areas for improvement.
- Contribute to QA process improvements and best practices. Required Skills and Qualifications:
Experience:
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in manual testing with a strong focus on Salesforce applications.
- Proven experience with web automation tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or similar.
- Demonstrated experience in testing Salesforce customizations, integrations, and data migrations.
Technical Skills:
- Proficiency in writing and executing test cases and scripts for Salesforce applications.
- Experience with Salesforce testing tools (e.g., Provar) is a plus.
- Familiarity with Salesforce data model, object schema, and configuration.
- Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python) for automation. Preferred
Qualifications:
- Experience with performance testing tools.
- Knowledge of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)

Title: Senior Nintext K2 Developer
Description:
Company Description
Founded in 1991, ASSET Technology Group is a leader in innovative software solutions for Document Management, Process Automation, and Content Management, serving over 600 clients across the Middle East and internationally. The company has established a strong presence with a team of more than 600 engineers delivering software development, support, and quality services, both offshore and on-site. Since 2004, ASSET has been creating tailored Value-Added Services (VAS) and custom software solutions for the telecommunications sector in the MENA region. With partnerships with leading tech companies like Opentext, Microsoft, and more, ASSET continues to expand regionally and internationally, driven by its focus on excellence and innovation.
Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role for a Senior Nintex K2 Developer, based in New Cairo with the flexibility of some remote work. The role involves designing, developing, and maintaining K2/Nintex solutions to meet business process automation needs. The developer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and optimize workflows. Responsibilities include creating technical documentation, ensuring system compliance, and leading the implementation of best practices in development. The role also requires mentorship of junior developers and staying updated on industry trends.
Qualifications
Proficiency in K2 Workflow, K2 SmartForms, and K2 Smart Objects development
Ability to design, develop, and implement business automation solutions using Nintex and integration tools
.net experience
Expertise in database management, SQL programming, and maintaining data integrity
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills, with experience resolving complex workflow issues
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams
Experience in software development lifecycle (SDLC) processes and agile methodologies
Knowledge of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and APIs is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
Prior experience in a similar senior-level role is highly desirable

Title: BIM Navisworks instructor
Description:
Company Description
Link Academy for Training & Consultancy is a training provider with branches in Giza, Egypt, and Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Established in 2015, Link Academy is an authorized training partner with PMI (Project Management Institute) in the USA since 2023. Specializing in online interactive courses in the engineering field, we offer customized training programs tailored to the specific needs of individuals, companies, and academic institutions.
Role Description
This is a part-time remote role for a Navisworks Instructor
at Link Academy.
The instructor will be responsible for developing and delivering online interactive courses focused on BIM Coordination using Autodesk Navisworks Manage. The role involves providing hands-on training on model aggregation, advanced clash detection, clash reporting, and the application of 4D/5D scheduling and quantification simulations.
The Instructor must ensure participants can effectively use Navisworks to streamline the project lifecycle.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related Engineering Field.
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience using Navisworks Manage specifically for BIM coordination and clash detection on complex construction projects.
Expert-level proficiency in model aggregation, model review, clash reporting, and managing schedules in Navisworks.
Strong knowledge of BIM workflows and interoperability between programs such as Revit and AutoCAD.
Experience in delivering professional training and instruction on Navisworks or other BIM coordination software, preferably in an online format, is a huge plus.
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to work remotely and independently.
Relevant certification (e.g., Autodesk Certified Professional in Navisworks) is a strong plus.

Title: Vietnamese Voice Actor - Freelance AI Trainer Project
Description:
Are you an experienced Vietnamese voice actor eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models and speech technologies are evolving rapidly, moving beyond simple interactions into expressive, human-like communication. With high-quality training data, tomorrowâ€™s AI can deliver more natural, accurate, and engaging voice experiences across education, entertainment, accessibility, and beyond. That training data begins with youâ€”your voice expertise will help power the next generation of AI.
Weâ€™re looking for a highly skilled Vietnamese voice acting professional who can bring nuance, clarity, and authenticity to training data. Youâ€™ll work with cutting-edge AI tools, record and evaluate Vietnamese speech samples, and provide expert feedback on pronunciation, tone, pacing, and emotional expression to strengthen voice models.
On a typical day, you will record scripted material, assess AI-generated outputs for linguistic accuracy and naturalness, annotate errors, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and voice design guidelines.
Fluency in Vietnamese is required, along with demonstrated experience in professional voice acting, dubbing, narration, or related performance work. Experience in training, coaching, or linguistic annotation is a plus. Clear communication skills and attention to detail are essential. A high-quality recording setupâ€”including a reliable microphone and a quiet environmentâ€”is required.
Ready to channel your Vietnamese voice expertise into building the AI voices of tomorrow? Apply today and help shape the model that will speak to millions around the world.
We offer a pay range of $6 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor youâ€™ll supply a secure computer, high-quality microphone and recording setup, and stable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.
Job title: Vietnamese Voice Acting Specialist â€“ AI Trainer
Employment type: Contract
Workplace type: Remote
Seniority level: Mid-Senior

Title: Deloitte Innovation Hub I Cyber Security I DevSecOps & Cloud Security Tech Lead, Cairo, Egypt.
Description:
Deloitte Innovation Hub
I
Cyber Security I DevSecOps & Cloud Security Tech Lead, Cairo. Egypt
Connect to your career at Deloitte.
Deloitte
,
established globally in 1845, is the worldâ€™s largest and leading professional services firm, providing Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal and Consulting and related service to public and private clients spanning multiple industries. Present in more than 150 countries, Deloitte is distinct in its ability to help clients solve their most complex problems, from strategy to implementation.
Deloitte innovation hub (DIH) is a strategic initiative/priority established by Deloitte North & South Europe (NSE) to support our ambition to become the leading business transformation partner of choice for our clients and to expand and scale our delivery footprint across EMEA. With access to a scaled, diverse, highly skilled, motivated, and engaged workforce, DIH is delivering complex technical solutions for clientsâ€™ most complex business problems, across Portfolios that include â€˜Strategy & Transactionsâ€™, â€˜Customerâ€™, â€˜Engineering, AI & Data, â€˜Enterprise, Technology & Performanceâ€™ and â€˜Cyberâ€™. DIH is aiming to become the destination for top talents in Egypt for a long, exciting career.
We invest in outstanding people of diverse talents and backgrounds and empower them to achieve more than they could elsewhere. Our work combines advice with action and integrity. We believe that when our clients and society are stronger, so are we. Our organization has grown in scale and diversity, providing services across the region, with our shared culture remaining the same. We aim to help clients realize their ambitions, make a positive difference in society, and maximize the success of our people. This drive fuels the commitment and humanity that run deep through our every action.
Connect to your opportunity.
As a
DevSecOps &
Cloud Security Tech Lead,
you can expect to be involved in the following activities:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Cloud Security Engineers with a specialization in one of the four public clouds, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services (AWS). The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the security of clientsâ€™ cloud environments, by implementing and maintaining robust security measures and monitoring systems for potential threats. This role requires deep technical expertise in cloud security best practices, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Responsibilities
Design, implement, and manage security controls, policies, and procedures for the cloud environment to safeguard against unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security risks.
Conduct regular security assessments and audits of the security environment infrastructure, identifying vulnerabilities and areas for improvement, and recommending solutions to mitigate risks.
Develop and enforce cloud security best practices and policies across the organization.
Collaborate with development and operations teams to ensure secure deployment and operation of cloud applications.
Implement native cloud security controls, such as IAM, VM, EDR, cloud security posture management to ensure appropriate access to cloud resources.
Stay current with emerging cloud security threats, technologies, and best practices.
Provide security training and guidance to team members and stakeholders on cloud security measures.
Work with regulatory bodies to ensure compliance with industry standards and Middle East regulations related to cloud security.
Manage and configure security tools and software, such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and encryption technologies, within cloud environments.
Connect To Your Skills And Professional Experience
In order to succeed in this role, you will need to match the following criteria:
Bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.
Minimum of 6 years of related experience.
Strong hands-on experience on
Three
of the below five domains:
Cloud And Container Security
Experience with AWS, Azure, GCP or OCI and demonstrable affinity with Cloud technology.
Experience with containerization: Kubernetes, Docker. Practical experience with serverless and secure development environments, infrastructure-as-code is a plus.
Knowledge of information security principles and guidelines (including CIS, MITRE ATT&CK frameworks) is an advantage.
Governance And Risk Assessment
Experience with security frameworks such as ISO, CSA and PCI.
Experience with the implementation of cloud risk frameworks and optimization of controls (in CI/CD pipelines).
Architecture And Design
Experience with Secure Cloud Architecture Design and Implementation; Design solutions for improving Cloud Security by enforcement of cloud security guardrails and standards.
Experience with architecture and security reviews, threat modelling applications, and identifying areas of risk.
Experience with encryption in-flight and at-rest practices, as well as certificate and secrets
Knowledge of network architectures, topologies, and concepts (Firewalls, LB, WAF, CDN, VPC, ACL, TLS, SSH, and DNS).
Experience with security solutions such as WAF, IPS, and anti-DDOS systems.
Experience with network / perimeter security platforms and routing protocols, OSI layers etc.
Experience implementing strategies to support secure and compliant architectures.
DevOps & Engineering
Good knowledge of application architecture (Microservices, API gateway, service mesh, message queues etc.) and technical expertise in designing controls to secure each layer within the application architecture (web layer, integration layer, backend).
Strong understanding of authentication and authorization patterns and their applicability within the development context (knowledge of Authentication / Authorization protocols and patterns, Authentication and Authorization within microservices).
Experience with infrastructure automation, infrastructure as code, automated application deployment, monitoring/telemetry, logging, reporting/dashboarding, and continuous delivery technologies.
Application Security & DevSecOps
Experience in cybersecurity principles, assessment and triage for security flaws and common vulnerabilities for web and mobile applications. Ability to understand and assess both threats and vulnerabilities, articulating these to both technical and business stakeholders.
Experience with continuous security practices, including threat modelling, threat and vulnerability management, secure coding practices, and automated penetration testing.
Understanding of the OWASP Top 10 application security risks and how to address them.
Working knowledge of the Security Development Lifecycle (SDLC), OWASP Software Assurance Maturity Model (SAMM), or Building Security in Maturity Model (BSIMM).
Understanding of web application security scanning software and related penetration testing tools such as SAST/DAST/IAST/SCA.
Understanding of service-oriented architecture, building internet-scale, distributed, and critical services.
Experience on integration & automation of various security technologies.
Preferred Certifications
Cloud Certifications by AWS/GCP/OCI/Azure.
Kubernetes Certifications
Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CCSP, AWS Certified Security â€“ Specialty, or equivalent are highly desirable.
The Following Attributes Are Essential
A willingness to work as part of a diverse team.
A commitment to continuous improvement and lifelong learning.
A passion for technology and a drive to deliver secure, high-quality solutions.
An ability to remain calm under pressure whilst continuing to pay attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Proactive and self-motivated with a keen attention to detail.
Connect to your service line â€“ Technology and Transformation
Distinctive thinking, deep expertise, and collaborative working. Thatâ€™s what connects us. Thatâ€™s what makes us Deloitte. If you want to help solve some of the biggest challenges around, join us. Together, weâ€™ll make an impact that matters.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to several audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
Connect to your Industry
â€œWhat attracted me to Deloitte were the endless opportunities and the collective experience of other like-minded individuals. Deloitteâ€™s clients include many of the worldâ€™s largest organizations; I wanted to be part of a team that made a difference that I could be proud of.â€ Dan, Consulting
Connect with your colleagues
Location: Cairo. Egypt
Your Work, Your Way: We call our hybrid working vision Deloitte Works. And it does. We trust you to make the right choices around where, when, and how you work. Youâ€™ll be able to make decisions about how you work best, to be collaborative, learn from colleagues, share your experiences, build the relationships that will fuel your career and prioritize your wellbeing. Having great conversations with your team and your leadership paves the way for great collaborative ways of working.
Our commitment to you
Making an impact is more than just what we do: itâ€™s why weâ€™re here. So we work hard to create an environment where you can experience a purpose you believe in, the freedom to be you, and the capacity to go further than ever before.
We want you. The true you. Your own strengths, perspective, and personality. So, weâ€™re nurturing a culture where everyone belongs, feels supported and heard, and is empowered to make a valuable, personal contribution. You can be sure weâ€™ll take your wellbeing seriously, too. Because itâ€™s only when youâ€™re comfortable and at your best that you can make the kind of impact you, and we, live for.
Your expertise is our capability, so weâ€™ll make sure it never stops growing. Whether itâ€™s from the complex work you do, or the people you collaborate with, youâ€™ll learn every day. Through world-class development, youâ€™ll gain invaluable technical and personal skills. Whatever your level, youâ€™ll learn how to lead.
Connect to your next step
A career at Deloitte is an opportunity to develop in any direction you choose. Join us and youâ€™ll experience a purpose you can believe in and an impact you can see. Youâ€™ll be free to bring your true self to work every day. And youâ€™ll never stop growing, whatever your level.

Job Description
The Microsoft Power Platform Developer will be responsible for developing applications using Microsoft Power Platform components. .Net (C#) and Javascript experience interacting with ODATA and REST endpoints for Dynamics 365 / Power Platform.

Other Skills:

Must be a â€œteam playerâ€ able to work with management in developing and implementing new processes and enabling systems.

Title: IPPS CF Support Engineer German Speaker (VOIS)
Description:
Who We Are
VOIS (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value for customers by delivering intelligent solutions through Talent, Technology & Transformation.
As the largest shared services organisation in the global telco industry with 30,000 FTE, our portfolio of next-generation solutions and services are designed in partnership with customers across Vodafone Group, local markets, and partner markets to simplify and drive growth. With our strategic partner Accenture, we work alongside our Vodafone customers, other Telco and tech companies to drive transformation, meet the challenges of our industry and ensure we stay relevant and resilient. This partnership is a unique, industry-first model which brings together the best of in-house and 3rd party capability.
We work with customers across 28 countries from 10 VOIS locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Spain, Turkey, UK, Germany, Ireland, and with a network of teams in Czech Republic, Italy, Greece, and Portugal.
#VOIS #BeUnrivalled #CreateTheFuture
About This Role
We are seeking a skilled professional to resolve complex and escalated technical issues related to Vodafone Germanyâ€™s fixed and TV products in a dynamic, customer-critical environment. This role involves troubleshooting, process improvement, and collaboration with internal and external teams to enhance customer experience and support services.
What Youâ€™ll Do
Act as a technical and process reference for junior incident managers
Handle long-running and complex tickets, ensuring resolution within SLA and KPI targets
Perform fault identification and resolution for Vodafone Germany customers
Collaborate with internal competence teams and third parties to resolve incidents
Manage end-to-end customer incidents from initial contact to resolution
Deliver exceptional customer experience measured by NPS and feedback
Work on a 24/7 rotational shift basis, including weekends and public holidays
Who You Are
Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience in troubleshooting and technical support for complex solutions
Advanced knowledge of fixed and TV products, including routing, switching, and IP services
Fluent in German (C1 level) and English, both written and spoken.Strong analytical and communication skills with a customer-oriented mindset
Ability to support new team members in complex scenarios
CCNA certification is preferred
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer or Telecommunications Engineering or related field
Not a perfect fit?
Concerned you may not meet every requirement? Vodafone is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are excited about this role but your experience does not align exactly with every aspect of the job description, you are encouraged to apply. You may be the right candidate for this or another opportunity, and the recruitment team will support you in exploring where your skills fit best.
What's In It For You
Opportunity to work on advanced technical solutions and cutting-edge technologies
Exposure to international markets and collaboration with global teams
Career growth through continuous learning and development programmes
A dynamic and inclusive work environment that values innovation and teamwork
What Skills You Will Learn
Advanced troubleshooting techniques for fixed and TV networks
Cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder management
Process optimisation and incident management best practices
Deep understanding of Vodafoneâ€™s product portfolio and tools
VOIS Equal Opportunity Employer Commitment
Vodafone recognises and celebrates the value of diversity in building a workforce that reflects the customers and communities it serves. No form of discrimination is tolerated. This includes, but is not limited to, discrimination based on race, colour, age, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, ethnicity, disability, religion or belief, political affiliation, trade union membership, nationality, citizenship, indigenous status, medical condition, HIV status, neurodiversity, social origin, cultural background, marital or civil partnership status, or socio-economic background.
Join Us
At Vodafone, weâ€™re working hard to build a better future. A more connected, inclusive and sustainable world. As a dynamic global community, it's our human spirit, together with technology, that empowers us to achieve this.
We challenge and innovate in order to connect people, businesses, and communities across the world. Delighting our customers and earning their loyalty drive us, and we experiment, learn fast and get it done, together.

Introduction
A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio
Your Role And Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, and support SAPUI5/Fiori applications using SAP best practices and methodologies.
Develop and extend SAP Fiori apps using SAP Fiori Elements, freestyle development, and the SAP Business Application Studio.
Create and maintain OData services for front-end and back-end integration.
Collaborate with functional analysts and business users to understand user requirements and provide tailored solutions.
Perform testing, debugging, and performance optimization of Fiori apps to ensure user satisfaction and efficient operation.
Maintain and support existing SAP Fiori apps, implementing enhancements and fixing bugs as necessary.
Stay up-to-date with SAPUI5, Fiori, and SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) trends and innovations.
Participate in code reviews, design discussions, and software development lifecycle activities, including post-deployment support.
Required Technical And Professional Expertise
4 up to 7 years of experience in SAPUI5/Fiori development.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
Proficiency in developing SAP Fiori apps, both freestyle and Fiori Elements-based.
Strong experience with SAPUI5 framework, JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
Hands-on experience with OData services and SAP Gateway.
Knowledge of SAP Business Application Studio and SAP Web IDE.
Understanding of SAP Fiori Design Guidelines and best practices for UI/UX.
Familiarity with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) concepts and deployment.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Advanced proficiency in English (speaking and writing).
Flexibility to work in different time zones.
Preferred Technical And Professional Experience
SAP certifications related to SAPUI5/Fiori or SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
Experience with RAP (Restful ABAP Programming Model).
Knowledge of integration with ABAP, HANA, and CDS views.
Exposure to Agile development methodologies.

Title: Marketing and Brand Manager - (KMG-Libya)
Description:
, permanent
Position: Marketing and Brand Manager
Company Overview:
Kasrawy Group is a leading an automotive company in the Libyan market, providing high-quality products and services in the automotive industry.
Job Overview:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Marketing and Brand Manager to join our team in Tripoli, Libya.
You will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategies to promote our brand and drive growth for our various business divisions.
This is a full-time, permanent position with opportunities for career advancement and a competitive salary package.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement marketing plans and strategies to promote the company's brand and products.
Conduct market research and analysis to identify new opportunities and trends.
Create and manage marketing budgets and measure return on investment (ROI).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute marketing campaigns across various channels (e.g. digital, print, events).
Monitor and analyze market trends and competitors to identify potential risks and opportunities.
Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including media outlets, vendors, and partners.
Responsible for developing and executing integrated marketing strategies that build brand awareness, generate qualified leads, and support sales performance across all channels.
Ensuring consistent brand positioning and effective coordination with sales, CRM, and external agencies.
Oversee the development of marketing materials, such as brochures, advertisements, and website content.
Plan and execute events and promotional activities to increase brand awareness and customer engagement.
Track and report on marketing campaign performance and make recommendations for improvement.
Stay up-to-date with industry developments and best practices to continuously improve marketing strategies.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in marketing, with at least 2 years in a managerial role.
Proven track record of developing and implementing successful marketing strategies.
Strong understanding of market research, data analysis, and budget management.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box.
Strong leadership skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Proficiency in MS Office and marketing software (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite, Google Analytics).

Title: Well Engineer
Description:
The Well Engineer is responsible for ensuring well engineering and operations support for one or more rigs or well sites. They are tasked with developing and delivering optimized technical well designs for areas of responsibility, including preparation of Well Proposals, Basis of Designs, Well Programs(i.e., Drilling, Completion, Workover), project budgets, and End of Well Reports. They perform Assistant Well Site Leader duties according to the Well Engineer Training Program development requirements. They also provide risk management project support and apply lessons learned to improve the well program and provide real-time support to the project operations as required. The position is expected to identify opportunities for continuous improvement of service delivery, well program, well operations, and formally communicate findings.
Provide technical and operational support throughout the project execution process.
Prepare well schedule, budget estimates, and project well control briefing.
Support multiple PL operations in a collaborative optimized program design.
Assist in incident response, recovery, and incident investigation.
Understand, communicate, and implement new technologies for the project.
Analyze job execution versus design and formally capture design improvements and optimization opportunities.
Participate in selection and evaluation of service companies, suppliers, and equipment.
Ensure proper communication with relevant parties (i.e., Customer, PLs, third-parties, etc.)
Participate in HARCs and other risk assessment methodology.
Forecast and plan medium- and long-term needs to meet program requirements
Anticipate operational changes and needs and revise the plan accordingly.
Manage and monitor daily operational progress (i.e., scope, time, cost and quality) versus plan and provide recommendations for improvements utilizing new technology options where appropriate.
Evaluate results versus objectives, focusing on service companies and key contractors performance.
Perform engineering studies to solve recurring well problems and initiate engineering corrective actions for continuous improvement.
Attend critical operations at the wellsite as necessary.

Title: CEO Siemens Morocco (f/m)
Description:
Siemens has been present in Morocco for more than 90 years, actively contributing to the countryâ€™s industrial and technological development. Drawing on our expertise, we support Moroccan clients in their transformation projects and in building sustainable innovation.
At the head of Siemens Morocco (part of the Lead Bundle Country Franceâ€“BeLuxâ€“Maghreb), you embody the face of the company in the country. You drive the strategy as well as the commercial development of the Digital Industries division, while bringing together all stakeholders around a shared vision. Your role is decisive in strengthening Siemensâ€™ growth, innovation, and positive impact in Morocco.
Your Main Responsibilities
You represent Siemens in Morocco with customers, partners, institutions, and the media, acting as a true ambassador of the company and its values.
You define and implement the strategy of Siemens Morocco and the Digital Industries division, in alignment with the groupâ€™s global vision while tailoring it to local specificities. A leader in the field, you foster a culture of collaboration and trust, building close and lasting relationships with our clients, while actively contributing to the development of a strong ecosystem that brings together business partners, universities, and local institutions.
You identify and develop cross-sector growth opportunities, driving innovation, competitiveness, and value creation for the company and its partners.
You ensure operational and financial performance, steering the efficiency of local organizations and ensuring rigorous resource management, in close cooperation with our CFO.
You oversee compliance with legal requirements, exemplary governance, the strict application of Compliance, and the highest standards of health and safety.
You mentor and develop local talents, creating an environment that fosters engagement, diversity, and collective excellence.
Your profile
An engineering degree combined with a strong background in the industrial sector will be key to understanding the environment and challenges you will face, as well as ensuring credibility with our technically skilled clients and prospects. You are also able to navigate with ease within a large matrix organization, bringing together diverse stakeholders around a shared vision.
You bring at least 10 to 15 years of experience in executive or senior sales leadership roles, including full P&L responsibility. These years have given you an in-depth understanding of the Moroccan market and the ability to represent a company with economic, political, and institutional stakeholdersâ€”supported by a well-established professional network in Morocco.
With a strong commercial orientation, you naturally excel in communication and negotiation.
Recognized for your leadership, you have a proven ability to unite and develop teams around a shared ambition for success.
Fluency in Arabic, French, and English is essential to succeed in this role.
Why join us?
At Siemens, you have the opportunity to shape the future of Moroccan industry by bringing forward innovative and sustainable solutions. You will thrive in a stimulating international environment, where your decisions have a direct impact on the countryâ€™s growth and on the digital transformation of its industrial players. Join us to help write the next chapter of Siemens in Morocco.

Title: Cost Controller
Description:
Job Purpose
The Cost Level II role is to work in One or Different small to medium projects, under moderate supervision and generally reports directly to the Project Manager, the Project Controls Manager or the more senior cost engineer. The Cost Engineer uses established systems and procedures to manage all or part of a project cost control function including establishing budgets, capturing commitments and expenditures, generating forecasts, and preparing analyses and reports.
Main Scope/Responsibilities
Assist during work-hour and staff forecasting with input from leads and Project Manager in different projects
Participate in Earned Value data analysis & reporting in different projects
Assist in the preparation and analysis of cost reports in different projects
Assist in the cash flow development, analysis, & reporting in different projects
Assist when conducting special cost studies and prepare analysis in different projects
Assist when forecasting the estimate to complete based on an independent analysis of progress, productivity, work remaining and current commitments
Assist in the preparation of Margin Analysis and contingency
NEFS - No Exception For Safety
Adhere to all company HSE policies and procedures.
Prioritize Health and Safety in all Work interactions as JESA value.
Never bypass safety controls or engage in unsafe practices.
Identify potential hazards in your work area and take steps to minimize risk.
Education
BA or BS or equivalent related experience
Curricula: Arts, Sciences, Finance
Global Experience
2 years minimum
Specific Experience In The Position
N/A

Title: Project Manager
Description:
Job Description Summary
As related customer equipment, facilities or infrastructure projects: responsible for project delivery, profit & loss accountability, and customer satisfaction through management of project related activities and resources. Responsible for departmental operations planning/execution or is focused on execution of
professional activities within a technical discipline.
Functions with some autonomy but guided by established policies or review of end results.
The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (quality, volume, timeliness etc.).
Job Description
Vernova Purpose
GE Vernova is accelerating the path to more reliable, affordable, and sustainable energy, while helping our customers power economies and deliver the electricity that is vital to health, safety, security, and improved quality of life. Are you excited at the opportunity to electrify and decarbonize the world?
What You Will Do
To plan, manage and deliver an entire project from transfer through to Final Acceptance (FAC) ensuring that additional business opportunities are pursued and to deliver high levels of Customer satisfaction and maximum margin/value.
At Level B, the Project Manager has the capacity of managing a medium sized Unit Project (15-20 M Euros) or a small number of similar projects. The impact of the Project(s) will have a significant effect on the Business Unit. The project(s) operate in a limited international environment or national context with existing external or Internal Customer with not more than 20 internal and main supplier interfaces.
Risks associated to the project correspond to difficult and technical risk.
Ensure good, transparent and effective reporting and deliver all documents in a timely manner so that progress can be fully communicated.
Take responsibility for all aspects of communication for an overall project.
Take responsibility for all aspects of Project Management for the overall project(s) Full
Scope management.
Take responsibility for all aspects of work package execution for the overall project(s) (M.D).
Manage the entire project scope of work.
Maximize standardization Full Time management.
Take responsibility for delivery on time for the overall project(s) Full cost management.
Take responsibility for the gross margin for the overall project(s)
Maximize profit at each phase of project Quality management
Take responsibility for all aspects of quality for the overall project(s) Full H.R management.
Responsible for organizing and deploying the Team for the overall project(s)
Structure the project and define the Organization Breakdown Structure (OBS) and interfaces.
Take responsibility for all aspects of contract management with the Customer, suppliers and partners for the overall project(s).
What You Will Bring (Basic Qualifications)
Engineering Degree from an accredited university.
7+ yearsâ€™ experience of managing small size projects value (10-20 M Euro) or work package of project.
Experience in one or several functions involved on operations: Engineering, logistic, sourcing, and field services.
(optional).
Proven track record of project improvement margin.
Willingness to work in different locations for short or medium periods worldwide
Arabic , English & French proficient.
What Will Make You Stand Out
Highly preferred experienced in our GRID business.
Project management in an international environment.
Strong personally and experience in analyzing and solving problems.
Ready to be exposed to contracting business challenges.
High soft, communication and presentation skills.
PMP Certificate would be a plus.
Additional Information
Relocation Assistance Provided:
No
This is a remote position
