Title: Relief Residential Counsellor
Description:
Who We Are
For more than 130 years, The Salvation Army has served people in need in communities across Canada and Bermuda. Building on our roots as a world-wide Christian church, each year we help more than 2 million people, providing necessities such as food, clothing and shelter. In addition, we support people experiencing unemployment, addiction and family challenges. We continually adapt and innovate to meet emerging needs and live out our mission, vision and values of hope, service, dignity and stewardship. As a faith- and values-based organization, we hire and serve people of all backgrounds and walks of life - there is a place for everyone to belong here.
Mission Statement
The Salvation Army exists to share the love of Jesus Christ, meet human needs and be a transforming influence in the communities of our world.
Job Description
POSITION PURPOSE SUMMARY:
Schedule will vary according to requirements and responsibilities â€“ evening and weekend work will be required. Shifts include a paid meal break where applicable. Supervisor will set the hours of work and work schedule. Shifts can include the following: days, afternoons, evenings, overnights, and weekends.
The Relief Residential Counsellor will plan and implement individualized, goal-centered programs for adults with developmental disabilities within all Lawson Ministries Programs. The Relief Residential Counselor will...
Promote greater independence and strive towards the highest quality of living possible.
Promote an environment and programming that is supportive and nurturing.
Ensure that the Service Userâ€™s physical needs (food, clothing, shelter) are well met. This includes cleaning of the home, as well as participation in and co-ordination of meal preparations and the provision of personal needs care as required
Assist the Service Users in meeting their emotional and psychological needs.
Being involved in the planning, implementation and evaluation of Person-directed treatment/rehabilitation plans in conjunction with Service Users, team members, other staff and professionals, as well as the evaluation of such plans.
Accountabilities
To have working knowledge of the application and maintenance of person directed plans along with policy and procedures within the Salvation Army for each person in your specific program.
To support the efforts made to meet Service Usersâ€™ spiritual needs by way of demonstrated interest and participation in programming activities where necessary.
Working co-operatively with residential and when necessary day program team members in providing co-ordinated and consistent approaches to Service Users.
To endeavour to develop strong therapeutic relationships with Service Users and their families.
Ensure the proper and accurate recording of all daily logs, shift reports, incident reports, etc. using the AIMS software.
Trained in medication dispensing. Responsible for the administration and accurate documentation of and ordering medication.
Ensure the general upkeep, cleanliness and maintenance of residence and main office.
Responsible to assist with any type of Service User emergencies that may arise during the shift.
Responsible for transportation of Service Users to and from specific destinations as required.
Demonstrate an understanding of the psychological and social dynamics of working with persons who have a developmental diagnosis and behavioural needs.
Other duties as assigned by the Program Supervisors, Program Directors, or Executive Director.
Critical Relationship Management
Governance Boards and Councils:
None
Internal
Regular interaction with Program Supervisor and other team members
Regular interaction with Service Users
External
Community Partners
Managerial/Technical Leadership Responsibility
Reports directly to: Program Supervisors or Program Directors
Direct reports for this position: None
Financial And Materials Management
Uses or maintains organization assets in accordance with established guidelines.
Does not process any financial transactions with no budget responsibilities.
Assists Service Users in management of their own personal funds.
Working Conditions
Working environment is in the Service Usersâ€™ homes in the community, the office, or as assigned all in generally agreeable conditions. Locations may vary within the Lawson Ministries community settings; this will be determined by the Program Director/Supervisor and is based on the needs of the Service Users.
Schedule may vary according to requirements of responsibilities.
This is a relief position based on relief/casual hours per week with no guarantee of hours.
The above responsibilities must be performed in keeping with The Salvation Armyâ€™s Mission, Vision and Values, in a professional manner, upholding our code of conduct.
Education, Experience, Qualifications, Certifications, Skills
Education, Qualifications and Certifications:
Completion of a formal post-secondary/college program of two academic years: Developmental Social Worker Diploma or equivalent in Human Services field.
Current First Aid & Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation with Defibrillation training required or willingness to obtain upon hiring.
Current Non Violent Physical Crisis Intervention Certification (CPI) required or willingness to obtain upon hiring.
Provide an original copy of Criminal Records Check (CRC) with vulnerable sector screening secured through either the national Canadian Police Information Centre (CPIC) or through a local police detachment; a satisfactory criminal background check is required.
Must have valid Ontario Class G or G2 Driverâ€™s license and a current Driverâ€™s Abstract.
Experience And Knowledge Requirements
A minimum of one (1) year of experience working with adults with developmental disabilities and vulnerable populations.
Medication administration training and experience is an asset.
Lift and transfer training and experience an asset.
Alternative combinations of education and experience may be considered.
Skills And Capabilities
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to lift up to 20 lbs.
Attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Strong sense of integrity and confidentiality with professional ethics and flexibility.
Ability and willingness to develop an understanding and support for the mission and purpose of The Salvation Army in Canada and its implications as related to position responsibilities
Starting Wage
$23.50/hour
Compensation
The target hiring range for this position is $21.83 to $27.29 with a maximum of $32.75.
Placement in the salary range will be based on factors such as market conditions, internal equity, and candidate experience, skills, and qualifications relevant to the role.
The Salvation Army will provide reasonable accommodation upon request. Please email
Recruitment.Accommodations@salvationarmy.ca
if you have a need for any accommodation and we will be pleased to discuss this with you.

Title: Sales Agent
Description:
INSURANCE COMPANY HIRING
JOB TITLE. SALES AGENTS
REPORT TO. AGENCY MANAGER
Role Description
The insurance Sales Agent will be responsible for engaging with potential clients, promoting and selling products or services, handling customer inquiries, and maintaining strong customer relationships. The role will involve providing detailed information about insurance products and services, meeting sales targets, and representing the organization professionally to prospective customers. Additionally, the Sales Agent will participate in training sessions to improve product knowledge and sales techniques.
Qualifications
Strong Communication and Customer Service skills to effectively interact with clients and address their needs
Proven Sales experience with a focus on executing sales strategies and achieving targets
Knowledge of Insurance products and ability to explain them clearly to clients
Experience in or willingness to participate in regular Training to enhance sales and product knowledge
High level of motivation, professionalism, and self-discipline
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing or related field advantageous.

Title: Sales Agent
Description:
COMPANY. INSURANCE AGENCY BRANCH
JOB TITLE. SALES AGENTS
REPORT TO. INSURANCE SALES MANAGER
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Sales Agent, located in Central. The insurance Sales Agent will be responsible for identifying potential customers, building relationships, generating leads, and meeting sales targets. Day-to-day activities include delivering presentations, communicating effectively with clients, providing excellent customer service, and guiding prospects through the sales process. The role also involves participating in training sessions to stay updated on products, services, and industry trends.
Qualifications
Strong Communication and Customer Service skills to build rapport and address client needs effectively
Proven Sales and Insurance experience, with the ability to meet or exceed targets
Willingness to undergo Training and continuously improve product knowledge and sales techniques
Goal-oriented mindset and the ability to work in a team environment
Proficiency in using CRM tools and other sales-related software is a plus

Title: Head of Field Marketing, EMEA
Description:
About Kinaxis
Elevate your career journey by embracing a new challenge with Kinaxis. We are experts in tech, but itâ€™s really our people who give us passion to always seek ways to do things better. As such, weâ€™re serious about your career growth and professional development, because People matter at Kinaxis.
In 1984, we started out as a team of three engineers based in Ottawa, Canada. Today, we have grown to become a global organization with over 2000 employees around the world, and support 40,000+ users in over 100 countries. As a global leader in end-to-end supply chain management, we enable supply chain excellence for all industries. We are expanding our team in Europe and around the world as we continue to innovate and revolutionize how we support our customers.
Our regional offices serve as centralized hubs where employees and customers from across Europe and the UK can come together to work towards solving some of the biggest challenges facing supply chains.
Location
This is a remote position. You can work from home and be located anywhere in the United Kingdom.
About The Team
The Head of Field Marketing EMEA, will lead the development and execution of field marketing strategy and programs across the EMEA region, with direct accountability for driving all marketing activity in EMEA while overseeing regional execution to support pipeline and revenue goals. This role is critical in raising awareness of Kinaxis, engaging with target accounts, and driving business growth in alignment with Kinaxisâ€™ go-to-market (GTM) strategy.
The individual must bring proven experience in generating leads and building trusted engagement with senior decision makers (Director, VP, and C-level executives) at enterprise target accounts across diverse markets. Familiarity with SaaS, supply chain, procurement, and/or AI-driven solutions is a strong plus.
The Field Marketing Lead, EMEA must bring not only proven executional excellence, but also an innovative mindset to test new approaches, pilot emerging channels, and experiment with creative engagement strategies that differentiate Kinaxis in a competitive market. Success will also require strong familiarity with key industry thought leaders, associations, and communities that can help fuel and extend Kinaxisâ€™ strategy across the region.
What you will do
Regional Strategy & Leadership
Drive all field marketing activity in EMEA, ensuring strong alignment with sales, customers, and partners.
Own and oversee EMEA field marketing strategy, ensuring regional alignment with sales objectives and global marketing priorities.
Adapt and localize Kinaxisâ€™ global programs to reflect market-specific buyer behaviors, cultural nuances, and competitive landscapes.
Act as the senior field marketing lead in EMEA, representing the regionâ€™s needs within the global marketing organization.
Build, scale, and manage field marketing resources across EMEA, including recruitment, mentorship, performance management, and career development, while fostering collaboration across markets.
Program Execution
Develop and deliver integrated, multi-channel marketing programs (events, digital, webinars, campaigns, account-based marketing) to generate demand and accelerate sales pipeline.
Design and execute engagement strategies specifically aimed at senior decision makers (Director, VP, and C-level executives) at target accounts, ensuring messaging and formats resonate with enterprise leadership.
Lead flagship EMEA marketing programs (executive roundtables, industry conferences, roadshows) while overseeing event and campaign execution across the region.
Plan and execute joint marketing programs with strategic partners in EMEA, including co-hosted events, campaigns, and account-based programs to expand reach and drive shared pipeline.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement
Work closely with sales leadership, business development, and alliances to build account- and partner-focused strategies that support revenue goals.
Collaborate with global marketing on messaging, content, and campaign execution while tailoring materials to resonate in EMEA markets.
Partner with the global alliances and partner marketing teams to ensure alignment of regional partner GTM programs with Kinaxisâ€™ strategic objectives.
Develop relationships with key thought leaders, analysts, and industry communities in EMEA to strengthen Kinaxisâ€™ presence and influence.
Support PR, analyst relations, and social media activities in EMEA to elevate Kinaxisâ€™ voice in the region.
Measurement & Optimization
Track, analyze, and report on program effectiveness, pipeline contribution, and ROI for EMEA.
Use data-driven insights to refine strategies and continuously improve program impact.
What we are looking for
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field (Masterâ€™s preferred).
10+ years of progressive B2B field marketing experience, including 5+ years of leadership of regional/EMEA-focused programs.
Strong experience in enterprise software/SaaS and familiarity with supply chain, procurement, or AI solutions preferred.
Proven track record of generating leads, building pipeline, and engaging senior decision makers (Director, VP, and C-level executives) at enterprise target accounts.
Demonstrated success in developing and executing integrated demand generation programs that directly impact revenue.
Experience working with strategic partners and executing joint go-to-market initiatives.
Familiarity with key industry thought leaders, associations, and communities in EMEA to drive influence and extend Kinaxisâ€™ reach.
Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills, with proven ability to influence, collaborate, and build trust across global and regional teams.
Proven ability to build, scale, and manage high-performing teams across diverse markets.
Strong project management skills with ability to balance multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency with Salesforce, Eloqua, Highspot, PowerBI, Wrike, and related marketing/sales technologies.
Data-driven mindset with experience analyzing performance metrics to guide strategy and execution.
#Senior
Work With Impact:
Our platform directly helps companies power the worldâ€™s supply chains. We see the results of what we do out in the world every dayâ€”when we see store shelves stocked, when medications are available for our loved ones, and so much more.
Work with Fortune 500 Brands:
Companies across industries trust us to help them take control of their integrated business planning and digital supply chain. Some of our customers include Lockheed Martin, Yamaha, P&G, Honda, and more.
Social Responsibility at Kinaxis:
Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Committee weighs in on hiring practices, talent assessment training materials, and mandatory training on unconscious bias and inclusion fundamentals. Sustainability is key to what we do and weâ€™re committed to net-zero operations strategy for the long term. We are involved in our communities and support causes where we can make the most impact.
People matter at Kinaxis and these are some of the perks and benefits we created for our team:
Flexible vacation and Kinaxis Days (company-wide day off on the last Friday of every month)
Flexible work options
Physical and mental well-being programs
Regularly scheduled virtual fitness classes
Mentorship programs and training and career development
Recognition programs and referral rewards
Hackathons
For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the companyâ€™s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com .
Kinaxis welcomes candidates to apply to our inclusive community. We provide accommodations upon request to ensure fairness and accessibility throughout our recruitment process for all candidates, including those with specific needs or disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please reach out to us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com. Please note that this contact information is strictly for accessibility requests and cannot be used to inquire about application statuses.
Kinaxis is committed to ensuring a fair and transparent recruitment process. We use artificial intelligence (AI) tools in the initial step of the recruitment process to compare submitted resumes against the job description, to identify candidates whose education, experience and skills most closely match the requirements of the role. After the initial screening, all subsequent decisions regarding your application, including final selection, are made by our human recruitment team. AI does not make any final hiring decisions.

Title: Verkoper
Description:
WERK MET JOUW SMAAK
Gall & Gall is al sinds 1884 dÃ© drankenspecialist van Nederland. Met 600 winkels verspreid over het hele land, is er altijd een winkel bij jou in de buurt. En iedere winkel is uniek. Met zâ€™n eigen vaste klanten, mensen die aanwaaien voor een praatje, of iemand die op zoek is naar een passende fles voor een heel bijzondere gelegenheid. Goed genieten, dat is wat we serveren. Als verkoopmedewerker of winkelmanager zorg jij dat mensen met een glimlach en het perfecte drankje naar buiten lopen.
Wat betekent dit voor jou?
Als (aankomend)Verkoper adviseer je klanten over de verschillende dranken in ons assortiment. Welke wijn bij verschillende gerechten past of welke (trendy) drankjes geschikt zijn voor een feestje. Omdat jij een liefhebber bent en graag over je hobby vertelt, gaan de klanten niet alleen de deur uit met het juiste advies en de juiste fles, maar ook met een mooie klantervaring.
Daarnaast ben je als Verkoper ook verantwoordelijk voor de uitstraling van de winkel en de afhandeling van de (online) bestellingen. Samen met je collegaâ€™s zorg je ervoor dat de acties op tijd in de winkel staan, alle schappen goed zijn aangevuld en dat de communicatiematerialen up-to-date zijn.
Wat neem je mee?
Je bent gemotiveerd om een echte klantexpert te worden.
Wij biedenâ€¦
Een goed salaris plus een winstuitkering
Flexibele werktijden
Veel verantwoordelijkheid; je mag regelmatig zelf de winkel runnen
Een afwisselend takenpakket waaronder ook voorraadbeheer en administratieve werkzaamheden
Opleidingen en (online) trainingen om een expert te worden op het gebied van dranken en verkoop
Opleiding sociale hygiÃ«ne
Ben jij iemand dieâ€¦
21 jaar of ouder is
Alles wil leren over wijn en sterke drank/spirits
Energie krijgt van het helpen en adviseren van klanten
Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou als onze nieuwe Verkoper!

Title: SERVICES OPERATOR - PROCESS
Description:
Lumwana Mining Company Is Seeking To Recruit a Highly Committed Employee For The Position Of Services Operator To Join The Versatile Process Team. We Are In Search Of An Individual Who Can Champion Barrick's DNA By
Communicating Honestly, Transparently, and Acting with Integrity
Exhibiting a Results-Driven approach
Delivering solutions that are Fit for Purpose
Dedicating themselves to Building a Sustainable Legacy
Taking Responsibility and being Accountable
Committing to Zero Harm
Cultivating strong and meaningful Partnerships
Reporting to the Services Supervisor, you will be responsible for performing and implementing operational procedures, guidelines, systems and Process services activities to maximize production and minimize costs, while ensuring operational sustainability.
Your duties will include but are not limited to the following:
Conduct routine operational inspections as per the area inspection sheet and ensure all sheets are filled in with the correct information.
conduct reagents/grinding media top ups.
Mobile equipment operations (Front end loaders, Telehandlers, forklifts, tractor loader backhoe)
Conduct fiend level risk assessment in a work area and report hazard conditions to the supervisor
Conduct Mill reline preparations, Plant start-ups and shutdowns in preparations for maintenance.
Conduct housekeeping in the workplace
Carry out any other related duties which may be assigned by the Supervisor from time to time.
To be considered for the position, you must meet the following requirements:
Full Grade 12 School Certificate
Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience in a similar role
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Must Have a minimum Class B Driverâ€™s License
Possession of a certificate to Operate any Mobile equipment is an added advantage.
What We Can Offer You
A comprehensive compensation package including bonuses and site-specific benefits.
The ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to grow and learn with industry colleagues
Access to a variety of career opportunities across the organisation

To ensure the company operates within its defined risk appetite and adheres to both internal and external regulatory standards. This role involves overseeing the quality of the credit portfolio, analyzing performance metrics to guide strategic decisions, and performing regular ECL calculations in line with IFRS. Additionally, the position requires conducting thorough risk assessments, preparing detailed reports for senior management, and fostering a risk-aware culture through training and collaboration with compliance and legal teams

Key Responsibilities
Responsible for assessing, managing and mitigating key risks (credit, operational, etc.) within YesCash.
Oversee the quality and performance of the credit portfolio
Analyze portfolio performance metrics, including loan performance, profitability, and credit risk indicators, to align product strategy, credit risk framework, and proactively support business decision-making
Perform regular monthly ECL calculations in line with IFRS and company provisioning policy, methodology and guidelines
Conduct regular risk assessments to analyze the severity and impact of identified risks; ensure follow-up actions as per prescribed guidelines and procedures
Continuously monitor risk levels and assess the effectiveness of risk management framework and controls
Prepare and present regular risk reports to senior management, highlighting key risk areas and recommending actions
Ensure that provided risk management information is accurate, timely, and reliable
Conduct risk management training sessions for employees to build a risk-aware culture within the organization
Promote awareness of risk management principles and practices throughout the company
Collaborate with compliance and legal teams

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills
Strong collaboration skills
Proficient Microsoft Office suite
Advanced Excel Skills
Proficient user of common data extraction and analysis tools â€“ SQL,

Title: Scaffolding Assessor- LEP (Fixed Term)
Description:
Job Description
Lumwana Mining Company seeks to recruit a highly committed employee for the position of
Scaffolding and Rigging Assessor - LEP (Fixed Term Contract)
to join the Project Department. We are in search of an individual who can champion Barrick's DNA by:
Communicating Honestly, Transparently, and Acting with Integrity
Exhibiting a Results-Driven approach
Delivering solutions that are Fit for Purpose
Dedicating themselves to Building a Sustainable Legacy
Taking Responsibility and being Accountable
Committing to Zero Harm
Cultivating strong and meaningful Partnerships
Reporting to the
Senior Trainer - LEP
, you will be responsible for assessing conducting competency-based assessments, evaluations, and certifications of scaffolders working within the expansion project. You will be also responsible for carrying out timely inspections.
Your duties will include but are not limited to the following:
Assess and certify scaffolders in accordance with statutory requirements, company procedures, and industry best practices.
Conduct on-the-job competency assessments, written tests, and practical evaluations of scaffold erection, modification, inspection, and dismantling.
Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and feedback to scaffolders to support skills development and safe work practices.
Maintain accurate assessment records, competency databases, and reports for compliance and audit purposes.
Liaise with supervisors, training department, and HSE team to ensure scaffolders meet competency standards before deployment.
Participate in safety audits, risk assessments, and incident investigations relating to scaffolding.
Meet with clients to determine the needs and requirements for scaffolding access and be able to understand drawings for requirements.
Develop, review, and update assessment tools, training materials, and procedures in line with evolving industry standards .
Promote a culture of safety, accountability, and continuous improvement across all scaffolding operations
Conduct thorough inspections of scaffolding and rigging materials, components, and structures to ensure compliance with health, safety, and industry standards.
Assess the condition, integrity, and suitability of scaffolding and rigging equipment before, during, and after use.
Identify faults, defects, and non-conformities in scaffolding and rigging equipment and recommend corrective actions.
Ensuring that sufficient time is spent on each project to carry out a full inspection (and that clientsâ€™ demands for unnecessary additional time is resisted).
Ensure all team members have the correct and inspected PPE, Podger, lanyards and harnesses.
Support the development of scaffoldersâ€™ career progression pathways by identifying training needs and recommending upskilling programs.
Ensure integration of scaffolding safety with other trades and departments working in the project area
To be considered for the position, you must meet the following requirements:
Full Grade Twelve (12) School Certificate
Recognized qualification in Scaffolding e.g. Advanced Scaffolder Certificate or equivalent).
Certified Assessor accreditation
Minimum Three (3) yearsâ€™ scaffolding experience in mining, heavy construction, or similar industrial environment.
Must be a TEVETA Accredited Trainer/ Assessor
Prior experience in competency-based training and assessment in a mining or project setting.
Strong knowledge of statutory requirements, mine regulations, and international scaffolding standards.
An advantage will be if the individual has a licence and can operate a forklift and/or a telehandler
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills with the ability to engage technical and non-technical audiences effectively.
What We Can Offer You
A comprehensive compensation package including bonuses and site-specific benefits.
The ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to grow and learn with industry colleagues.
Access to a variety of career opportunities across the organisation
Applicants that meet the above stated requirements are invited to submit their CVs to the Job Portal link: https://jobs.barrick.com/.
Barrick has a strong commitment to environmental, health and safety management.
Barrick offers employment opportunities to both qualified women and men.
Women who meet the above qualification are strongly encouraged to apply.

Title: ASIC Verification Engineer
Description: Responsibilities include development of test environments and tests to enable functional verification of large, multi-million gate ASICs.  Additional responsibilities include verification plan development, code coverage analysis, formal equivalency checking, and behavioral modeling.  The qualified candidate will be knowledgeable in Verilog and/or VHDL, C/C++, Java, or other programming languages. The qualified candidate will be knowledgeable in industry-standard simulators (VCS, MTI, NC-Verilog), gate-level simulation techniques, and logic debug.  Additional experience with formal verification tools, hardware design and debug, constrained-random verification techniques, and System Verilog is a plus.

Title: Loodgieter - Rotterdam
Workshop Supervisor
Description:
R0086195
Workshop Supervisor
Sandvik Mining and Rock Solutions is a global leading supplier in equipment and tools, parts, service and technical solutions for the mining and construction industries. Applications include rock drilling, rock cutting, loading, and hauling, tunnelling, and quarrying. The focus lies on bringing value to customers through high performing products that increase productivity and safety as well as to provide services and flexible maintenance programs that extend uptime and cut costs.
Sandvik Botswana is seeking a highly skilled
Workshop Supervisor
to lead and manage workshop operations, ensuring technical excellence and compliance with OEM standards. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in rock drills and mining equipment, combined with leadership skills to drive efficiency and safety
Key Responsibilities
Manage Workshop Operations â€“ Oversee daily activities including rebuilds, diagnostics, repairs, and returns.
Ensure Technical Quality â€“ Maintain OEM standards in all work performed; ensure first-time fix accuracy.
Plan and Allocate Resources â€“ Assign jobs to technicians based on skill and workload; manage shift schedules.
Monitor Job Progress and Turnaround â€“ Track job timelines to ensure timely delivery and minimize downtime.
Control Costs and Job Efficiency â€“ Manage labor, parts, and overhead to ensure cost-effective operations.
Maintain Safety and Compliance â€“ Enforce health, safety, and environmental regulations in the workshop.
Manage Inventory and Tooling â€“ Ensure availability and proper use of parts, tools, and equipment.
Lead and Develop Technicians â€“ Provide training, mentorship, and performance feedback to workshop staff.
Customer and Stakeholder Communication â€“ Liaise with clients, service advisors, and OEM representatives on job status and expectations.
Report on KPIs and Continuous Improvement â€“ Track and report key metrics; drive process improvements and corrective actions.
Profile
Qualification: National Craft Certificate (NCC) or higher in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
Experience: Minimum 8 years total experience in Sandvik equipment maintenance and workshop operations.
At least 4 yearsâ€™ hands-on experience working with rock drills such as RD535, RD1635.
General experience and training on surface drills, boom drills, pedestal drills, underground drills, and loaders.
Basic experience in servicing rock drills, axles, rotary heads, and hammers.
Proven experience in commissioning loaders, drills (underground/surface), and trucks.
Strong understanding of OEM standards, diagnostics, and rebuild processes.
Knowledge of health, safety, and environmental regulations.
Skills & Competencies
Strong Leadership and Team management skills.
Excellent problem-solving and diagnostic abilities.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
How To Apply
Please apply online through Workday (ESS), or access the Sandvik website www.home.sandvik/en/careers, reference
Applications close: 31 December 2025
We offer you an interesting role in an international business environment as well as opportunities for your professional development. At Sandvik, we believe that diversity of experience, perspective and background will lead to a better environment for our employees, our business and, thereby, our customers.

Title: Product Specialist
Description:
Location: Sandvik Botswana
Sandvik Mining and Rock Processing is a global leader in the supply of equipment, tools, services, support and technical solutions for the mining and construction industry. Responsible for providing quality technical support and for developing the technical competencies of internal and external customers

5 years post trade experience in maintaining and supporting Sandvik products or related equipment.

Title: Network Developer Specialist
Description:

Development, management and execution of country retail network plan in line with the retail business strategy. Evaluation, development, execution and administration of all retail projects.

At least 3 years working experience in retail commercial management.

Title: Commercial Supply Manager
Description:
Main Purpose:
The incumbent of this role provides an overall interface between Supply Team and the local marketing demand for Puma Energy Namibia. On the other hand, this role provides an interface between Pumaâ€™s affiliates (Trafigura PTE and Puma Energy) and their customersâ€™ demands with regard to storage and handling of transit volumes.
This role provides Fuel Supply Leadership and manages all supply relationships both internally and externally with key stakeholders throughout the supply chain.
The goal is to efficiently manage product supply chain into the country to meet the marketing demand (to meet Local Customers demand) and facilitate the growth of storage and handling of transit business accounts into one of the leading business channels of Puma Energy Namibia.
Knowledge Skills and Abilities, Key Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:
Ensures fuel Suppliers are done as per agreements/contractual terms
Maintains effective relationship with key supply chain stakeholders i.e. Namibian National Oil Company and other OMCs.
Surveyors, OMCâ€™s, Ship Agents and all Puma Namibiaâ€™s fuel supply related vendors.
Organizes monthly demand forecast and supply planning meetings with marketing team and nominating Pumaâ€™s volumes requirements.
Plans for ullage for both local and 3rd party requirements with a view to increase tank turn-around and S&H income.
Carries out fuel price & margins analysis, maintains availability of price & margin analysis updates as per regulatorâ€™s advice and/or upon receipt of new stock.
Updates contractual customers prices and new B2B / Spot deals.
Monitors daily and compiles weekly stocks progression reports.
Drives compliance towards importation regulations for both local and transit products, monitors changes and advises accordingly.
Reviews and verifies supplierâ€™s claims/Invoices, before payment.
Prepares vessel receipt advice and proration report, maintains the trail/database thereon.
Prepares and submits affiliateâ€™s Tender documents.
Working as a representative of Pumaâ€™s Trading arm.
Requirements:
Minimum Educational Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Commercial / Engineering / Quantitative studies
Minimum Prior Experience
3 â€“ 5 years of experience in fuel importation
Key Competency Areas
Supply chain management & optimization, especially fuel supply
Supply contracts administration
Business acumen, especially pricing, costing, demand & supply forecast
Excellent analytical & problem-solving ability
Demonstrate high levels of ethics and Integrity
Ability to work independently and in a team
Excellent interpersonal & communication skills
Ability to persuade and influence others, negotiation skills
Products and service Knowledge
Result oriented and customer focused
Skills:
Business Relationship Management
Pricing analysis
Computer applications
Key Relationships and Department Overview:
Internal â€“ Finance, Operations Teams, Retail, B2B, Aviation
External â€“ Government, National Oil Company and other OMCs, Trading Managers at Regional & Global offices
Industries: Oil and Gas, Financial Services, and Banking

Title: Unit Manager - Medical Ward
Description:
Mediclinic is an international private healthcare services group, founded in South Africa in 1983, with divisions in Switzerland, Southern Africa (South Africa and Namibia) and the United Arab Emirates.
The Group is focused on providing specialist-orientated, multidisciplinary services across the continuum of care in such a way that the Group will be regarded as the most respected and trusted provider of healthcare services by patients, medical practitioners, funders and regulators of healthcare in each of its markets.
MAIN PURPOSE OF JOB
The Unit Manager manages a specific nursing unit, e.g. a surgical ward, to ensure safe patient care and a positive client experience. They further manage human and other resources to ensure that staff are engaged and processes are optimised.
KEY RESPONSIBILITY AREAS
Ensure safe patient care by meeting set clinical quality standards according to company policies and procedures
Manage and mitigate clinical risks in the unit
Lead and manage the staff in the unit
Manage the unit's operational and capital expenses according to financial and budget guidelines and ensure optimal utilisation of resources
Manage and actively contribute to a positive client experience in the hospital
Support the achievement of interdepartmental outcomes
Manage key stakeholder relations
Required Education
ESSENTIAL EDUCATION:
Professional Nurse qualification, and Postgraduate Diploma in Health Services Management or an Accredited Management Qualification OR 5 years of leadership experience in a hospital, and
Postgraduate Diploma in Nursing if managing a specialist unit (e.g. Perioperative Nursing)
Desired Education
N/A
Required Experience
ESSENTIAL MINIMUM EXPERIENCE:
5 years of Professional Nurse experience in a hospital
2 years of leadership experience in a hospital
Desired Experience
N/A
Required Job Skills And Knowledge
Auditing and accreditation processes
Clinical risk management
Computer literate (Microsoft Office)
Continuous improvement and quality assurance methodologies
Financial management
Healthcare industry
Human resource processes including employee relations
Infection prevention and control
Management of staff productivity
Nursing functional knowledge
Patient complaint management
Relevant nursing legislation

Title: Enrolled Nurse / Registered nurse
Description:
Company Description
MedFit Imaging is a licensed Occupational Health Centre under Namibia's Ministry of Health and Social Services, specializing in mobile medical imaging and examinations. Through our mobile x-ray unit, we deliver on-site screenings for pneumoconiosis, transmittable diseases, and other health concerns at mines, construction sites, manufacturing facilities, and food processing companies. By offering comprehensive health examinations, we ensure compliance with occupational and public health regulations, support preventative worker health, and help companies minimize compliance costs. Our broad range of services includes chest x-rays, audiometry, spirometry, blood tests, drug tests, ECGs, and more, catering to the unique needs of various industries.
Role Description
This is a full-time remote role for an Enrolled Nurse / Registered Nurse at MedFit Imaging. The nurse will be responsible for conducting medical examinations such as blood tests, drug tests, spirometry tests, and visual/vision screening tests. Responsibilities also include supporting doctor-led physical exams, maintaining detailed patient records, and ensuring compliance with occupational and public health standards. Timely, efficient examination processes are critical, as is ensuring patients are supported and informed throughout their procedures.
Qualifications
Valid certification and licensure as an Enrolled Nurse or Registered Nurse in Namibia
Proficiency in conducting medical tests such as  spirometry, audiometry, and blood screenings
Strong attention to detail with skills in patient record-keeping and ensuring regulatory compliance
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with patients and company personnel
Ability to work independently, primarily in a mobile and remote setting
Familiarity with occupational and public health standards is a strong advantage
Flexibility to cater to high-demand workplace environments, including shift work accommodations
Previous experience in occupational health or similar roles is a plus

Title: Passenger Information Agent.INT KIA.Client Services (Airport Management)(O22201)
Description:
Job Description
The successful candidate for King Shaka International Airport will be reporting to the Supervisor Passenger Services, and will be responsible but not limited to the following:
Proactively identifying, resolving, and escalating customerâ€™s needs as and when required.
Announcing flight information
Provide support to relevant stakeholder to ensure achievement of objectives.
Participate in customer care projects and initiatives as and when required.
Build, support and maintain healthy diverse internal and external relationships to ensure the achievement of organisational goals.
Capture information for trending purposes.
Identify and escalate any system related errors.
Escalate repeated Operational non-compliance team performance meets required standards
Technical Skills And Experience
The following skills and experience are required:
National Senior Certificate (Grade 12 - NQF level 4) is essential.
1-3 years operational experience within a business is recommended.
Competencies
Basic MS Office
Achiever
Diplomatic
Conflict Management
Planning and Organising
Problem solving
Communication
Action orientated
Knowledge of Airport Operations
Shortlisted candidates will be required to provide proof of their qualifications and must be eligible for Top Security Clearance within 3 months of appointment.
Positions will be filled in line with Airports Company South Africa values and Employment Equity Policy and Plan. Should you not hear from Airports Company South Africa
Should you not hear from us within 30 days of your application, consider your application unsuccessful.
About Us
Airports Company of South Africa Limited (ACSA) is a majority (94.6%) state-owned South African airport management company. Founded in 1993, ACSA operates nine of South Africa's airports.[2] The company is headquartered at Aviation Park, Western Precinct Building, situated at O.R. Tambo International Airport in Kempton Park, Gauteng, South Africa.

Title: Junior Graphic Designer
Description:
Description
Zutari: Co-creating an engineered impact.
We co-create engineering solutions that have a positive impact and improve people's lives. Zutari values inclusion and recognises the importance of a diverse, talented workforce, believing that people need other people to succeed.
What kind of talent do we pursue?
We employ people with the right attitude and a positive mindset, who are motivated by doing the right thing, getting things done and share a sense of urgency. People who have an impact in our teams and broader community. People who think differently and connect with those around them to co-create new opportunities and leave a meaningful legacy.
The Junior Graphic Designer is responsible for creating visually engaging content that supports Zutari's business objectives and strengthens our brand identity. This role requires creativity, attention to detail, and collaboration. The Junior Graphic Designer will support the marketing and communications team by creating and editing a variety of digital and print materials.
Key Role Responsibilities
Design & Production: Create and edit a variety of digital and print materials, including social media graphics, presentations, brochures, flyers, and internal communications.
Brand Guardian: Ensure all design work aligns with the Zutari brand guidelines to maintain consistency across all platforms.
Collaboration: Work closely with the marketing, communications, and business development teams to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality visual solutions.
Content Support: Assist with the design and layout of thought leadership content, such as opinion pieces and case studies.
Project Management: Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, ensuring all deadlines are met.
Staying Updated on Design Trends and Industry Best Practices: Stay informed about the latest design trends, techniques, and technologies.
Attention to detail: Meticulousness in design execution to avoid errors and inconsistencies. Ability to understand and incorporate feedback effectively.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Graphic Design or a related field
Certifications in design software
Minimum 2-3 years of proven experience in graphic design.
Proven experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) and other applicable design software.
Skills, And Characteristics
Ms Office Proficiency: (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)
Communication skills: Ability to engage effectively with management and employees at all levels.
Understanding of Print and Digital Design Requirements
Familiarity with print production processes and specifications.
Knowledge of design requirements for various digital platforms (social media, websites, etc.).
We believe that a diverse workforce is key to our business success. We seek the best people for our jobs based on their skills, qualifications, and experience. We embrace the principle of equal opportunity in employment, and we work towards eliminating all forms of unlawful discrimination in our employment practices. In support of diversity and the equal opportunity principle, preference will be given to individuals from designated groups within South Africa.

Title: Cook/Cashier
Description:
Location
Nutrition Services
Reference #
2026-165B
Close Date
01/05/2026
Location
Nutrition Services
Reference #
2026-165B
Close Date
01/05/2026
Summary
Under the supervision of the unit manager, the cook/cashier prepares, serves and cleans up after meals. May also be assigned to assist with cashier or clerk responsibilities.
Description
Classified job is announced to all applicants. Applications must be submitted no later than Monday, January 5, 2026. Hours vary per day/176 days per year/Grade 3 $16.92 per hour (2025-2026 Support Salary Table) [Promotions result in a 5% minimum increase] JOB SUMMARY: Under the supervision of the Nutrition Services manager, the cook/cashier prepares, serves and cleans up after meals and performs cashier or clerk responsibilities. Nutrition Services has openings at the following schools in the district. (Shifts vary from 3-3.9 hours per day) - Adelaide Elementary - Bountiful Jr High - Centennial Jr High - Clearfield High - Doxey Elementary - Farmington High - Island View Elementary - Millcreek Jr High - South Weber k-2 - Syracuse Jr High - Viewmont High - West Point Jr High - Whitesides Elementary - Woods Cross High ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Prepares broad variety of foods. Weighs, cooks and portions.
Prepare vegetables (weighs, cleans, peels, cooks).
Sets up serving line, serves food and Keeps line stocked by distributing food to appropriate station.
Reports plate count figure
Records food temperatures.
Portions out condiments
Cleans up the line during, between, and after meals. Cleans and sanitizes dishes at the end of the day. Sweep and mop the kitchen.
May help record and maintain inventory.
Cashiering: Takes point of service count for lunch.
Reconciles point of service count with plate count. Sets up computers (turns on and updates) in preparation for meals. Receives pre-paid money, enters totals into computer; maintains cash drawer.
Maintains proper personal hygiene and cleanliness by washing hands and wearing and changing gloves. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
High School diploma.
Three (3) to six (6) months of experience preferred.
Food handler's permit required (Before first day of work)
Regular, on-site attendance is required to effectively collaborate, support staff/students, and maintain continuity of operations.
This position requires completion of all training requirements within the first 90 days. Continued employment is contingent upon meeting this requirement. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Ability to read and write and perform basic mathematical calculations.
Knowledge of cooking/food preparation procedures.
Ability to communicate with staff and students.
Ability to use small office equipment and computers.
Ability to accept, receive and collect payment.
Ability to maintain inventory and property. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Medium work:
Must be able to be on your feet for four consecutive hours.
Exert up to 50 pounds of force occasionally.
Exert up to 30 pounds of force frequently.
Exert up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects. This work also requires the following physical abilities in order to perform the essential job functions: balancing, climbing, crawling, crouching, feeling, fingering, grasping, handling, hearing, kneeling, lifting, mental acuity, pulling, pushing, reaching, repetitive motion, speaking, standing, stooping, talking, visual acuity and walking.

Title: Assistant Stock Accountant
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description: At Novus Print, we value the expertise and dedication of our team members. We are currently seeking an Assistant Stock Accountant to join our dynamic team. As a leading printing company, we are committed to excellence in everything we do, from delivering top-notch printing solutions to fostering a supportive and collaborative work environment. The position reports directly to the Senior Stock Accountant.

Title: Emergency Doctor
Description:
Mediclinic is an international private healthcare services group, founded in South Africa in 1983, with divisions in Switzerland, Southern Africa (South Africa and Namibia) and the United Arab Emirates.
The Group is focused on providing specialist-orientated, multidisciplinary services across the continuum of care in such a way that the Group will be regarded as the most respected and trusted provider of healthcare services by patients, medical practitioners, funders and regulators of healthcare in each of its markets.
MAIN PURPOSE OF JOB
To provide quality and safe clinical care to patients that present to the emergency centre through assessing, diagnosing, treating and disposition according to best practice standards
KEY RESPONSIBILITY AREAS
Provide quality safe clinical care in the emergency centre
Assist with teaching and co-ordinating clinical development programmes in the emergency centre to improve patient care
Adhere to and to support the nursing staff in the application of triage in the emergency centre
Actively participate in company strategies e.g. PatientsFirst@Mediclinic
Partake in emergency centre quality improvement and quality assurance initiatives to ensure safe, quality patient care is delivered at all times
Maintain a minimum standard of emergency medical care knowledge and expertise at all times
Required Education
ESSENTIAL EDUCATION:
MB BCh/MB ChB
DESIRED EDUCATION:
Dip PEC, MPhil
Required Experience
ESSENTIAL MINIMUM EXPERIENCE:
Completion of internship and community service years
DESIRED EXPERIENCE:
Previous work experience post community service year in emergency centre in private / public hospital
Required Job Skills And Knowledge
Health Professions Act No. 56 of 1974
Children's Act No. 38 of 2005
HPCSA Regulations and Guidelines on Ethical rules, regulations and policy guidelines
Advanced Trauma life Support
South African Triage Scale
Advanced Paediatric Life Support
The Charter of the Public and Private Health Sectors of the Republic of South Africa
Private healthcare industry knowledge
Mental Health Care Act No. 17 of 2002
Advanced Cardiac Life Support
Children's Amendment Act No. 41 of 2007
Basic Life Support
National Health Act No.61 of 2003
The Patients' Rights Charter

Title: LNOC Dispatcher
Description:
Company Description
Simplex Africa is a trusted staffing solutions provider dedicated to reducing costs and streamlining workforce management for businesses. With a focus on aligning skilled staff with the right opportunities, the company offers dynamic work assignments for job seekers both domestically in South Africa and internationally. Simplex Africa prides itself on connecting businesses with productive talent for sustained success.
Role Description
The LNOC Dispatcher will be responsible for monitoring and coordinating network operations, ensuring minimal downtime and efficient issue resolution. Day-to-day tasks include tracking network performance, addressing and escalating technical issues, and maintaining seamless communication between departments and clients. This is an on-site contract role based in the Johannesburg. Gauteng
Qualifications
Strong skills in network monitoring, ticketing systems, and incident management.
Experience in system troubleshooting and status reporting.
Excellent organizational, time-management, and multitasking abilities.
Strong communication, customer service, and problem-solving skills.
Technical certifications or relevant qualifications in IT or networking are a plus.
Ability to handle high-pressure situations calmly and effectively.
Ability to work shifts

Title: Customer Service Consultant (Centurion)
Description:
Recruiter:
Express Employment Professionals Midrand
Job Ref:
MR000374/TBDW
Date posted:
Thursday, December 18, 2025
Location:
Centurion, South Africa
SUMMARY:
Job Title:
Customer Service Administrative Consultant
Location:
Centurion
Remuneration:
R10 000 per month
Our client is looking for
a Customer Service Administrative Consultant
for their office in Centurion.
We require your experience in Customer Service and Administration. We are looking for a team player who will be able to be an all-rounder in the office environment.
Experience And Qualifications
Completed Matric
Customer Service and Administration work experience
2 to 4 Years of SAGE Accounting System work experience
POSITION INFO:
Duties & Responsibilities:
Attend to all phone, email, and walk-in customers in a friendly and professional manner.
Answer all phone calls and assist customers telephonically, return customer calls timeously.
Answer all tickets daily and assist customers with queries.
Create clients on the SAGE Accounting System.
Send quotes to clients and follow up daily on quotes sent.
Attend to what's up queries on the company cell phone.
Ensure that all transactions are done effectively and timeously from the date of receipt. This
includes ensuring all forms are completed correctly and the correct supporting documents are attached.
Ensure all transactions are submitted to the correct Departments.
Contact clients if transactions are returned to discuss problems with them.
Ensure tickets are closed when transactions are finalized.
Make number plates for clients if necessary.
Ensure that all outstanding money is received from clients before documents are handed to the client.
Should documents be handed to clients without full outstanding money being paid, the consultant will be held liable to pay the money.
Filing and scanning of all documents.
Booking couriers for all customers and balancing courier invoices.
Sending out outstanding invoices to clients and following up with regard to payments.
Use tickets at all times for communication, if communicating via email.
Create a ticket when working on an email and then correspond on there.
Achieving monthly sales targets.

Title: Branch Consultant/Financial Advisor - Richards Bay
Description:
Who are we?
Sanlam Developing Markets [SDM] (a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sanlam Life Limited) is one of the top financial services providers in the South African entry-level and emerging middle market. It aims to understand the unique requirements of clients and offers a wide range of simple and affordable financial solutions that cover needs such as funeral insurance, savings for education, life cover and personal accident plans. In terms of the Sanlam Group Governance Policy, SDM is managed by the SA Retail Mass cluster, which is part of the Sanlam Life and Savings cluster within the Sanlam Group. The cluster focusses on retail products, as well as group schemes.
PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
To promote Sanlam Retail Mass (SRM)â€™s products and increase market share through:
Providing sound financial advice and a high level of client service in a Branch context.
Creating opportunities for client optimisation and cross selling of value-added services.
Key Responsibilities
Sales delivery
Gain and maintain an in-depth understanding of SRM product ranges.
Gain an understanding of the customerâ€™s needs, financial goals and means, and provide the right product (or selection of products) that will satisfy the goals of the customer in the best and most affordable way possible.
Continuously update and inform customers of new products, or changes in existing products. Manage, review, and incorporate the implications of product changes on the customerâ€™s portfolio accordingly.
Validate client details in line with product and regulatory requirements. Submit new business through the right channels.
Conduct due diligence on clients to identify and flag risks.
Manage own capacity to ensure daily appointments are being prioritised while allowing time for and capitalising on walk-in / non-appointment clients.
In-branch client service and client retention
Responsible for servicing and managing all client profiles to ensure clients remain on the books.
Send payment reminders, conduct follow-ups, and remain in contact to address potential queries or to provide support.
Manage and report on NTUs (clients Not Taken Up) by putting controls in place, and taking corrective actions where required.
Manage persistency of client payments in favour of both the branch and the client.
Gain insight into client risk profiles to proactively identify where support will be required.
Consult with clients on alternative payment arrangements and ensure it gets processed through and noted on the right platforms.
Responsible for in-branch servicing in line with client experience standards:
Apply product knowledge to accurately guide clients through policy cancellations and provide alternative options.
Resolve various types of client queries in the branch as far as possible or escalate queries to the right stakeholders by using the existing escalation framework. Follow up on the status and continuously provide feedback to the client.
Quality, compliance and continuous development
Remain up to date with and continuously adhere to compliance and quality standards.
Keep up to date with own registration, product knowledge and maintenance of own CPD points.
Identify risks and flag potentially fraudulent activities.
Keep and store relevant records of advice.
Log all activities as per regulations and standard operating procedures, and provide data to relevant stakeholders to inform reporting and decision making.
Monthly planning and reporting
Responsible for reporting on activities daily, through using relevant technology platforms.
Collate data on activities to deliver on weekly and monthly reporting deadlines.
Perform any ad-hoc requirements as requested by the Retail Branch Manager.
Qualifications
Matric (Grade 12)
RE5 advantageous
FAIS Compliant (Wealth Management) as per DOFA requirements.
Class of Business training (to be completed within 12-months of employment)
Knowledge and Experience
Skills and Competencies
Personal Attributes
Business insight - Contributing independently
Decision quality - Contributing independently
Builds effective teams - Contributing independently
Plans and aligns - Contributing independently
Build a successful career with us
Weâ€™re all about building strong, lasting relationships with our employees. We know that you have hopes for your future â€“ your career, your personal development and of achieving great things. We pride ourselves in helping our employees to realise their worth. Through its five business clusters â€“ Sanlam Fintech, Sanlam Life and Savings, Sanlam Investment Group, Sanlam Allianz, Santam, as well as MiWay and the Group Office â€“ the group provides many opportunities for growth and development.
Turnaround time
The shortlisting process will only start once the application due date has been reached. The time taken to complete this process will depend on how far you progress and the availability of managers.
Our commitment to transformation
The Sanlam Group is committed to achieving transformation and embraces diversity. This commitment is what drives us to achieve a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace as we believe that these are key components to ensuring a thriving and sustainable business in South Africa. The Group's Employment Equity plan and targets will be considered as part of the selection process.

Title: Onboarding Specialist
Description:
Job Opening:
Onboarding specialist
Location: South Africa (Remote)
Hours: Monday to Friday (9-5 EST)
Pay: Monthly Salary
Overview
We are seeking a proactive and organized
Onboarding specialist
to guide new clients through a smooth and effective onboarding process. The ideal candidate has experience in onboarding, training, customer service, or other client-facing roles and is confident facilitating virtual walkthroughs, managing schedules, and supporting clients with new software
.
Key Responsibilities
Lead all onboarding calls once platform configuration is complete
Conduct initial system walk-throughs and follow-up training sessions covering schedules, workflows, and key features
Monitor client activity to ensure adoption, understanding, and correct usage
Host app rollout sessions and assist staff with mobile app setup and activation
Conduct a 1-week follow-up check-in to provide additional support and reinforce adoption
Maintain detailed notes, track client progress, and ensure all onboarding milestones are completed
Transition the account to the Client Success team once onboarding objectives are successfully met
Communicate clearly and consistently with clients and internal teams throughout the onboarding process
Requirements & Skills
Experience in onboarding, training, customer service, or client-facing support roles
Ability to conduct virtual training sessions, product demos, and platform walkthrough
Strong schedule management and administrative coordination skills
Highly organized and detail-oriented; able to track data, tasks, and deadlines accurately
Clear and professional communicator who can explain processes simply
Patient, supportive, and client-centered, capable of assisting clients at all learning level
Proactive problem-solver who follows up and addresses challenges early
Comfortable using technology and teaching software tools to clients
Strong team player with a positive, solution-oriented attitude

If you have not heard back from us within 14 days of application, please consider it as unsuccessful.

Title: Electrical Engineer
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Want to join a frontrunner in renewable energy that is actively seeking early entry into new markets globally? Since the establishment in 2007, Scatec has acquired extensive knowledge and experience in developing, building and operating solar, wind and hydro power plants and storage solutions. Driven by our company values and competent global workforce, we aim to deliver competitive and sustainable renewable energy globally; protect our environment and improve quality of life through innovative integration of technology; and create shareholder value. We are present on four continents and are headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

Currently we are looking for an
Electrical Engineer
in
Cape Town
, South Africa to be part of our global team working together towards our vision â€“
Improving our future.
As our
Electrical Engineer,
you will support the Senior Engineering team members by managing or leading assigned tasks and design activities to ensure the delivery of technically compliant projects. Additionally, you will assist in ensuring all technical and contractual requirements are considered and implemented, facilitating the successful completion of projects.
Furthermore, you will contribute to the development and operational aspects of projects by managing or leading technical assessments, investigations, due diligence studies, and design activities in support of the senior engineering team.
Main Responsibilities
Support to Structuring Phase of projects
Support in the development and establishment the technical base case and specifications of the project
Review and evaluate technical documentation and contracts (PPA, Grid Code, Connection Agreement, etc.)

Degree in Electrical / Electronical Engineering
Degree in Electromechanical Engineering organisation

Experience in PVSyst modelling
Experience in AutoCAD
Experience in Weather data sets (MN7, SolarGIS)
Exposure to High Voltage Networks and Sub-Stations
Experience in Utility Scale PV Project design and execution
Personal characteristics
It is part of every employeesâ€™ terms of reference to contribute to Scatec's vision: Improving our Future and adhere to our company values which are:
Predictable : demonstrate clear communication and listening skills, shares information in an open and honest way
Driving results: demonstrate determination, pro-activeness, can prioritise and work independently
Changemaker: demonstrate entrepreneurship, can challenge, fast learner, take initiates and adjust
Working together: demonstrate teamwork, shares responsibilities, can compromise, has a can-do attitude
We offer
Scatec is an exciting, innovative and ambitious company operating in a growing industry. We offer a challenging and interesting position where you will be part of a flexible, diverse and truly international working environment consisting of highly competent and committed colleagues with a positive drive to make a difference.
Scatec is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.
Applications will be processed on a continuous basis.

Title: Mid-Level BI Analyst
Description:
WELCOME TO MOYO
Mid-Level BI Analyst
We are looking for an experienced Mid-Level BI Analyst at our Moyo team.
Primary Duties And Responsibilities
The BI Analyst is responsible for turning data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Responsibilities include conducting full life-cycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, database development and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Required Qualifications
Tertiary degree, diploma or certificate in a related field (BSc Computer Science, B.IT or Informatics related degrees).
Experience And Knowledge
4 + yearsâ€™ working experience as a BI Reporting Analyst, Database Developer and/or Software Consultant.
Working Knowledge of Database design and Data analytics (specifically Power BI).
The ideal candidate must have at least 2 + yearsâ€™ experience in the following technologies, tools and disciplines:
Tableau and/or Power BI
MS SQL
SSRS, SSIS and SSAS
Big data: Hive, Pig, Flume, Sqoop, Uzi and Spark.
Predictive Analytics: Alteryx, Python and R.

Data analysis, design and reporting.
Update knowledge about emerging industry or technology trends.
Develop information communication procedures.
Prepare analytical reports.

Systems Analysis: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.
Complex Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

Inductive Reasoning: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).
Excellent communication skills: Ability to engage with C-level stakeholders, both verbal and non-verbal and communicate a deep understanding of the business and a broad knowledge of technology and applications.

Team Leadership: To oversee and direct development teams throughout the project development lifecycle, experience with team leadership and motivation is essential
Ability to translate strategy and strategic objectives into measurable and executable projects

Experience working on large project(s) incorporating processes and procedures and standards.
Creativity, self-confidence, and flexibility.

We seek understanding.
We make a difference.

Description

Title: Payroll and Tax Accountant
Description:
Let's Write Africa's Story Together!
Old Mutual is a firm believer in the African opportunity and our diverse talent reflects this.
Job Description
This role will be responsible to ensure accurate, timely, and compliant payroll and tax accounting for a large workforce (3,000+ employees). The role encompasses managing payroll tax reconciliations, payroll processing and accounting, and general ledger functions, while ensuring legislative and regulatory compliance. Key responsibilities include preparing and submitting EMP201 and EMP501 returns, reconciling payroll-related accounts, and supporting statutory reporting requirements. The position plays a critical role in safeguarding payroll accounting and tax accuracy, maintaining financial integrity, and enabling efficient payroll operations aligned with governance standards.
Responsibilities:
Prepare and submit EMP 201 and EMP 501 submissions and reconciliations, across five payrolls or more, accurately and on time.
Prepare PAYE, UIF, SDL, and SARS submissions accurately and timeously.
Accounting for employee share schemes, including IFRS 2 compliance, fair value calculations, and related tax implications.
Accurate recording and reconciliation of employee SARS codes across 5 payrolls or more (employees, brokers).
Point of contact for IT88 administration and reconciliation.
Update payment records on Easyfile.
Administer employee deductions for Company rental cars and annual reconciliation thereof.
Accurate and timeous processing of all Payroll reconciliations.
Clearing of outstanding items on the reconciliations and to ensure that all outstanding items are investigated, valid explanations provided for with necessary follow ups and escalations performed.
Maintain general ledger accounts and prepare journal entries for accruals and/or variances.
Ensure that where interface or bookkeeping errors have occurred the necessary provisional journals are processed to maintain financial accuracy.
Performing of the monthly bank reconciliation process and that all unknown or unaccounted for transactions are timeously and accurately posted to the relevant balance sheet, income statement and suspense/control accounts.
Tracking of Payroll Bank Account statement to ensure all transactions are cleared up and allocated accordingly.
Liaise with external departments to clear unallocated bank statement items.
Ensure the clearing of all reconciling items and control accounts.
Provide support for both internal and external audits.
Prepare payroll tax reports for management and statutory purposes
Adhering to standard accounting principles and company procedures.
Implement and maintain internal controls for payroll and tax processes.
Ensure adherence to company policies and legislative requirements.
Liaise with HR, Finance, and Tax on payroll tax matters.
Provide guidance on payroll tax queries and compliance issues
Engage with SARS to ensure matters are resolved timeously.
Act as additional support for Payroll Function (Input capturing, medical aid recon)
Perform additional duties as required to support departmental objectives.
Education
BCom degree in Accounting, Tax, or related field and/or
A National Diploma in Payroll Administration or similar qualification can be advantageous.
Professional qualification (e.g., SAPA, CPP, SAIPA, SAIT, CIMA) will be advantageous.
Experience and knowledge required:
Minimum 5 yearsâ€™ experience in payroll accounting and payroll tax administration, including PAYE, UIF, SDL and SARS submissions.
Experience with large headcount payroll (3,000+ employees).
Monthly reconciliations, year-end tax submissions, and audit support.
Hands-on experience in accounting for employee share schemes, including IFRS 2 compliance, fair value calculations, and related tax implications.
Proven ability to manage SARS reporting for share-based payments, including IRP5 coding and reconciliation of equity compensation.
Technical Skills:
Strong knowledge of payroll tax legislation and SARS requirements.
Proficiency in payroll systems (e.g., Oracle) and MS Excel.
Understanding of IFRS and tax accounting principles.
Familiarity with SARS eFiling, EMP201/EMP501 submissions, and IRP5 reconciliations.
Strong understanding of South African tax legislation and statutory requirements for payroll and share-based compensation.
Soft Skills:
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Strong Knowledge of Accounting Principles
Demonstrates a solid understanding of financial and tax accounting standards.
Accounts Reconciliation Expertise
Skilled in reconciling payroll-related accounts and resolving discrepancies accurately.
Payroll Operations Management
Proficient in end-to-end payroll processes for large employee headcount.
Analytical Problem Solving
Solving for Payroll Investigations â€“ Ability to investigate and resolve payroll variances and compliance issues effectively.
Independent and Collaborative Work Style
Works autonomously while fostering teamwork across Finance and HR functions.
Integrity and Confidentiality
Maintains high ethical standards and protects sensitive payroll and tax information.
Effective Communication Skills
Communicates clearly and professionally with internal and external stakeholders.
Planning and Organizational Ability
Prioritizes tasks, manages deadlines, and ensures timely delivery of payroll and tax obligations.
Tax and Payroll Compliance Knowledge
Ensures adherence to SARS regulations and legislative requirements for payroll tax.
The Recruitment Process:
TA Interview: This will be a discussion with a member of the Talent Acquisition Team to give you an understanding of our business, our culture & values and more context on the role. It will also allow us the opportunity to get to know you more and ensure OMI can meet your career aspirations.
Panel Interview: This will be with 2 members of the Senior Leadership of the Hiring Team and 1 member of the HC Leadership Team.
Technical & Psychometric Assessments: These will depend on the role and will sometimes happen concurrently with Vetting through an external service provider & Internal Verification.
Final Feedback.
All About OMI:

Please note that, unfortunately, we cannot accept any applications after the closing date
Skills
Accounting, Action Planning, Budget Management, Computer Literacy, Database Reporting, Data Classification, Data Compilation, Data Controls, Data Modeling, Evaluating Information, Finance, Financial Acumen, Management Reporting, Numerical Aptitude, Oral Communications, Payroll, Payroll Operations, Payroll Processing, Report Review
Competencies
Balances Stakeholders
Collaborates
Ensures Accountability
Manages Complexity
Optimizes Work Processes
Plans and Aligns
Tech Savvy
Education
Bachelor of Commerce (BCom): Accounting (Required), NQF Level 7 - Degree, Advance Diploma or Postgraduate Certificate or equivalent

29 December 2025 , 23:59

Title: Head of Enterprise (Strategy & Growth), Uber Eats SSA
Description:
About The Role
At Uber Eats, we're building the future of on-demand delivery and we're looking for a bold, strategic leader to own and grow our most important restaurant partnerships in South Africa & Kenya. As Head of Enterprise Accounts, you'll lead a high-performing team of Account Managers, driving impact at scale with some of the biggest names in the industry.
This is a high-visibility role where your leadership and commercial instincts will shape how Uber Eats grows with enterprise partners and how we deliver value to millions of eaters across South Africa & Kenya.
What You Will Do
Build trusted relationships with senior stakeholders at our most strategic partners to unlock long-term value for their business. Your team will help build joint business plans, solve shared operational problems, and advance partner priorities across our full Delivery product portfolio.
Use your analytical ability combined with operational rigor and project management skills to build processes that your team can use to drive forward partnership critical metrics effectively.
Work closely with stakeholders to deliver the best service and value to restaurant partners.
Engage closely with your peers in other countries to build common and sound strategies (regionally and globally).
Lead a hard-working team in a fast-changing environment: attract, motivate and develop a robust team of 4+ people. Build a culture where your team can thrive and where customer obsession is at the heart of everything you do.
What You Will Need
7+ years of experience in commercial leadership, enterprise partnerships, or B2B operations within a high-growth or technology-driven environment.
Proven track record of leading and developing high-performing teams, with demonstrated success in driving results across multiple markets.
Strong analytical and commercial acumen, with a data-driven approach to strategic decision-making and problem-solving.
Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets, Docs, and Slides, with the ability to derive insights and build compelling narratives from data.
Exceptional relationship-building skills, with experience managing strategic partnerships and influencing senior internal and external stakeholders.
Strategic thinker with sound business judgment, capable of prioritizing initiatives that drive maximum impact on gross bookings and long-term enterprise growth.
Cross-functional leadership capability, able to align multiple teams and stakeholders behind shared goals across South Africa and Kenya.
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred background and expertise includes: strategy consulting, business development in big tech / scale-ups and enterprise account management
Experience collaborating directly with C-level executives of major businesses is very relevant
SQL knowledge is advantageous
